loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper is a twenty-seven-year-old woman. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in demand. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a larger stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy a larger stock of clothes

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married and has one child who goes to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over ten years, Sharifa has operated a tailoring business making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as the major challenge to her business. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase cloth and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a twenty-two-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, bread, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of resources. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more drinks, bread, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to open a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more drinks, bread, sweets and other items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a widow who has toiled through thick and thin to ensure her children go to school. She is a subsistence farmer whose income cannot adequately meet these needs but with the help of loans, she started a small retail shop to supplement the farming income. She now wants a loan to pay her daughter's secondary school tuition. Jane is hard working and honest.

loans.use: pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
This is Daina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more children's clothes for her business.

Daina would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of clothes for her business. Daina looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin lives in Kampala. She is married with four children and all her children go to school.  She also has additional family members. She sells charcoal for a living. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week.  She earns additional income from selling green bananas. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 to buy bags of charcoal. Her business challenges include a lack of transportation from villages to markets. Her goal is to buy rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Amina has operated a clothes selling business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in this business. 

Amina is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 20 años y 17 años de edad y su pequeña hija de 10 años de edad. Virginia tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de queso, crema, cuajada y requesón. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Virginia desea construir el servicio sanitario dado que actualmente está construido a base de plástico por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del servicio sanitario y para encementar el piso de un cuarto dormitorio lo antes posible. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagará la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Virginia is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her two sons, aged 20 and 17 years old respectively, and her 10-year-old daughter. Virginia has been working for eight years selling cream, cheese, curd and cottage cheese. Through this work she is able to bring home an income and support her household. Virginia wants to build a bathroom in her home as the current one is made of plastic. Virginia has decided to applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to invest in building the bathroom, and to cement the floor of one bedroom as soon as possible. This loan will be used to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, and to pay labourers to build a bathroom and cement the floor of one room.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 34 años de edad, estudio solamente 4º grado, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos viven con ellos, son menores pero aun no estudian. Él es albañil y también trabaja la agricultura, trabaja de albañil desde que tenia 14 años, aprendió mientras trabajaba con su cuñado, aunque nunca ha dejado de trabajar la agricultura, trabaja en ella el tiempo libre que le queda o los fines de semana.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar material para el techo de su casa, como lamina, clavos, polines, etc. ya que viene la época lluviosa y necesita proteger a su familia. A él le gustaría que sus hijos aprendan su mismo trabajo, ya que es de albañil como ha sacado adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old and completed only up to fourth grade at school. He is married and has three children. Carlos' wife looks after the household chores. The children live at home with their parents; they are still too young to go to school. Carlos is a builder and also works in farming. He has been working as a builder for 14 years, having learned the trade while working with his brother-in-law. Carlos has always worked in farming in his spare time and at the weekends.

This loan will be used to buy material - such as laminate sheeting, purlins and nails - for the roof of his house. The rainy season is approaching and Carlos needs to protect his family. Carlos would like his children to learn his trade and, through his building work, Carlos has helped his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy material - such as laminate sheeting, purlins and nails - for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan  pertenece al banco comunal LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS, el socio tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, el socio vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso ,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the "Llapanchis Tticarisunchis" communal bank. He is 37 years old and has a partner and three children. Juan carries out his daily chores and also runs a business selling clothes. He has had the business for quite some time, and he finds it personally satisfying and he is able to make an income from it. Juan is a street vendor. He is responsible and determined. Juan wants to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

Juan has applied for this loan in order to buy hats for his business.

Juan is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy hats for his business.

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
La socia Ruth Mery  pertenece al banco comunal LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS, la socia tiene 22 años de edad  y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes productos como arroz,azucar,leche ,golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio e cual le va trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth Mery is a member of the "Llapanchis Tticarisunchis" communal bank. She is 22 years old and has a partner. As well as carrying out her daily chores, Ruth has a grocery store where she sells a variety of products, including rice, sugar, milk and sweets. Ruth has had the business for quite some time and she is satisfied with it both personally and in that it provides her with an income. Ruth also delivers to customers who request it. Ruth wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Ruth has applied for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar and other items.

Ruth is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and more.

loans.name: Lissette Isabel

texts.es: Lissette tiene 28 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida, quien es agricultor, y junto a su hija de 3 años de edad. Lissette trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida dan a sus hijos lo necesario. Con mucho esfuerzo han logrado levantar su casa con  material más resistente y por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado colocar el techo a la misma por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, tornillos y mano de obra.
texts.en: Lissette is 28 years old, and she lives with her partner, who is a farmer, and their three-year-old daughter. Lissette works as an employee in a local business and has for some time. This is how she helps pay the household expenses, and, along with her partner, they provide their children with what they need. Through a great deal of hard work, they have built a house from more durable material. However, they haven't had the financial resources to add a roof to it. That's why they have come to FUSAI for a loan, which they will invest in the purchase of corrugated steel, support girders, screws, and manual labor.

loans.use: buy the materials and labor she needs to build a roof on her home.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo  “Las Azucenas” es un grupo responsable que han demostrado ser solidarios entre ellos,  la cual está conformada por 07 mujeres trabajadoras. Este es el caso de Julia de 47 años, separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 16 años que Julia se dedica a la venta y confeccion de prendas de vestir. Tiene el deseo de seguir mejorando su negocio cada dia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y botones. Los integrantes del grupo “Las Azucenas” estan agradecidos con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Julia se encuentra de pie es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo plomo.
texts.en:
This is the “Las Azucenas” (The Lilies) group. They are a responsible group who have demonstrated solidarity amongst themselves and are formed of 07 working women.

This is the story of Julia who is 47 years old and separated from her husband, with 03 children who are dependent on her. Julia makes and sells clothing. Her wish is to keep bettering her business every single day. She has asked for this loan to buy fabric, thread and buttons. The members of "Las Azucenas" are grateful to the people who make this loan possible. Julia is standing up in the photo and is the second from the right, wearing a plum fleece.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, charcoal and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, "gari" and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 26 años, trabaja como vigilante para una empresa de seguridad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante  y poder solventar los gastos de su familia.

Oscar esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la compra de una cama, ya que actualmente la que posee es de fierro, los cuales ya están oxidados, así el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en: Oscar is 26 years old. He works as a guard for a security company, which earns him enough money to get ahead and to be able to meet his family's expenses.   Oscar is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy a new bed. The one he currently has is made of iron and it's all rusted out. This will help him improve his quality of life so that he can keep working and keep fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: Improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy a bed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hens and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS, la socia tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente , la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio e cual le va trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solictan,a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de cerveza, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the community bank Llapanchis Tticarisunchis. She is 35 years old and has a live-in partner. Irma alternates her daily work between two businesses. One of her businesses is selling clothing, which she's done for quite some time. It brings her both personal and economic satisfaction. She travels to her customers. Her other line of work is selling beer. She hopes to be able to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

Irma is requesting this line of credit to purchase beer for her business. She is pleased with the credit she has been offered and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy beer for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 31-year-old married woman. She describes herself as principled. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in  a nice place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to open more shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as committed. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a reliable location. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a single man. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a populated place, and his primary customers are frequent. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. 

His business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Giseke +Buteka G2 Group

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 36. He is a father of three children between 6 and 15. 

He will use his portion of the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Migogo G7 Group

texts.en:
Aimable is 36 years old. He is a father of four children. 

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

Aimable is the group leader. To be identifiable from his group-mates, he decided to hold a red file as a sign of identifying him from the others.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi Muduha Gishubi G6 Group

texts.en:
Felix is 30 years old. He is married and has two children and his wife works as a farmer as well. 

Felix is the leader of the group. In the photo, he is holding a red file.

He will use his portion of the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk and maize flour and renovate her food stall. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk and maize flour and renovate her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María, es soltera, vive con su hija quien es independiente, aprendió dentro de su familia a elaborar y vender tamales de elote, nuégados, chilate, entre otros antojitos, es así como desde hace cinco años cuenta con su propio negocio. La venta la elabora sola.
El capital que solicita será utilizado para comprar elotes, yuca, maíz, leña y un perol, de esta manera tendrá de forma inmediata los  ingredientes para elaborar la venta, aumentara la producción y agilizara los procesos.
Su visión es seguir trabajando para tener los recursos económicos para salir adelante y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
María, a single woman, lives with her daughter, who is independent. She learned from her family how to make and sell traditional Salvadorean foods, including sweet corn tamales, nuégados (a fried pastry treat), chilate (a thick, sweet corn flour drink that is nearly a meal in itself), and other snacks. She has five years of experience since she started her business, and she works alone.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweet corn, yucca, corn, firewood, and a saucepan. That way she will have the ingredients on hand that she needs to make her foods. She can expand production and make her process run more smoothly.  

Her vision for the future is to keep working and to have the economic resources to get ahead and pay off her debt.

loans.use: buy ingredients and supplies for her production of traditional foods.

loans.name: Nora Griselda

texts.es:
Nora, es propietaria de una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, ya tiene diez años realizando dicha actividad y lo aprendió de su madre, de esta manera genera los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares, vive junto a sus tres hijas de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad.
Solicita un crédito con el que comprara huevos, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, pan, galletas, dulces, jabón, boquitas, azúcar, sal,  etc., le permitirá aumentar los productos de su negocio para competir en el mercado, espera mejorar su situación financiera.
Para Nora es importante mantener su negocio funcionando con lo que ahorrara lo suficiente para darle a sus una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Nora has been the owner of a corner store for ten years. She learned about the work from her mother, and it is how she earns money to pay for her family's needs. She lives with her three daughters aged 5, 3, and 2. 

Nora is seeking a loan to buy eggs, oil, soft drinks, juice, bread, cookies, candy, soap, snacks, sugar, salt etc. These purchases will enable her to increase the stock in her store and be more competitive. She hopes to improve her financial situation.

It is important to Nora to have a well-run business so she can save enough money to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy eggs, oil, soft drinks, juice, bread, cookies, candy, soap, snacks, sugar, salt etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as kind. 

He operates a retail business where he sells movies in DVDs. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of security. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a TV decoder for business use. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a TV decoder.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn earns a living from buying and selling coconuts while her husband works as a security guard. For three years, Jocelyn has earned well and improved the business. Her earnings go toward her children's education costs. To add more stock, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more coconuts to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of improving their house and providing better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Mirian Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Mirian Matilde tiene 39 años de edad ,tiene 02 hijos ella y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de velas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de velas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
39-year old Mirian Matilde is single and has two children. She combines her daily chores with her work selling candles, a job she's had for many years. It brings her much economic and personal satisfaction. 

Mirian is a responsible and hardworking person who wishes to continue with her work so she can support her family. She is seeking a loan to buy more candles for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back.

loans.use: Buy candles for her business

loans.name: Redes De Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
Basilia is the coordinator of her group "Redes de Amor 1". Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This group is composed of five women running different businesses like shoes, clothing, cosmetics, underwear and many other small businesses. Basilia plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing jewelry (stainless, silver and gold).

Basilia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza, and she will uses this loan to increase her inventory. She will uses her profits to reinvest in her business. She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 44-year-old married man. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a transport business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of security.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 31-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as optimistic. 

He operates a transport business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located In a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to open a grocery store for his wife. His business goal is to own two other motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a tuk tuk. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to open a grocery store for his wife.

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi Nyankono2+Ruhabyo G10 Group

texts.en:
Aloys is 52 years old. He is married with four children. He has been a farmer for the past twenty years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and purchase fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Arlinda to improve her business. She is married and she has a business where many people come to buy every day. She sells chickens. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Arlinda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a second-hand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  shirts, trousers, shorts, etc. She opened her second-hand clothing business a year ago with her own working capital of $400.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long-sleeved and short-sleeved clothing

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Marco Antonio pertenece al banco comunal LLAPANCHIS TTICARISUNCHIS, el socio tiene 38 años y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando sus servicios de maestro de obra, él socio  lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, el socio trabaja para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso ,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para realizar el mejoramiento de su casa.
El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a member of the community bank Llapanchis Tticarisunchis. He is 38 years old and has a live-in partner.  He varies his daily work, providing services as a construction foreman. He has quite a bit of experience in this work, and it bring him both personal an economic satisfaction.  He works on various jobs that had requested his services. He is a responsible and enterprising person; he hopes to continue working so that he can keep supporting his family.

Marco Antonio is requesting this loan so that he can improve his house. He is pleased with the credit he has been offered and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: improve his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments and fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beauty products, salt, and soaps

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 01 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Tuất has a vegetable stall. She wants to purchase more vegetables to resell. Tuất is 57 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 01 Quảng đại solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Tuất joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuất has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuất has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuất hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hanin** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hanin**. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB.

Hana'a is the leader of the group. She is a 33-year-old widow with two children. Her older child is 13 years old and the younger one is 7 years old. She studied till secondary school, but she got married when she was very young. 

In her kitchen, Hana'a has a very old refrigerator. It doesn't work very well. Hana'a needs to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition. But she doesn't have enough money to purchase a new refrigerator. For this reason, Hana'a asked a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase e new refrigerator for the home.

Hana'a looks forward to purchasing all home appliances in order to make her house more comfortable. Hana'a hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase e new refrigerator for the home.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Every effort must have ups and downs along the way. And that’s what happened with the Triwana Sari Group. There was a member who succeeded in raising pigs and decided to continue the business with their own capital. But there’s also a member who couldn’t reach their goal because their pigs got sick and the growth wasn’t maximal.

Ni Komang earned less profit [than expected] from the last loan. It’s because her pigs wouldn’t eat because of sickness. But, fortunately, she sold them all. The profit fulfilled the need for a kitchen, paid the electricity and water bills, and also went toward savings. She’s very happy for all that although [profit was] not as expected. She is requesting a new loan to continue her business.

The Triwana Sari Group feels grateful, because they're still trusted to receive a new loan especially for the pig program. They say they still need a loan until they have enough savings to continue the business by themselves. The loan use is for increasing the population of pigs, purchasing feed, and also renovating the pen. Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets only. She will buy feed with her own money to combine with the traditional feed she can get from her garden. She hopes this time the pigs will grow healthy, free from diseases and get fat. For that, she will always have contact with the vet and give the pigs nutritious feed and vitamins. With more profit, she hopes she can improve her savings.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: 03 Bắc Hải _ Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Lý is 48 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Lý is the group leader of the 03 Bắc Hải _ Hoằng Phong solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
Lý lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lý has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future Lý hopes for her children to find a good job, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more  baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Vui

texts.en:
Vui is 56 years old and she is married with three children. Vui lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Vui works in agriculture growing industrial crops. Vui has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main harship that Vui faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. 

Vui is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a water tank. This is Vui's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Vui hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a water tank

loans.name: Amen Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMEN est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Aimée Séverine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 51 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Aimée Séverine ne vit plus avec son mari. Aimée Séverine a un enfant, scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Aimée Séverine vit seule avec son enfant.  Les diverses charges familiales sont assumées par Aimée Séverine. C’est pour cette raison que, Aimée Séverine vend de la nourriture (de la pâte de maïs, du riz accompagnés de sauce et  de l’igname) à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Aimée Séverine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Aimée Séverine ensemble avec les membres du groupe AMEN désire obtenir un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AMEN is composed of three persons, whose members are friends. The group representative, Aimée Séverine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 51 years old and did not attend school. She no longer lives with her husband. Aimée Séverine has one chld, who is in school and in her care. 

Aimée Séverine lives alone with her child. The diverse family expenses are covered by her. For this reason, she has been selling food (polenta or rice served with sauce; and yams) out of her house for four years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Aimée Séverine along with the members of the group AMEN wish to obtain financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, corn, and yams

loans.name: Resailyn

texts.en:
Resailyn is 32 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Resailyn has a business selling cakes and pastries. She earns about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work.

Resailyn has a requested a loan for additional capital for her business to pay for sacks of flour and other baking ingredients.

Resailyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Resailyn would like to expand her business and give more financial support to her two children.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of flour and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
One week before payments were due, Ni Made as the group head, informed the members of the Naga Tegal Wangi group to prepare for their payments. The group had already sold their pigs to make their payments on time. All the members of the group were very satisfied with the result. They earned a profit which fulfilled their needs. Ni Made sold her 3 pigs for 4.500.000 IDR and she earned a net profit of 1.000.000 IDR. She’s very happy for that. The group and Ni Made asked for a new loan and they hoped for a lower interest rate.
The group received a new loan of 15.000.000 IDR and Ni Made received 1.500.000 IDR. She will use her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and superior feed. Now she has a sow. She hopes the sow will produce piglets during this period of the loan. She will sell the piglets when they are older to pay for the loan.
The group still expects to receive additional business training and visitations by the Vet on a regular basis to make sure their business is run well and to prevent the pigs from becoming diseased.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and superior feed

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
The Marga Damai group made their payment of 15,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) on time. The payment was represented by the head of the group, Ni Ketut. Ni Ketut told us each member now has two sows, and at the last period, the sows gave birth to 8–10 piglets. They keep them for three months, and then sell them to the big buyer. With the money they earn, they can pay the loan, fulfill the family needs and set some aside for saving.

The Marga Damai group decide to continue their loan. With good marketing, they are confident to establish their group as the piglets seller group because all of them already have sows. The loan use is to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages to accommodate the piglets.

Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior feed to make sure the piglets grow healthy and fat. The good quality piglets are easier to sell. The Marga Damai group keeps their quality to produce superior quality piglets, and they can give a guarantee for that. Ni Ketut and the Marga Damai group hopes their businesses will growing rapidly and make happiness for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Sra. Natividad  de 53 años de edad casada  y madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, la Sra. Natividad es una mujer muy emprendedora, gracias  a sus esfuerzos ha sabido superarse con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos , la Sra. Natividad   tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa a pedido, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros  y así generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener más ingresos económicos y poder salir adelante. La Sra. Natividad  es la tercera persona esta parada para la mano derecha al costado del caballero se le distingue por su chompa blanca y sus anteojos, ah la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva, sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Natividad is 53 years old, married, and has two adult children.  She is a very enterprising woman.  Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to succeed with the support of her husband and children.  Natividad has a small business that sells clothing by order.  It is the only source of income for her and her family.  

With this loan, she will purchase women's and men's clothing to sell, which will generate profits.  She will be able to have more revenue and be able to move forward.  

Natividad is the third person standing from the right side, next to the man.  She is wearing a white sweater and glasses.  She is very grateful for the help provided.  She finishes with a big hug to Kiva, knowing that she will achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Gotitas De Amor” conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas, que cada día luchan por salir adelante con el único propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de Judith que se dedica a la venta de comida como el lomo saltado. Comenzó hace mas de 05 años donde todo le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de contar con un local para poder vender diversos platos típicos de la zona. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, papa, carne y pescado. Judith de 41 años es separada y tiene 03 hijos dependientes.  El grupo “Gotitas De Amor” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Judith  es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca de color verde limón
texts.en:
The Gotitas De Amor community bank is made up of 7 enterprising and committed women, who fight every day to succeed, with the sole intention of caring for the well-being of their families.  This is the case for Judith, who works selling food, including lomo saltado (beef stir fry).  She started more than 5 years ago and it is going well.  Her biggest hope is to have a store where she can sell a variety of typical dishes.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, potatoes, meat, and fish.  Judith is 41 years old, separated, and has three dependent children.  

The Gotitas De Amor group is grateful for the people who make this loan possible.  Judith is the first one on the right side, dressed in a bright green jacket.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, meat, and fish.

loans.name: 03 Thôn Trung Triều _Hoàng Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 32 years old and she is married with 1 child
Hiền is the group leader of the 03 Thôn Trung Triều Hoàng Phongsolidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013 Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her child to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn and fish

loans.name: 06.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Ngân is 22 years old and she is married with 1 child
Ngân is the group leader of the 06.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngân has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Ngân has been involved in this business for 2 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture growing industrial crops.

Hương is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hương supports 2 dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to a build toilet and bath-room.

In the future, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to a build toilet and bath-room

loans.name: Thạo

texts.en:
Thạo is 49 years old and she is married with two children. Thạo lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thạo works in agriculture growing industrial crops. Thạo has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Thạo faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine.

Thạo is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room. This is Thạo's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

In the future, Thạo hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: 93 Thắng Lộc - Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà has a general store selling sweets, cake, milk, soap, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (sweets, cake, milk, etc.) and resell them.

Hà is 26 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 93 Thắng Lộc - Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for seven years.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Hà hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (soap, sweets, cake, milk, etc.) to resell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie  is 54 years of age and a resident of Bita-ug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married.  They do hog raising from which to earn a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they have realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Elsie and her husband work hard at selling their pigs at the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their pigs and piglets. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business.  They have requested  a Php 13,000 loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional feed and piglets. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future.  Elsie smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: 02 Thắng Lộc - Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điều has a general store selling soap, milk, cake, sweets, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (soap, milk, cake, sweets, etc.) to resell. Điều is 48 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 02 Thắng Lộc - Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Điều's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Điều has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Điều faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Điều hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (soap, milk, cake, sweets, etc.) to resell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family will always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is from  Bita-ug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She  is 61 years old and is married.

In 2012, Dolores applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Dolores is asking for financial assistance of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional feed and piglets for her hog raising activity. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and to expand her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 49 years old and she is married with two children. Hà lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hà works in agriculture growing industrial crops. Hà has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Hà first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW).

In the future, Hà hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Reina Victoria

texts.es: Reina tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad. Reina es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad dado que gracias a su integridad muchas personas dan buenas referencias. Reina y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, cultivan maíz, frijol y ayotes desde hace mucho tiempo. Reina solicita este crédito a FUSIA dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y construir paredes para cerrar la cocina la cual tiene al aire libre. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Reina is 56 years of age and lives in her own house with her husband and her son, who is already grown. Reina is a well-known woman in her community. Thanks to her integrity, many people give her good references. Reina and her husband are farmers who have cultivated corn, beans, and pumpkins for a long time.

Reina is requesting this loan through FUSIA in order to repair the roof of her home and to construct walls to close in her kitchen, which stands at present in the open air. With the amount solicited, she will purchase galvanized laminated sheets, bricks, cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized iron sheets, bricks, cement, and sand to repair the roof of her home and to construct walls to enclose her kitchen.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en: Chhunly is 22 years old. He is a student who lives at Pursat Province, Cambodia. Now he would like to apply for loan of $1,925 to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him get a higher education. In the future he hopes that he can get a good job with a good salary and he can have his own house.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans Le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Fernandine Maximine(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 47 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Fernandine Maximine est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Ange. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Fernandine Maximine vit seule avec son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Fernandine Maximine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Fernandine Maximine vend des tissus par la technique de distribution depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Fernandine Maximine vend aussi du riz et des ustensiles de cuisine. Fernandine Maximine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Fernandine Maximine ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFONSI désire obtenir un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
FIFONSI is a group composed of three persons, whose members reside in the same district. The group representative, Fernandine Maximine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 47 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a refrigeration specialist named Ange. The couple have one child, who is in school and in their care. 

Fernandine Maximine lives her child. The diverse family expenses are covered by her and her husband. For this reason, she has been selling fabrics by the distribution method for eight years. And she also sells rice and kitchen utensils. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Fernandine Maximine along with the members of the group FIFONSI wish to obtain financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Thôn 8- Hoằng Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Ngân is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Ngân is the group leader of the Thôn 8- Hoằng Thịnh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
Thoa lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngân has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Missite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSITE est composé de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans Le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Cica (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 42 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Cica est mariée à un certain Aurelien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Cica vend du maïs depuis huit ans environ. Cica s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Cica ensemble avec les membres du groupe MISSITE sollicite un appui financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Missite Group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  Cica (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 42 years old and did not attend school much.  Cica is married to Aurelien and the couple have four children, some of whom currently attend school.  Between them, the couple provide for the expenses of their household.

Cica has been selling maize for around eight years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

Cica and the other group members would like to build their businesses and be able to respond to the demands of their customers.  This is why they have requested this loan from the field partner, Alidé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: 03.8. Thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hỡi has a retail business selling electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase more electronic devices to resell

Hỡi is 49 years old and she is married with 1 child
Hỡi is the group leader of the 03.8. Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hỡi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hỡi has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hỡi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hỡi hopes to make enough money to provide for her child, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic devices to resell

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: MAHOUTIN est un groupe est composé de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans Le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Pierrette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 30 ans est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Esaï. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge.  Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple.  Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille Pierrette vend du poisson de mer depuis huit ans environ. De façon de façon secondaire, Pierrette vend également des pâtes alimentaires. Pierrette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Pierrette ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUTIN désire obtenir un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
MAHOUTIN is a group composed of five persons, whose members reside in the same district. The group representative, Pierrette (with her hand raised in the photo), is 30 years old and married to a fisherman named Esaï. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. 

Pierrette lives together with her husband and children. The diverse family expenses are covered by the couple. To meet family needs, she has been selling ocean fish for eight years. On the side, she also sells pasta. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Pierrette along with the members of the group MAHOUTIN wish to obtain financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase ocean fish and pasta

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en: To earn a living Maylin owns and operates a service business, which is laminating pictures for the local community. She has been in business for eight years and earns a good income that meets their needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. To improve her orders, she took a new loan to purchase additional materials for laminating pictures. She also started selling cosmetic products in addition to her lamination service. Her hope and dream is to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for laminating pictures

loans.name: Nhóm 1 Thôn 7 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiến is the group leader of the Nhóm 1 thôn 7 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.

Chiến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Chiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase feed for cattle. The main hardship that Chiến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Chiến is 52 years old and she is married with no children. Chiến lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

 In 2014, Chiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chiến has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Chiến hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: 88 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuyên is the group leader of the 88 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.

Chuyên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Chuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Chuyên is 58 years old and she is married with 6 children. Chuyên lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Chuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chuyên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Chuyên hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Diễn

texts.en:
Diễn is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Diễn has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. Diễn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Diễn hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

In 2012, Diễn  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Diễn has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Diễn is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Eba

texts.en: Eba  owns and operates a fishing business, primarily fishing and selling seafood to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for many years in order to augment their living. She sells fish in their village and her husband does the fishing.  Recently she took a new loan to buy new fishing nets. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miriam dreams to have another store and hopes to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio lives in Plaridel Misamis, Occidental. He earns income through making and selling woven amakan to support the needs of his six children. He has been doing this for many years. He earns a sufficient income to sustain their daily expenditures. Rogelio successfully repaid his previous loan used in this business.

To buy additional raw materials for amakan making, Rogelio took a new loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for amakan making

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 40, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Emilio, a community counselor.   She and her partner work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Susan hopes to have more customers and dreams of having their house renovated.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Dorena

texts.en:
Dorena is 28 years old, married and mother of two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dorena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dorena requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Dorena has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Dorena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her child’s university fees

loans.name: Bookku Khoole 2 Group

texts.fr:
Bookku Khoole est le nom d’un groupement qui se traduit en français par « le même cœur ou partager le cœur » pour montrer comment ils sont soudés et unis. Le groupe rassemble cinq membres toute des femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce depuis des années.
Leur présidente, la dame Ndèye Ndiémé, vend divers produits alimentaires comme du pain de singe, du « bissap » appelé oseille et autres produits qu’elle peut vendre et qui est susceptible de générer un bénéfice. Cela fait maintenant plus de 10 ans qu’elle est active. Madame Ndèye Ndiémé a démarré son activité avec ses propres moyens, on la reconnait sur la photo habillée en grand boubou blanc et 2ème à partir de la droite. Mariée et mère d’une famille nombreuse, elle épaule son mari dans les charges de la famille.
Elle a comme ambition d’aider ses enfants les plus âgés à avoir une activité qui leur permettra de se prendre en charge, mais aussi de prendre la relève dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne puisque elle et son époux prennent de l’âge.
texts.en:
Bookku Khoole is a name that means 'with one heart', this demonstrates the strength of the union of the group members.  The five women members have all been working in retail for many years.  Their president is Ndèye Ndiémé (seen in the photo wearing a white robe, and standing second from the left), and she has been selling various food products, such as baobab fruit, hibiscus flower (known as oseille) and anything else that is likely to generate a profit, for more than ten years.  She started her business with funds that she provided herself.

Ndèye Ndiémé is married and has a large family.  She helps her husband to provide for the expenses of their household.  Her ambition is to help her eldest children to establish businesses for themselves and become independent.  She would also like to help out more with the day-to-day expenses of her household as both she and her husband are advancing in age.

loans.use: to buy food products, fabric and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: AÏDOTE est un groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans Le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Fifamè Hermine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 37 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fifamè Hermine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Jean. Le couple a deux enfants, qui ne sont pas scolarisés mais tous à leur charge. Fifamè Hermine vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins, Fifamè Hermine vend de la bouillie à base de maïs, et de mil accompagnée de lait depuis trois ans dans sa région. Fifamè Hermine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Afiavi Justine ensemble avec les membres du groupe AÏDOTE désire obtenir un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Aïdote Group is made up of three members who all live in the same neighbourhood.  

Fifamè Hermine (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 37 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school.  Fifamè Hermine is married to a driver called Jean.  The couple have two children, neither of whom attend school.  Fifamè Hermine lives alone with her children but the household expenses are provided for by both her and her husband.  In order to provide for these expenses, she has been selling a maize and millet based porridge, accompanied by milk, locally for three years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

Fifamè Hermine and the other members of the group would like to build their businesses in order to be able to satisfy the demands of their customers.  This is why they have requested a loan from the field partner, Alidé.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet and milk for resale.

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en: Sarah Jean graduated from her college this year. Her previous loans helped to pay her school tuition fees. Sarah Jean is thankful to GDMPC for this as this is a big help to students who wants to become successful. Currently she took a new loan, which she used to pay the review costs for the coming licence examination. she is hoping to have a brighter future that will help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay the review costs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with 6 children. Erlinda is 60 years old and lives in Situbo, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Erlinda operates her own sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy more basic needs items to restock her store to sell.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future,Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more basic needs items to restock her store to sell

loans.name: Brinda

texts.en: Brinda is 33 years old, married and the mother of two school-aged children who lives in Tamban, Punta Miray, Baliangao. She earns a living by running a grocery store where she earns a monthly income of PHP 6,000.  She has been in this line of work for almost four years, and joined Paglaum because she wanted to increase the income she earns from her store. She has requested this loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as rice, canned goods, oil and sugar. She will save the additional profits she earns from her business in order to prepare for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to restock grocery store.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN ont en moyenne 50 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN /SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers, les céréales  et des condiments.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire. SENE 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 carton d’eau javel, 30Kg de sucre, 20 paquets de bonbon  et 2 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Fotemogoban Group are, on average, 50 years old and have five children.  They all live in traditional, extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and all work buying and selling various products, cereals and food ingredients.

This will be the group's sixth loan, all the previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

Sene (standing on the far left of the photo) plans to use her loan to buy one box of bleach, 30 kg of sugar, 20 packets of sweets and two boxes of soap.  She buys her products locally from wholesalers, and sells them to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  She expects to make an average monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, food, clothing and school fees.  The rest of her profit will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Mercylinda

texts.en:
This is Mercylinda, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a production specialist, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercylinda operates a vegetable stall. She sells different kinds of vegetables near their house. She buys a quantity of vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables to expand her product inventory.

Mercylinda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
