* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of vegetables to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUSMANE né en 1984 à LOULOUNI cercle de KADIOLO, marié il vit  avec son épouse à LOULOUNI  un arrondissement dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur OUSMANE n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, s’est initié il y a six ans aux activités d’achat et de vente  des marchandises de boutique ( sucre, riz, cube maggi, thé, bonbon etc). Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Ainsi, il rejoint l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il sollicite ce deuxième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ce  deuxième prêt individuel  permettra d’acheter  3 sacs de 50 kg de riz, 4 sacs de 50 kg du sucre, 2 cartons de cube maggi, 5 cartons du thé et 2 cartons de bonbon dans la ville de SIKASSO pour la revendre au détail dans son point de vente au bord du goudron à LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d ‘homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 52 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les prêt et son intérêts.
texts.en:
Ousmane was born in 1984 in Loulouni. He is married and lives with his wife in Loulouni, which lies in the Kadiolo district of the Sikasso region (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). Ousmane did not have the opportunity to do any studies and six years ago he started buying and selling shop products (sugar, rice, Maggi stock cubes, tea, candy, etc..) With such an experience in this field he enjoys a good reputation. He has thus joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and is on his second individual loan, which will enable him to expand his business so that he can respond to customer demand. 

This second individual loan will allow him to buy three 50-kilo sacks of rice, four 50-kilo sacks of sugar, two cartons of Maggi stock cubes, five cartons of tea and two cartons of candy in the town of Sikasso. He will resell these products on a retail basis at his sales point on the edge of the road in Loulouni to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

With this loan he expects to make an average monthly profit of 52,000FCFA, which will be used to cover his expenses and pay back the interest and capital of his loan.

loans.use: to buy shop products.

loans.name: Keneya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KENEYA ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN /SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers et des boissons.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KENEYA sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de bonbon, 1 carton de vinaigre, 3 cartons de biscuits et 1 carton de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 31 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group Keneya are on average 45 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

These women met through family relations and trade in various items and beverages. They paid back their previous loans on time. This is the seventh solidarity loan for the women of group Keneya. Djeneba, the first woman from the left in the picture, plans on using her loan to purchase two boxes of candy, one of vinegar, three of cookies, and one of soap. She procures her supplies from local wholesalers. She sells cash or, often, extends credits to her mixed-gender clientele.
She is expecting an average monthly profit of 31,000 XOF, which will be used to pay for expenses related to healthcare, food, and school. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items.

loans.name: Jenolor Joy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jenolor Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. Jenolor Joy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Jenolor Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Joann works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Joann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  buy spare parts for her motorcycle and to pay for maintenance.

Joann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Letecia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marissa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Myrna is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 50 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom are in school.

Marjorie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marjorie has been raising pigs for 14 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Jean is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Esther

texts.es:
Mirna, vive con dos sobrinos y su hija, se dedica a atender un mini súper donde ofrece a sus clientes diferentes artículos para el hogar, dicho negocio pertenecía a uno de sus hermanos y en el cual era empleada, con el tiempo su hermano viajo al extranjero y le cedió el negocio, por el momento no representa ningún problema.
Con el financiamiento surtirá el inventario de su negocio con nueva mercadería, con ello mejorara las ventas y las ganancias, que utilizara para cancelar la deuda adquirida y ofrecerá a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud. Comprara variedad de estilos y colores de ropa, cubrecamas, sandalias, cosméticos, entre otros productos.
Su sueño es seguir mejorando la variedad y calidad de productos para aumentar la rentabilidad necesaria para comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Mirna lives with her daughter and two nephews. She has a small convenience store in which she offers her customers a variety of household items. The business belonged to one of Mirna's brothers and she worked there as an employee. However, over time her brother traveled abroad and handed the business over to her. This has not been a problem so far.
Mirna will use the financing to stock her business with new merchandise, which will improve sales and the profit. This will allow her to pay back the loan and offer her family better food, clothing and health. Mirna will buy clothes in a variety of styles and colors, as well as bedspreads, sandals, cosmetics and other products.
Mirna's dream is to keep improving the variety and quality of her products in order to improve profitability so she can buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in a variety of styles and colors, bedspreads, sandals, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Sarah Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Sarah Jane is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 48 years old and married with 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Jemma works very hard to provide for them.

Jemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jemma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Elenita works very hard to provide for them.

Elenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Elenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
José, de 58 años, se despierta todos los días a las 4 de la mañana con el canto de los pájaros y el sonido de sus vacas, las cuales representan la única fuente de ingresos de su familia. A pesar de que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, desde hace 40 años, emprendió en el camino de la agricultura, comprando vacas, criándolas y luego vendiéndolas a un mejor precio, para así proveerles a sus tres hijos y a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. 
Anteriormente, José había solicitado un préstamo para comprar terneros y limpiar un poco su finca. Al obtener resultados positivos, ha decidido solicitar otro crédito para seguir creciendo, desea comprar más terneros para cuidarlos y venderlos cuando ya estén desarrollados. Lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida, invirtiendo sus ganancias en las necesidades familiares. En un futuro piensa comprar una cortadora de césped o un motor de riego para mejorar las condiciones de su finca.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old. He wakes up every morning at 4 am to the singing of the birds. And the lowing of the cattle which represent the only source of income for his family. In spite of not having had the opportunity to study, he has been dong his farming for more than 40 years, buying cattle, raising them and then selling them at a higher price. This is how he has provided his wife and children with a higher quality of living.

José had requested a loan previously to buy some calves and clean his farm a bit. With positive results from that, José has decided to request another loan in order to keep growing. He wants to buy more calves to raise and sell when they are grown. This will allow him to improve his standard of living, investing his earnings in things the family needs. In the future he is thinking of buying a lawn mower or a pump for the irrigation to improve conditions on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Evelia Rafaela

texts.es:
Evelia desde pequeña se sintió atraída por la  alta costura. Sus primeros pasos a este oficio los dio confeccionando en una zona franca, lo que le permitió  adquirir  buenos conocimientos. Gracias a este empleo pudo ahorrar y utilizó el dinero para abrir su propio taller.  Evelia se ha convertido en una excelente modista. Los clientes la prefieren porque ofrece telas de calidad  y por ser detallista en su trabajo. Siempre está  a la vanguardia y conoce las últimas tendencias.
Su entorno económico ha mejorado gracias a las ganancias del negocio.  Anhela distribuir sus prendas por otros departamentos hasta convertir su taller en un sitio reconocido. Sin embargo, también tiene otras visiones, ella quiere invertir en la compra de una moto taxi. Por lo tanto solicitó la ayuda financiera de KIVA Mi Crédito,  ya que esta institución siempre apoya a pequeños comerciantes como ella que aspiran un futuro mejor en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Evelia felt attracted to haute couture.  She took her first steps toward this profession working in a duty-free zone, which allowed her to acquire decent knowledge.  Thanks to that employment, Evelia was able to save and use that money to open her own workshop.  Evelia has become an excellent dressmaker.  Her customers come to her because she sells quality fabrics and is detailed in her work.  Evelia is always on the cutting edge and knows the recent trends. 
Evelia's financial situation has improved, thanks to the profits from her business.  She longs to distribute her garments to other departments so that her workshop becomes well-known.  Even so, she has other visions too.  She wants to invest in the purchase of a "moto taxi" (motorcycle taxi).  Evelia is requesting financial assistance from KIVA Mi Crédito, as this institution always helps small business owners, like herself, who aspire to a better future in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 10 años de edad. Carlos es agricultor y cultiva principalmente ayotes y maíz. Además, es pescador desde hace 6 años y es así como junto a su esposa mantiene la economía del hogar. Carlos desea terminar de construir la pila con el baño que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado construir y además, desea enladrillar el piso de la vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena,hierro, etc.
texts.en: Carlos is 42-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their 10-year old daughter.  Carlos is a farmer and primarily grows pumpkins and corn.  In addition, he has worked as a fisherman for six years, which is how he and his wife are able to maintain their home's finances.  Carlos wants to finish construction on their bathroom and sink, but due to a lack of financial resources he hasn't been able to.  He also wants to pave their home's floor with bricks.  That is why he decided to request a loan from FUSAI.  He will invest in the purchase of flooring bricks, cement, sand, iron etc.

loans.use: to purchase: flooring bricks, cement, sand, iron etc. to pave his home's floor with brick and to finish construction on his bathroom and sink.

loans.name: Cerenisa

texts.en: Cerenisa provides transportation services in her community, and she earns well from this, the main source of her income. She has been running this business for more than nine years. She lets her tenant operate the tricycle for her. Her husband works as a port laborer. Cerenisa is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy new tires for her tricycle and for maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to give her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella  has been selling a variety of different vegetables for seven years. She earns well, enough that she was able to improve her business and successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. She’s old now, yet continues to hang on to her retail business to give adequate support to her family. She took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Stella hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. Cherry is single and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready to wear clothing.

Cherry has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready to wear clothing.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is married and the father of four children. He describes himself as successful and operates a retail business where he sells bricks. He has been in this business for the three last years, operates from a very busy location, and sells most of his bricks to homebuilders. His biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of his business. He will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to make more bricks. His goal is to have a bigger business within five years. This is his first loan request with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as to be determined. He operates a posho mill business where he grinds maize to produce maize flour. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are area residents. 

David says his biggest business challenge is power shortages. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for electricity installation. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for electricity installation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sodas, juice, candy, eggs, firewood and corn.

loans.name: Ana De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Hace 10 años, Ana empezó a recorrer el mundo detrás de las telas y las máquinas de coser, fabricando ropa para negocios de otras personas. Hasta que un día, al ver el potencial que tenía en ella, decidió independizarse y con la ayuda de su esposo compró una máquina que le ayudaría a ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus cinco hijos entre las edades de 21-8 meses. 
Ahora Ana tiene 39 años y sin haber tenido la oportunidad de ir a la universidad, se convirtió en una productora y comerciante de ropa, siempre con el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo. Ambos desean proveerles los estudios a todos sus hijos, sin embargo sus ingresos solo le permite para dos, de manera que esto la motiva a seguir creciendo. 
Con el préstamo de MiCrédito-KIVA piensa comprar una máquina de coser, puesto que le serviría para aumentar la producción y llegar a cumplir con su sueño de tener una fábrica de ropa importante en el país, que le permita promover sus productos en todos los mercados capitalinos y así permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Ana started going all over chasing fabrics and sewing machines.  She made clothing for other companies and people until the day she saw her own potential.  She decided to go out on her own and, with her husband's help, purchased a sewing machine that would help her to offer a better quality of life to her five children.  Her children are between the ages of 21 years and 8 months. 
Ana is now 39-years old, and without having had the opportunity to go to university, has become a clothing producer and seller.  She has always been able to count on her husband's moral and financial support.  They both want to provide their children with an education.  However, their income only allows them to send two of their children to school.  This is what has motivated Ana to keep growing her business. 
Through her MiCrédito-KIVA loan, Ana plans to purchase a sewing machine.  It will serve her in increasing production and making her dream, of having an important clothing factory in her country, come true.  It will also allow her to promote her products in the capital markets and improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian, es casado, vive junto  a su esposa y cuatro hijos, todos dependen económicamente de  él, siendo un niño aprendió de su padre a cultivar granos básicos y a criar ganado, su jornada de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, su experiencia ha hecho que estás actividades le generen los ingresos necesarios con los que sale adelante junto a su familia.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar una vaca parida, con esta acción aumentara la producción de lácteos, que serán utilizados para consumo familiar y para comercializarlos, esperando tener ingresos extras con los cuales cumplirá con los compromisos económicos que tiene.
El Sr.: Willian aspira a que sus esfuerzos diarios por administrar bien su negocio le den como resultado una ganadería mucho más grande y reconosida.
texts.en:
Willian is married and lives with his wife and four children who are all economically dependent him. As a child, he learned from his father to cultivate basic grains and raise cattle. His working day is from 6 am to 3 pm. His experience has ensured that these activities generate sufficient income so that he and his family can get by.
 
The loan will be used to buy a cow which has recently calved, this action will increase the production of milk, which will be used for home consumption and to sell. He is hoping to have extra income which will meet the financial commitments he has. 

Willian hopes that his daily efforts to manage his business well will result in a much larger and more recognised herd of livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow which has recently calved

loans.name: Georgina Margarita

texts.es:
Georgina cuenta con una gran variedad de prendas  de vestir que llaman la atención  de todas las personas que la visitan en su domicilio.  Inició vendiendo  ropa interior, luego optó por ofrecer  ropa en general, como pantalones, camisas  y shorts.  Posee un sexto sentido, porque conoce  los gustos  de sus clientes, además siempre está a la vanguardia con las últimas tendencias de la moda actual. Nunca imagino que este pequeño negocio le iba generar   buenas ganancias.
Georgina recurrió a un financiamiento de KIVA MiCrédito.  Desea conseguir más capital para invertir en la compra de jeans, shorts y camisas, prendas de vestir que cuentan con fuertes demandas entre su clientela. Ella es una mujer con visión, en sus planes futuros está la posibilidad de abrir su propia tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Georgina has a large variety of clothing which gets the attention of all the people who come to visit her in her house. She started out selling underwear and then decided to carry clothing in general like pants, shirts and shorts. She has a sixth sense as she knows what her customers want and she stays on top of the latest fashion trends. She never thought her small business would make her good money.

Georgina is requesting a loan from KIVA and MiCrédito. She wants to have more capital to invest in buying jeans, shorts and shirts, items of clothing that are in strong demand by her clients. She is a woman with vision. In her future plans it is a possibility to open her own store in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shorts and shirts.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela manages a retail store while her husband works as a carpenter to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC, which she used for her business. She was able to open her store from the revenue generated and to also access financial services from GDMPC micro finance. She is thankful to GDMPC that it helped to improve her ability to engage in business. She took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She hopes to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila operates a tailoring business in her community. She has to work more, for she is the sole provider for her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to purchase fabrics and repairs. Recently, she took a loan to buy textiles to make curtains and pillow cases for sale. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy textiles to make curtains and pillow cases for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She has seven children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a large supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro de 70 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en Morazán, Yoro. El siempre se a dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos como maiz y frijoles. Hace 15 años vende productos de golosinas como churros, galletas, harina, azúcar, confites, y también ropa, calzado y variedades. El ha obtenido varios préstamos para el negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 7,000 lempiras para surtir de mercadería como churros, dulces, galletas, ropa y calzado,  para atender mejor a los clientes. Su plan es aumentar ventas y ganancias para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Don Pedro is 70-years old, married, has four children and lives in Morazán, Yoro.  He has always made his living growing staple foods, like corn and rice.  For fifteen years he has sold sweets, like "churros" (doughnuts), cookies, sugar, candy and also clothing, footwear and assortments.  Don Pedro has taken out some loans for his business, and he currently needs another 7,000 lempiras (USD $375).  He will use the loan to stock up on merchandise like "churros," sweets, cookies, clothing and footwear so he can offer better service to his customers.  Don Pedro's plan is to increase his sales and profits and to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise, such as "churros" (doughnuts), sweets, cookies, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Copaneco Group

texts.es: Elder, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, y reside en una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula. El cultiva  maíz y frijoles, desde hace 14 años, esta producción la vende en los mercados locales de donde obtiene sus ingresos. Está solicitando 8,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y preparación de la tierra para sembrar maíz y frijol. Su meta es aumentar la producción de granos y obtener mas ganancias. El grupo se llama Copaneco, integrado de tres miembros que viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es de 18,000 Lempiras para abonar y preparar tierra y sembrar maiz y frijol. En la foto esta Elder, a la izquierda, Mauro y Agustin a la derecha.
texts.en:
Elder is 24 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with his partner. He lives in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He has grown corn and beans for 14 years. He sells his product in the local markets to obtain money. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to buy fertilizer and prepare the land to plant beans and corn. His goal is to increase his production of grains and generate more income.

The group is called "Copaneco" and has three members from the same community. The group loan is for 18,000 HNL to buy fertilizer and to prepare the land for growing corn and beans. Elder is to the left in the photo, then Mauro and Agustin to the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in their village to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years. She also buys and sell charcoal and she earns additional income from this. With her generated income, she was able to provide for the family and sustain the business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Elizabeth wants to provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luz Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de 64 años de edad está acompañado y tienen un hijo de 14 años de edad, ellos viven en casa propia desde hace 6 años. Desde la edad de 36 años comenzó a trabajar como albañil independiente por lo que es muy bien conocido y recomendado en la zona de donde habita. Su esposa lo apoyo con los ingresos que adquiere por la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto del mercado central de otro municipio. Heriberto ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para construir un servicio sanitario y baño con fosa séptica y pozo de absorción, actualmente su baño está a la intemperie utilizando plástico como paredes (como se aprecia en la fotografía). Heriberto construirá las paredes de ladrillo de barro y colocará techo de lámina galvanizada. Él se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas que este crédito implica, así seguirá a corto plazo mejorando su vivienda con otro crédito, espera dejar a su hijo una mejor herencia.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 64 years old, married and has a 14 year old child. They have lived in their own house for 6 years. At the age of 36 he started to work as an independent bricklayer has has become well-known and recommended in the area he lives in. His wife helps him with income that she makes selling fruit and vegetables in a stall in the central market of another municipality.

Heriberto has requested a loan from FUSAI to construct a bathroom with a septic tank and seepage well. At present his bathroom is outdoors using plastic for walls (as you can see in the photo). Heriberto will build brick walls and cover the roof with galvanized laminate. He promises to pay his installments on time and in a short time continue improving his house with another loan. He hopes to leave his son with a better inheritance.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, re-bar and galvanized laminate to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Nelba

texts.en: Nelba is the sole provider for the family, for she has been separated from her husband. To earn a living, she runs a retail store that provides grocery goods in her community. With four years of running the business, she has successfully sustained it and she earns well from this. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 year old widow who lives with her family. She has a business serving food and snacks to her customers; she sells assorted food and beverages to generate additional income. She works every day in order to provide income for the family and to show her responsibility and love to her family. 

Carmelita requested this loan to purchase additional raw ingredients in order to prepare food to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue assisting her family by providing additional income. The story of Carmelita and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is happy live with his wife and four children. While his wife is busy managing their retailing business, Reynaldo engages in charcoal making. After making charcoal, Reynaldo delivers it to his regular customers in the market to sell. Most of the local households prefer to use charcoal in cooking because it is inexpensive. 

Since it is a basic need of every household, Reynaldo expects his customer base to increase. He needs additional capital to make more charcoal and meet his customers' needs. Reynaldo decided to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy unused wood for charcoal making. He also plans to use the loan to hire workers to assist him in making charcoal. Reynaldo hopes for continuous growth of the business and to further support his family needs.

loans.use: to buy unused wood for charcoal making.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en: Anna Marie has been earning a living from her piggery for many years. She earns well from this and was able to make some improvements to her house. With her generated revenue, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying piglets. To improve business, she has taken a new loan to buy feed in order to boost her pigs. Anna Marie is hopeful for the possibility of sustaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata buys and sells bananas for a living. She also sells charcoal in their village and she earns more income. With her generated revenue, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying more bananas to resell. To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito has had experience in many activities in order to make a living. He tried a fish vending business for many years. His previous loan, used in buying fishing equipment, was successfully repaid.

For the past three years, he has engaged in vulcanizing services, which earns better income for the family. Julito took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase a new tire tube vulcanizing machine. In the future, Julito wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a new tire tube vulcanizing machine

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-neuvième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame WASSA  debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes SABALY, fait la vente des produits alimentaires tels les légumes, les tubercules, les fruits, etc. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre au marché où  elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits alimentaires  qui seront revendus  au détail  sur place et à KAMALEN SIRAKORO à une clientèle composée  d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the SABALY group are married women who are on average 42 years old and who have on average five children. They live for the most part in traditional families in KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their nineteenth group loan with microfinance institution SORO Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.
Mrs. WASSA, standing to the far left in the photo of this women’s group, SABALY, sells food products, such as vegetables, tubers, fruits, etc.
With her loan, she plans to buy five 100-kg sacks of potatoes at the market where she is well sought after for the quality of her products, which she will resell at retail at KAMALEN SIRAKORO to a clientele composed of men and and women for cash or credit.
She foresees earning an average of 42,000 CFA per month, a portion of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the other for savings.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Sree Veerbhadreshiwar Mahila Swasahaya Sangh Group

texts.en:
Nirmala, aged about 33 years, is the group leader of a fourteen-member group from Chinchali village, situated in the Belgaum district of Karnataka state in India. Her family is comprised of five members: her husband, her daughter, and her parents-in-law. Her husband does agricultural activities in their own two-acre cultivable land. The lady who is standing with her raised hand is Nirmala. She has completed her schooling till 10th grade. 

Nirmala has a buffalo-rearing farm; she has 10 years' experience in this business, and she also works in their agricultural fields on daily wages. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts. At present, her family income is INR 8,000 per month, which is barely enough to maintain the family.   
                                                                                                                                                                          
To improve her living conditions, Nirmala wants to access a first loan from “Kiva”. With the loan amount, she will purchase another buffalo to rear. She dreams of converting her small farm into a much big farm in the future.

Nirmala, along with other fourteen members of her village, formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) group called “Sree Veerbhadreshiwar Mahila SwaSahaya Sangh” and planned to take a loan from Kiva.  The other members will be using the loan for different purposes like animal husbandry, auto purchase, education and petty shopkeeping.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Guirane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Guirane travaille comme agent de sécurité dans une Banque de la place, depuis plus de 5 ans. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et pour réaliser son projet, il vient solliciter ce montant avec lequel, il pourra acquérir une chambre à coucher bois verne : lit, armoire, coiffeuse et mettre dans sa chambre.
Il est marié et s’occupe de sa famille et de la dépense quotidienne.
Guirane voyant sa petite famille s’agrandir et les besoins des enfants augmenter, il a besoin d’avoir une autre source de revenu pour pallier à tout cela.
texts.en:
Mr. Guirane has been working as a bank security guard for more than five years. He’s never gotten a loan from IMCEC, and to fulfill his plans, he is seeking this amount with which he will be able to get a bedroom set: a bed, an armoire, and a dressing table to put in his room. 
He is married and takes care of his family and of the daily expenses. 
In watching his small family grow and the needs of his children increase, Guirane needs to have another source of income to meet all of these needs.

loans.use: to buy a bed, an armoire, and a dressing table to put in his room

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  BALIMAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame MAFOUNE debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes BALIMAYA, fait la vente des bois de chauffe. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de la ville de SIKASSO. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses bois qui seront vendus la plupart  des femmes de ménages au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the BALIMAYA group are married women, who are on average 37 and who have on average five children. They live for the most part in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their sixth group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.
Mrs. MAFOUNE, standing second to the left in the photo of the women of the BALIMAYA group, sells firewood. 
With her loan, she plans to buy two truck-loads of firewood in neighboring villages. She is heavily sought after for the quality of her wood, which she will resell mainly to housewives for cash or credit.
She foresees earning an average of 52,000 CFA per month, a portion of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the other for savings.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  LAFIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-unième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame RAMATOU debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes LAFIA, fait la vente des tasses. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des quantités importantes de tasses au grand marché où  elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses tasses qui seront revendues au détail  au comptant et à crédit sur place et à KAMALEN SIRAKORO à une clientèle composée principalement des femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 56 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The six members of the LAFIA group are married women, who are on average 42 and who have on average five children. They live for the most part in traditional families in KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their twenty-first group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.
Mrs. Ramatou, standing to the far left in the photo of the women of the LAFIA group, sells cups. 
With her loan, she plans to buy large quantities of cups at the grand market, where she is heavily sought after for the quality of her cups, which she will resell at retail for cash or credit at KAMALEN SIRAKORO to a clientele composed mainly of women.
She foresees earning an average of 56,000 CFA per month, a portion of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the other for savings.

loans.use: to buy cups

loans.name: Gnesouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  GNESOUMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame SALIMATA debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes GNESOUMA, fait la vente des bois de chauffe. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe, elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de SIKASSO. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses bois qui seront vendus la plupart  des femmes de ménages au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the GNESOUMA group are married women, who are on average 33 and who have on average three children. They live for the most part in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their sixth group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.
Mrs. SALIMATA, standing second to the left in the photo of the women of the GNESOUMA group, sells firewood. 
With her loan, she plans to buy two truck-loads of firewood in neighboring villages in the city of SIKASSO. She is heavily sought after for the quality of her wood, which she will resell mainly to housewives for cash or credit.
She foresees earning an average of 55,000 CFA per month, a portion of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the other for savings.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Zunilda tiene 56 años de edad es casada con una nieta a la cual educa. Ella se dedica a prestar servicios de costurera desde muy joven. Ella confecciona faldas blusas uniformes deportivos para niños  de centro educativos a pedido de las madres de familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de telas hilos cierres. Zunilda cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Zunilda es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste verde.
texts.en:
Zunilda is 56, married, and has a granddaughter whom she is educating.  

Zunilda has made a living as a seamstress since she was very young.  She makes skirts, blouses, and sports uniforms for school children at the request of their mothers.  She will use this loan to purchase fabrics, thread, and fasteners.  

Zunilda serves as president of the "Jesus Pan de Vida" ["Jesus Bread of Life"] group.  The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their provided support.  Zunilda is the third from the left wearing green.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, and fasteners

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married with three children. She helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling farm produce and she earns well to support their needs. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and pay replanting costs.  She has had to be determined in her work to give an adequate allowance for her children who are students. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay replanting cost

loans.name: Sarswathi Mahila Swasahaya Sangh Group

texts.en:
Group members of the Self-Help Group (SHG) called “Sarswathi Mahila SwaSahaya Sangh” from Amangi village, Belgaum are seeking a loan of 180,000 INR to expand businesses like animal breeding, cloth business, to improve agriculture activities, or for house construction. These women have broken free from the cruel Devadasi system and are working hard in their small businesses. Chandravva is the featured borrower of this group. She is illiterate; the Devadasi system deprived her of education and a normal childhood. 
 
The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a Devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this lifelong decision which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

Chandravva, now a former Devadasi, is living with her mother and daughter; her daughter is studying in the 8th grade. Chandravva has more than 30 years' experience in goat rearing. For extra income, she also works in agricultural fields.
  
Now she has planned to improve her goat rearing farm for which she is seeking a loan. She wants to buy more goats. This will help her to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes to save enough for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Mahila Sangh Group

texts.en:
The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a Devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this lifelong decision which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

Mala is 44 years old (she is the lady standing with her hand raised in the picture) and lives in Bendwad village, Raibag, Belgaum. She is a former Devadasi. Mala has a son; he is married and has four children, and they all are going to school. One of her daughters died. 

Mala’s main source of income is animal husbandry and agriculture. She has a buffalo rearing farm. She milks the buffalo and she sells the milk to the KMF Federation situated in her village. She uses some milk for her household. She also does labor in agricultural fields. She earns around INR 9,750 per month which is not sufficient to meet her family's basic needs. 

Now she wants to improve her farm for which she is seeking a loan which will allow her to purchase one more buffalo and to rear it. Mala will use the additional income for her grandchildren’s education and she wants to help her son to open his own petty trading shop in their locality. She hopes to save enough to secure their future.

The other six members of “Mahalaxmi Mahila Sangh” self-help group (SHG) are applying for loans for different purposes: two members for goat rearing, one for education and three members for buffalo rearing.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue, con quien tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos y padres, en el municipio del Negrito,Yoro. El se dedica a la producción de arroz desde hace 8 años, la produccion es de buena calidad y la vende en el mercado local. Lleva 8 ciclos de prestamos con el que ha solicitado actualmente y es por 15,000 lempiras para la preparación de terreno, arado y siembra de arroz y  realizar y sembrar viveros con el propósito es sacar buena cosecha y ganancias. Su meta es incrementar una manzana mas de cultivo de arroz para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: Ovidio is 29 years old and lives with his common law wife, with whom he has two children. He lives with his wife and children and parents in the town of Negrito Yoro.  He has been working in the production of rice for eight years.  The production is of good quality and he sells it in the local market.  He has participated in 8 cycles of loans.  His current loan request is for 15,000 lempiras for the preparation of land, tilling and seeding of rice. He will plant with the goal of having a good harvest and income.  His goal is to increase his land and cultivation of rice so that his children can go to school.

loans.use: For the preparation of the land and planting of rice.

loans.name: Moutaz

texts.en:
Moutaz is a 22-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner for the five members of his family. He has been employed in a company since 2006, and he is working hard to develop his career to make sure he can stay capable of providing his family with the necessities of life.

Moutaz is applying for a 2,000 USD YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance on his car and legally register it to drive it around Lebanon. His car is very important to him and his family. He hopes that one day he can establish his own business and raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: to register and do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a widowed man. He has two children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, cooking fat, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His business is located in a good market and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of stock. 

Edward will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other items

loans.name: Resgan

texts.en:
Resgan is studying at a university to earn a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology. 

Resgan is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his career. His father is a tricycle driver and his mother earns a living from her cafeteria. He helps them by working on various tasks around the house. He is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. His goal is to have a better life and career in the future, in order to support his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Severina is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 16 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. Severina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Severina hopes to have her own coconut plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Jose Florentino

texts.es: Florentino de 57 años de edad es casado, procrearon 5 hijos y tres de ellos ya tienen su propio hogar, dos hijos aun están al cuidado de Florentino. Florentino se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo a la agricultura con esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a toda su familia, hoy uno de su hijos desde el exterior le da apoyo económico para la educación de sus hermanos menores. Florentino quiere dar mayor seguridad a su familia y a las pocas pertenencias que poseen, por lo que sobre el muro de piedra existente levantará pared de bloque de concreto; Florentino no posee todo el capital que esta obra requiere por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el cemento, hierro, arena, grava y bloque de concreto para construir la pared descrita.
texts.en: Florentino, 57, is married. He is the father of 5 children of which 3 live in their own homes with 2 still remaining in his care. Florentino has made his living in agriculture for a long time. This activity has allowed him to raise his whole family. One of his sons works abroad and currently supports the education of his younger siblings. Florentino wants to give his family greater security for themselves and the few belongings they have so he'd like to raise the stone wall he has by adding concrete blocks. Florentino does not possess all the capital he requires for this work so he has applied for a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, iron, sand, gravel, and concrete blocks to build the described wall.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks, salt, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic location and his primary customers are area residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity and lack of adequate capital. 

Michael will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of salt, bread, sweets and other items. His business goal is to have a business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of salt, bread, sweets and other items

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Sebastiana to improve her business. She is married and  she opened her animal-sales business in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store selling chickens. Sebastiana is generating a good income from selling her chickens from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To sell chickens

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat lives in Kapsabet, a small town adjacent to Kakamega County, which is located in Western Kenya close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Josphat is a pastor. He is married and has two children. His wife and he have been farming for the past five years and are currently growing maize, tea, yams, onions and bananas, plus Napier grass for insect control. He is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey, and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Josphat’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a business and provide for his family’s needs. His hope for the future is to see his children finish school and get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in Kapsabet, western Kenya, an area famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in the area grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make the region particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Henry and his wife, the parents of two children, have been farming for six years now; they are currently growing tea and keeping bees and dairy cattle. Henry is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income through the sale of honey.

This is Henry's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. Henry's hope for the future is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in Kapsabet, very close to Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, as well as the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Christopher is married and has eight children. He is a retired teacher. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and are currently growing maize and coffee, and rearing dairy cattle. Christopher is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him extra income and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Christopher’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehive to invest in his dairy farm. Christopher’s hope for the future is to see his children finish school and get good jobs.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 9 años y 2 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Sonia posee una pequeña tienda y un molino de nixtamal y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y desea repararlo antes que el invierno llegue. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y polines.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her two children, ages 9 and 2, who are studying in the public school in the area. Sonia has a small store and a mill for corn flour and in this way earns a living and provides support for her household. 

In order to improve her living conditions she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in repairing the roof of the house since it is in bad condition and she wants to repair it before winter comes.  With this amount she will buy galvanized sheet metal and poles.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and poles to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials

loans.name: Arquilita

texts.en:
Arquilita is fifty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. For the past sixteen years she has grown bananas on her plantation.

Arquilita has been a member of PMPC for three years. She is applying for a 14,900 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for her banana trees. She would like to have a coconut plantation in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her banana trees.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma tiene 35 años edad y vive el distrito de Vilcabamba en la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, ella es una persona amable y carismática y desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal "Trabajadoras de Habaspata". Ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Ella agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Zulma is 35 years old and lives in the district of Vilcabamba in La Convencion province, Cusco. She is a kind and charismatic person and has belonged to the communal bank Trabajadoras de Habaspata [Women Workers of Habaspata] for several years.      

She earns her living in agriculture and by raising cattle and needs the loan at this time to buy seeds and fertilizers. She thanks all the lenders for the help provided and promises to make payments very responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is 64 years old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao. He is married and has six children. He earns approximately 5000 PHP a month running his motorcycle transport business.

Dioscoro has been a member of PMPC for a year. He is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He would like to own a jeep someday.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan lives in Kampala. She is single with three children, two of which go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to buy bunches of green bananas, onions, serving utensils, cooking oil, flour, and rice. Her main business challenge is seasonality. Her goal is to own a fully stocked restaurant with tables and chairs. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, onions, serving utensils, cooking oil, flour and rice.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 32-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a video shop where he sells movies and shows movies. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the change in the seasons. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a television for his business. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Chiryl

texts.en: Chiryl is married with two children. She operates a fishing business with her husband to earn a living. For two years, she has been selling fish in their village, which helps a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She has sustained her business and hopes to borrow a loan to buy fishing nets. In the future, Chiryl wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Laxmi Mahila Swasahaya Sangh Group

texts.en:
These nine enterprising women belong to the Self-Help Group (SHG) “Laxmi Mahila Swasahaya Sangh” managed by MASS society. They all are labourers in agriculture fields. They are very hard workers and want to improve their lives economically and socially, so they are seeking a loan from Kiva. All the members discussed and then elected Dundavva (the lady who is standing with her hand raised in the picture) as president of their group. 

Dundavva, 30, lives in Itnal, Raibag, Belgaum. She is married and has two children.  Her elder son is studying in tenth grade, and her younger son is studying in eighth grade. Her parents-in-law live with her. Her husband and father-in-law work in agriculture fields as daily-wage workers. 

Dundavva is also a daily-wage worker in agriculture, and she does goat rearing. She has fifteen years of experience in this field. Her family income is around INR 9,000 per month. This income is not sufficient for the family’s expenses, and she is finding it difficult to pay for her children’s education expenses. Hence, she planned to take a loan from Kiva to buy more goats, which will help her enlarge her business and increase her monthly income.

Dundavva hopes to save enough for her children’s education and for their future. She dreams to see her children as government job holders.   

The other group members need loans for goat and buffalo rearing. They hope to save an adequate amount to secure their families’ future.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing.

loans.name: Joisi

texts.en: Joisi is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as an optimist. She operates a retail business selling sugar, cooking fat, sweets and other items. Her biggest business challenge is lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other items. In the future, she hopes to improve her livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.en:
Gualberto is 48 years old. He is married and his wife works selling rice, which helps him with the household expenses. 

Gualberto has been raising rice for sale since he was very young. His father taught him this work, because it was the only way to move the family forward. In addition to raising rice, he works to help his wife's business. When he finishes his work, he comes home to help his wife with the daily chores.

Gualberto is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer, in order to prepare his farm for more abundant produce. In the future, he wants to give his family a better life. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sumiini

texts.en: Sumiini lives in Kampala. She is married with eight children and all of her children go to school.  She also has a sister and a brother. She operates a retail shop from the market. She has been in business for the last three years and works six days a week.  She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy sugar, rice, boxes of soap, flour, cooking oil and crates of soda. Her business challenges include access to transportation and electricity. Her goal is to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease in transportation, in addition to building rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, boxes of soap, flour, cooking oil and crates of soda.

loans.name: Petrona Ayde

texts.es: Petrona tiene 72 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Petrona tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de tamales, tortillas y pupusas. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Es una mujer impresionante quien a pesar de sus años no se cansa de luchar por mejores condiciones de vida. Petrona desea reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado y es necesario repararlo lo antes posible. Petrona solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Petrona is 72 years old and lives in her own house together with her adult son, whom she helps with household expenses. Petrona has a small business selling tamales, tortillas, and pupusas. This is how she earns a living and supports her household. She is an impressive woman, who despite her age never tires of fighting to improve her living conditions. 

Petrona wants to repair the roof of her home’s hallway, which has become damaged and must be repaired as soon as possible. Petrona requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the ceiling of the house's hallway.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 33-year-old married father of three children. He works hard to provide a better living for the five members of his beloved family. For the past two years he has worked as a salesperson and is striving to develop his career in a well-managed way.

However, Nasser's income is barely enough to cover all of his family's needs. Educating his children is very important to him, though, so he is applying for a 1,000 USD loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children’s increasing school costs. He used three previous loans from Al Majmoua to pay for their educational expenses and has proved to be a borrower in good standing.

Nasser is saving to buy a small bus that he will use to transport students and villagers from one place to another. This will give him an extra source of income.

loans.use: To pay for his children's increasing school costs

loans.name: Los Ruiseñores Group

texts.es: Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Los Ruiseñores” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Santa Ana de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú. Martha tiene 46 años y es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica es la agricultura donde tiene plantaciones de café, cacao, coca y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, lima, mandarina y limón. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Los Ruiseñores” of Asociación Arariwa. They live in the Santa Ana district of La Convención province, Cusco, Perú. Martha is forty six years old. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who supports her family. Her business is agriculture, and she has fields of coffee, cocoa, coca, and citrus such as oranges, limes, mandarins, and lemons. This time she requires a loan to buy fertilizer.

The other members work in livestock and agriculture, sell food, raise small animals, and offer professional services. The members thank those who, in this way, play a part in their dreams, and they promise to make their payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Alexina

texts.en: Alexina is a 40-year-old woman. She has two children and describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells timber and firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase trees to produce timber for sale. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her business and livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase trees to produce timber for sale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with four children and operates a fishing business while her husband works as a driver to earn a living. Four years of selling fish in their village has helped a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She has sustained her business and was able to give allowances to her children for going to school. Aside from this, she also had a retail store in their village. Recently, she  borrowed a loan to buy fishing nets used for fishing. In the future, Jocelyn wants to own more fishing boats to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic gates and other items, which he has been doing for five years. His biggest business challenge is theft. 

Julius requested a loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy a welding machine. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells motorcycle spare parts. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are motorcycle riders. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. 

Her business goal is to own a large shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children ranging in age from seven to thirteen years. When asked, she describes herself as optimistic.

For the past six years Rosemary has sold fish to make a living. She sells in a busy area and has frequent customers. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of working capital.

Rosemary is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP to buy more fish to sell. Her business goal is to sell wholesale within five years and so improve her cash flow.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 38-year-old married father of six children ranging from six to 15 years of age.  Describing himself as visionary, Festus operates a retail business where he sells chicken to a regular clientele. His biggest challenges are theft and poultry diseases. 

Festus will use this Kes 30,000 loan to buy more chickens. His business goal is to be the best within five years, and he hopes to raise his family's living standards in the future. This will be his second loan with SMEP DTM; he fully repaid his previous one.

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: Juan  Aquileo
