texts.es: Juan, es un señor de 40 años, originario de la comunidad de palo grande del municipio de somotillo,  se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora, responsable en su trabajo y su familia,actualmente se desempeña como conserje en la escuela Ricardo Morales Avilés de la comunidad de palo grande. se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de zim, alfajiyas y clavos para la reparación del techo de su vivienda que se deterioro por efectos de lluvia y de esta manera brindarle un techo a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 40 year old gentleman who is originally from the community of Palo Grande in the municipality of Somotillo. He characterises himself as an honest, hardworking and responsible person both in his work and family life. He is currently working as the janitor at the Ricardo Morales Avilés school in the community of Palo Grande. 

He came to CEPRODEL's offices to ask for a loan to buy zinc, rafters and nails to fix the roof of his house which has become deteriorated due to the rain. In this way he hopes to put a roof over his family's heads.

loans.use: zinc, rafters and nails to fix the roof of his house

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Concepción, es un grupo nuevo que quiere trabajar y salir adelante por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas y ayudado por el programa de comités de la fundación paraguaya.
La Sra.  Ana es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender a sus productos de limpieza, aparte de ello también realiza venta de comidas todos los fines de semana. Como se puede ver es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer las comidas que vende, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
San Miguel is a group from the city of Concepción. It is a new group that wants to work and move forward through all of their efforts and help from Fundación Paraguaya's committee program. 

Ana is a member. She is from the outskirts of the city where she goes out to sell her cleaning products. Apart from this, she also sells foods every weekend. As one can see, she is a hardworking woman and, above all, she is very entrepreneurial. She is requesting for this loan in order to buy ingredients to such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and others in order to make the food that she sells. 

They are thankful for the opportunity that they have received to grow and to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her mid forties, is a divorcee and takes care of her four children. Her children are at school. For six years now, Joyce has made her living by running a business selling home products: utensils. She opens her business from 08am to 07pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Joyce is requesting for a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy utensils to resell. She dreams of opening a successful project and making her family's lives better. Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "ANTOKIA", which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy utensils to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee and purchase educational equipment for her oldest daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to purchase educational equipment.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos (de 15, 2 años y gemelos de 17 años de edad) viven en casa que pudo adquirir hace 7 años por una institución benéfica. José es albañil y su esposa se dedica al cuido de los hijos y el quehacer del hogar, trabajo muy pesado y nada remunerado. La vivienda de José es pequeña para su grupo familiar pero él cerró con lámina galvanizada el corredor de la vivienda y a su vez amplio al frente de la misma construyendo una galera con lámina y madera, así ocupar este espacio como corredor. Por lo anterior José ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el cemento, arena, grava, hierro, bloque de concreto para sustituir la pared de lámina existente y construir con material más resistente y permanente, que le dará mayor durabilidad y seguridad. La fotografía muestra parte de la pared de lámina existente que sustituirá.
texts.en: José is 41 and lives with his wife and their four children, who are 15, 2 and twins aged 17. They live in a house he was able to buy 7 years ago, thanks to a charity organisation. José is a bricklayer, and his wife takes care of the children and the housework, which is both hard and completely unpaid. José's house is small for his family, but he has closed off the corridor with galvanised sheeting and opened up the front, making a gallery out of galvanised sheet and wood, which means they can use this space as a corridor. This is why José has asked for a loan through FUSAI: in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and concrete blocks to replace the existing galvanised sheet wall and to build a stronger and more permanent one that will provide more durability and security. The photo shows part of the existing galvanised wall that he is going to replace.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and concrete blocks to erect a wall that is currently made of galvanised sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala. She is married with two children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (a sister). 

Sarah operates a mobile money and telephone accessories business, on both retail and wholesale basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last 25 years. She works seven days week. She has requested for a loan from MCDT SACCO of Ugandan shillings 2,000,000 to buy phones, chargers, batteries and airtime. Her major business challenge is electricity and unstable mobile networks. 

Sarah's aspiration is to own a fully owned phone accessories shop and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy more phones, chargers, batteries and airtime.

loans.name: Adona

texts.en:
Adona help her husband by managing their transportation services while he works as a carpenter. In her income generated from this business, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. In order to replace the old used tires, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy tires.

Adona plans to have an additional tricycle to gain more income for the better future of her children.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie's greatest dream in life is to educate her children to their college level and to get a better and stable job someday. Through her retailing business, Lorelie can provide for her children's daily expenditures going to school. She is happy because, even in a simple way, she will help her husband in carrying the burden of their family's needs. 

Lorelie husband is engaged in a hair cutting business. Together, their incomes are providing for their children’s education. Lorelie wants to extend the products she sells to her customers so that she will retain them as regular customers. 

Lorelie is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy drinks and grocery items to sell. Lorelie hopes to maintain the business, extend the products she sells and increase her customers as well as her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy drinks and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 60 years old.  He is married and blessed with five children. He had many experiences in order to sustain their living. 

Alfredo provides for the family by his fishing business, and he earns well from this, the main source of income. He has been running this business for many years.  

He took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy new nets to be used for fishing. He plans to save a portion of his income for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 43 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She also grows cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Jane will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful farmer.

loans.use: buy seedlings and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a farm where he grows maize. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His primary customers are other farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of rain. 

Patrick will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. His business goal is to be a country wide supplier of maize within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will save money for school fees for his children. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more acres of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is now requesting a loan to purchase beans, maize, and rice for her cereal selling business .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize, and rice for resale

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Philip is married and has six children.  He is a photographer and he undertakes farming with his wife as well. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, sunflower, bananas and oranges. Philip is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some additional income as well as provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Philip’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his business. Philip’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Emorgelia

texts.es: Emorgelia, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada, tiene tres hijos, vive en el municipio de San Rafael Lempira, Ella se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 14 años, el cual logra vender en la misma zona, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual invertirá en fertilizantes, foliares e insumos para el cultivo de café. su sueño es ser gran productora de café y lograr ingresos para que no le falte nada  a su familia.
texts.en: Emorgelia, 56, is married, has three children and lives in the San Rafael Lempira municipality. She has made a living farming coffee for the past 14 years, which she is able to sell in the same area. Before, she used to only plant corn and beans. She has applied for a third loan cycle for 15,000 Lempiras which she will invest in leaf fertilizers and inputs for the farming of coffee. Her dream is to be a large coffee producer and achieve incomes so that her family is never missing anything.

loans.use: purchase leaf fertilizers and inputs for the farming of coffee.

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
Charmaine, 20 years old, lives happily with her parents in Zaragoza, Nueva Ecija. Despite her young age, she envisions a better life for her family. Charmaine knows that earning a college diploma will open better opportunities for her future career and a better career will enable her to achieve her dreams for her family. 
 
She wants to take up Education, because she loves teaching and she wishes to work in schools someday. Thus, she is requesting for financial support to KIVA thru ASKI to pay for her tuition fees. An educational loan of PHP 40,000 will surely help her to go and finish college for her brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 37 лет, вдова, 2 детей школьного возраста. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Жылдыз- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2000 году с 40,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жылдыз, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 дойные коровы и 10 овец. Также имеется 2,80 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Дополнительно Жылдыз ежедневно реализует молоко, сельхоз продукцию и скот. Также Жылдыз занимается заготовкой и перепродажей сезонных овощей и фруктов. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) для закупки породистых дойных коров. Жылдыз намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в покупку квартиры.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 37 years old, a widow, and has two children of school age. The children help their mother actively with the household. Zhyldyz has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started in 2000 with 40,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to the purposefulness and hard work of Zhyldyz, she currently has two dairy cows and ten sheep. She also has 2.80 hectares of land on which she every year grows potatoes, field crops and sainfoin. In addition, Zhyldyz sells milk, agricultural products and meat. Zhyldyz also harvests and sells seasonal fruit and vegetables. The total monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her farm, Zhyldyz turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase purebread daily cows. Zhyldyz intends to increase the number of livestock which will lead to an increase in the family's capital. Zhyldyz plans to invest the income from the loan in purchasing an apartment.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Solidarias En Accion Group

texts.es:
El g.s.  Mujeres Solidarias En acción está conformada por tres integrantes, dos mujeres y un hombre solteros con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron terminar sus estudios, en la actualidad luchan, día día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante,la cordinadora es Maria y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, como: mochilas, CD, pantalones, shores, faldas, blusas, ropa de cama, piyamas, sandalias, perfumes. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa y mercadería en general, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.G.S Mujeres Solidarias en Acción agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Mujeres Solidarias En Acción” (Caring Women in Action) consists of three members, two women and one man. They are responsible for eight children among them. The members are originally from Carazo, a place that is located in the central part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy being around their children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, the members were not able to finish their studies. They currently strive each day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, the leader, Maria, one of the borrowers has a business of selling general merchandise such as trousers, shorts, skirts, blouses, bedding, pajamas, sandals, and perfumes. She devotes approximately 12 hours a day to her business by offering her products. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling clothes and general merchandise. In the near future, she would like to earn more income.

The solidarity group “Mujeres Solidarias En Acción” appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, skirts, blouses, bedding, pajamas, sandals, and perfumes.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 2 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO TONAFA 2 est un groupement de huit personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement du nom de Marie (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 51 ans est veuve. Marie a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et aucun a sa charge.  Marie vit seule et assure ses différentes charges. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, dame Marie vend de l’akassa pâte à base de maïs fermenté). Marie exerce cette activité passionnément. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marie ensemble avec les membres du groupement GBENONKPO TONAFA 2 sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gbenonkpo Tonafa 2 is a group of eight people, who are friends and live in the same area. The representative of the group is named Marie (she has her hand raised in the photo). She is 51 years old and a widow. She has three children, who all go to school and are not under her care. She lives alone and must support her various expenses.

To support her needs, Marie sells akassa [a thick cornmeal porridge]. She is passionate about this work. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

In order to meet her customer's needs, Marie, together with the other members of the Gbenonkpo Tonafa 2 group, are seeking their seventh loan with Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Maria Mel

texts.en: Maria Mel owns and operates her retail store to earn a living. With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying rice for sale. She found a way to earn more income so she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. Maria Mel hopes to use the generated income for the business’ expansion and most of all, to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rey Soilo

texts.es: El señor Rey es una persona sencilla, honesta y muy trabajadora proviene de una familia humilde, está casado con la señora Julia, con la cual tiene 2 hijos , desde que era muy joven comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, ya que su familia era de pocos recursos económicos solo alcanzo el nivel de educación primaria, actualmente tiene una pequeña casa y está realizando la actividad de servicio de transporte de pasajeros en la provincia de Quillacollo, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino( para la producción de leche) y a la producción de porcinos( venta de lechones). El crédito que está solicitando actualmente es para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, de esta forma lograra mejorar el servicio que brinda y podra obtener mayores ingresos para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Rey is a simple, honest person. He is very hardworking and comes from a humble family. He is married to Julia, with whom he has 2 children. Ever since he was very young he began to work at different businesses. Since his family was very low-income, he only reached the level of an elementary education.

Currently, he has a small house and is doing business providing passenger service in the city of Quillacollo. His wife works in raising bovine cattle (for milk production) and porcine production (to sell piglets).  The loan he is requesting is for maintenance and repair of his vehicle, so he can improve the service he offers and earn more income to benefit his family.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 33-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sell. She also rears pigs and grows cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Hellen's business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy animal feed and pay for farm labor. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Yhuly Marcela

texts.es:
Yhuly es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 31 años de edad, 8 de ellos dedicados a trabajar de manera independiente, desempeñando actividades en el campo de la confección. Inició su propio taller en compañía de su esposo y, poco a poco fueron aumentando su capacidad instalada y su taller creció al punto de tener el apoyo de 5 operarios directos y muy buena  clientela.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina de doble aguja, con la que podrá optimizar su tiempo de trabajo y cumplir con las entregas de pedidos de manera oportuna, así podrá obtener contratos más grandes y aumentar los ingresos para su familia.
Yhuly manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su taller y obtener mayor número de clientes, así tendrá mayor rentabilidad y podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yhuly is a strong and hard working woman of 31 years, 8 of them dedicated to working independently performing activities in the clothing industry. She started her own workshop with the company of her husband and gradually increased their capacity. The workshop grew to the point of having 5 direct support workers and very good clientele. 

The credit request will be invested in the purchase of a double needle machine, with which you can optimize your work time and meet deliveries of orders in a timely manner, so you can get larger contracts and increase revenue for your family. 
Yhuly said that her greatest desire is to expand her workshop and get more clients and have higher profitability to provide better welfare and quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a double needle sewing machine

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia, estudio hasta 4 grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ella ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios y decidió dedicarse al comercio. Ella actualmente tiene una tienda de venta de granos básicos, y una cafetería. 

Ella tiene una tienda de venta de granos básicos, desde hace 20 años, trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, despachando a sus clientes, ella a parte de esto tiene una cafetería que se la atiende otra hija en el centro del pueblo, y es así como ella obtiene sus ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar granos básicos para vender y desea comprar más de todo el producto que ella vende.

sus sueños es tener un buen negocio fuerte establecido que le permita generar sus ingresos diariamente, ya que ella tiene un mercado potencial al cual ella le vende productos de la canasta básica,
texts.en:
Fidelia studied up to the 4th grade, but due to financial reasons she was unable to continue her studies and decided to engage in commerce. Currently she has a cafeteria and store where she sells bulk grains. 

She has had the grain store for 20 years. She works from 6 in the morning until 7 at night taking care of her customers. She also has a cafeteria in the center of town, which is tended to by her daughter. This is how she earns her income to raise her family. She is asking CREDICAMPO for a loan so she can buy bulk grains to sell; she wants to buy more of all the things she sells. 

Her dream is to have a good, well-established business, generating income every day since she has the potential to sell basic products to a market.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pacanal I, B1 Group

texts.es: Juan tiene 46 años de edad (en la foto aparece de primero de izquierda a derecha, viste playera color limón con mangas azules) tiene 4 hijos, el primero tiene 25 años de edad, ya esta casado, el segundo tiene 17 años de edad estudia cuarto perito contador, el tercero tiene 14 años de edad esta en primero básico y el último tiene 10 años de edad estudia quinto primaria, obtiene sus ingresos en la venta de hojas de maxán, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 40 años, la heredó de su padres, solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para el mantenimiento de maxán, le gustar realizar esta actividad por no lleva químico y es amigable con el medio ambiente, Juan en el futuro tiene planeado sembrar más matas de maxán.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 (in the picture he appears first from left to right, wearing a lime green shirt with blue sleeves) and has 4 sons. His oldest is 25 and married, the second is 17 and studying to be an accountant, his third is 14 and in 7th grade and the last one is 10 and he is in 5th grade.

He earns his income selling maxán leafs and has been doing so since he was 40. He inherited the trade from his parents and is asking for a loan to purchase materials for the maintenance of the maxán crop. He likes doing this activity because it does not require chemicals and is environmentally friendly. In the future, Juan is planning to plant more maxán plants.

loans.use: Buy materials for the maintenance of maxán crops

loans.name: Maria Mayela

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia en donde también vive uno de sus hijos su compañera de vida y un nieto. En total en su casa habitan 5 personas. María trabaja en la prestación de servicio domestico y su esposo es un pequeño agricultor, además María recibe el apoyo económico de su hijo para los gastos necesarios de su hogar. María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar e instalar las ventanas de su vivienda que como se aprecia en la fotografía solo tiene las defensas. María con el apoyo de los demás miembros de su familia pagará las cuotas que este crédito implica así, adquirirá otro crédito más adelante para repellar las paredes de su casa y realizar otras mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her husband in their own home where one of her sons also lives with his life partner and a grandchild. In total, 5 people live at her house. Maria works as a housekeeper and her husband is a small farmer, additionally María receives the economic support of her son for the necessary expenses of the home.
Maria has requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase and install the windows of her home which, as can be seen in the photograph, has only the defenses. Maria, with the support of the rest of the members of her family, will pay the installments that this credit implies. In the future she will acquire another loan in order to plaster the walls of her house and perform other improvements to her residence.

loans.use: purchase and install her home's windows.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raul tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeño nieto. Raul es agricultor, toda su vida ha trabajado cultivando la tierra y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Raul desea mejorar las condiciones de la cocina por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, lámina y madera para reparar el techo y construir los pilares de la cocina.
texts.en: Raul is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and young grandson. He is a farmer, and has spent his whole life working the land, which is how he supports his household. Raul wishes to improve his home's kitchen, which is why he decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which he will invest in purchasing cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and wood to repair the roof and build supports for the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and wood to repair the roof and build supports for his kitchen.

loans.name: Sumaq Causay De Acorcona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAQ CAUSAY DE ACORCONA”; Este banco se ubicado en el sector de Acorcona  en el distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yobana ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos, paltas y café, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar platanos, paltas y café.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cafe, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank "Sumaq Causay de Acorcona". The bank is located in the Acorcona area of the Vilcabamba district in the Cusco department. Yobana is a member of the group. She is 31 years old and is in a civil union with two children. She works in her fruit selling business. She sells bananas, avocados, and coffee from a stall she has at the market and it is going very well. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and she has had her business for seven years. Her dream s to have a storefront where she can sell fruit. She is requesting this loan to buy bananas, avocados, and coffee.

The other members make their living selling coffee, fruit, groceries, and meals. The group member thanks those who have have been a part of this dream through this medium and she commits to making her payments according to the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy bananas, avocados, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pruning shears, seeds, herbicides, shade trees, and also to pay for labor.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso is 35 years old. She is a kind woman. Tonijiso is married and has 3 children. Two of them are schoolboys. Her husband is a migrant in Russia because he can't find a job in Tajikistan. 

Tojiniso is the main food provider for her family.  She runs a sewing business. Tojiniso sews women's dresses. She has been busy with this business for more than 7 years. Tojiniso also sews curtains. She has a workshop in a local market, so she has a lot of customers due to the location.  

She needs financial support now, because her husband is needs to go to Russia, but he doesn't have money to buy an airline ticket. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 TJS to buy an airline ticket to Russia for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy  an airline ticket to Russia for her husband

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael lives in Kampala. She is married and has five children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days week. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is rainy season and transportation. 

Her aspiration is to buy a delivery van to facilitate transportation and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El señor Luis Antonio es una persona muy luchadora para con su negocio, desde hace varios años desde que lo jubilaron lo estableció en el barrio Arnoldo Alemán, el cual le dado muy buenos resultados debido a la gentil manera de tratar a sus clientes. Don Luis ha procreados dos hijas con su luchadora esposa y juntos han salido adelante con los ingresos percibidos de dicho negocio y su jubilación, ambos se han esforzado por sacar adelante a sus hijas que estudian secundaria en un colegio público. Luis tiene el deseo de invertir en su pequeño negocio ya que la demanda de sus productos ha crecido, solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijol, maíz, azúcar, huevos, sal, café, carne de res, carne de pollo, y diferente tipo de frutas, las cuales son los alimentos básicos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Antonio is a person who fights hard for his business, which he established several years ago in the Arnoldo Alemán neighborhood, when he retired. It has given him very good results due to the courteous way in which he treats his customers. Don Luis has two daughters with his determined wife and together they have moved forward with the income received from said business and his retirement. Both have made an effort to improve the lives of their daughters, who study in a public high school. 

Luis hopes to invest in his small business since the demand for his products has increased, and so he is applying for the loan in order to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, eggs, salt, coffee, beef, chicken, and different types of fruit, which are the basic foods requested by his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, eggs, salt, coffee, beef, chicken and different types of fruit.

loans.name: Nueva Luz De Poromate Group

texts.es: Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Poromate” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la comuniad de Poromate del distrito de Vilcabamba de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú. Egidia tiene 52 años y es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica es la agricultura donde tiene plantaciones de café, cacao, coca y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, lima, mandarina y limón. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Nueva Luz de Poromate" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. They live in the Poromate community in the Vilcabamba district of La Convención province, Cusco, Peru. 

Egidia is a hard working and enterprising 52-year-old woman who is getting her family ahead. Her business is agriculture, and she has crops of coffee, cocoa, coca and citrus fruit like oranges, limes, mandarins and lemons. At this time she needs the loan to buy fertilizers. 

The other members raise livestock, grow crops, sell food, raise small animals and others provide professional services. The partners are very grateful to those who are part of this dream through these means and are committed to meeting their repayments in the time established.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda  has been earning an income from farming. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to establish a farm plot. Aside from this, she is engaged in a retail business selling grocery goods in her village. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en: Donisa has been in her piggery business for many years, and she earns well for the family. With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her piggery business. Recently, she wanted to buy more pigs to raise, and she took a loan to buy additional piglets. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family, as well as her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia grows and harvests corn, work that she has done since she got married. Her husband also works with her on their farm since it is the only way they have to move the family forward. She gets up early to go into the fields where she oversees her crops. 

Because she needs to improve her farm's output, Amalia is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and be able to give her children the education she did not have. Amalia is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Miramar Group

texts.es:
El joven Delmi Anibal, tiene 28 años de edad,  es soltero, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una comunidad que pertenece a Cofradía, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de maíz, frijoles, hortalizas y café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona. El solicita ya el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 13,000 Lempiras en forma grupal, con el cual va comprar abonos para asistir a sus cultivos de granos básicos, hortalizas y café, y poder sacar mejor cosecha.
El grupo se llama Miramar, que esta integrado por 7 personas que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 67,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en la compra de abonos para darle asistencia a sus cultivos de granos básicos, hortalizas y café con el fin de sacar buenas cosechas. En la foto a la izquierda esta el Sr. Delmi Aníbal, Lázaro, José Francisco, Oscar, José Nelson, Joaquín y Jose Alonso a la derecha.
texts.en:
Delmi Anibal, 28, is single and has three children. He lives in a community that is part of Cofradía, Cortes. He has always worked in farming corn, beans, vegetables, and coffee. He sells these crops at the market in the area. He is requesting his third loan of 13,000 HNL as part of a group. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer to help her crops of basic grains, vegetables, and coffee. This will give him a better harvest.

The group is Miramar, which is comprised of seven members who work in agriculture and live in the same community. This group loan is for 67,000 HNL and it will be invested in buying fertilizer to help crops of basic grains, vegetables, and coffee in order to gain better crops. In the photo, on the left is Delmi Anibal, Lázaro, José Francisco, Oscar, José Nelson, Joaquín and Jose Alonso on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help his crops of basic grains, vegetables, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking fat, sugar, rice, and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has three school going children. The family lives in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married Palestinian Refugee, who established his convenience store a year ago, and has two years of experience in this domain. His wife doesn't work, so he works hard to provide her with the necessary living needs, and to develop and expand his current business.

Mohamad is a hard worker who puts so a lot of effort in developing his business since most Palestinians are suffering from the limited access to several working sectors in Lebanon.

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special summer beverages and special offer products that will increase his sales and income. 

Mohamad hopes to develop his business properly and open an additional business to generate extra income in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special offer products, summer beverages, and requested items

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadija lives in Kampala. She is married and has two children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells second hand clothes on a retail basis in the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, and works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality and thieves. 

Her aspiration is to build a residential house and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, está integrado por 16 mujeres muy emprendedoras, que a través del esfuerzo en conjunto y por medio de las capacitaciones han ido mejorado.
La Sra. Gisenia es parte de este luchador grupo, se dedica a vender prendas variadas en forma ambulante, y por medio de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ella da a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar variedad de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa.  It is comprised of 16 very enterprising women.  Through their joint effort and the training they have been improving.

Gisenia is part of this tenacious group.  She sells various clothes in an itinerant manner.  Through her effort she is getting ahead.  She gives her family everything that she was not able to have so that they do not have to do without the necessities.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy a variety of clothes for winter.  The cold season is approaching, and she wants to be able to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell for winter.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella tiene un restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Erika works selling food.  She has a restaurant.  She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soup and sliced beef.  She works from 8am to 6pm and has 8 years of experience in this business.  It is going well.  Her dream is to continue expanding her restaurant.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase produce for cooking like rice, vegetables and chicken.  She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Felipa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Si de herramientas se trata, la ferretería de Felipa está completamente surtida de los materiales necesarios para construir, reparar o realizar obras de albañilería. Ella y su esposo tuvieron la idea de establecer su propio negocio y a través de préstamos personales  fueron  creciendo,  hasta convertirse  en una reconocida  tienda de artículos ferreteros.  Sus buenas ventas son producto de su esfuerzo, optimismo, visión y  excelente administración. 
Felipa desea mantener  este ritmo de ventas y  por supuesto, ofrecerles  a sus clientes la mejor calidad en los productos ferreteros de su tienda. Ella solicitó un financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito, con el fin de invertir en la compra de artículos tales como: Martillos, clavos, llaves para plomería entre otros.  En el futuro, planea abrir una sucursal  en su ciudad de origen, ya que el negocio actualmente se encuentra  establecido en la capital.
texts.en:
If it’s about tools, Felipa’s hardware business is completely stocked with the materials needed to build, repair, or carry out bricklaying jobs.  She and her husband had the idea to establish their own business.  Through personal loans they were growing until they became a well-known store for hardware items.  Her good sales are a product of her effort, optimism, vision, and excellent administration.

Felipa wishes to maintain this sales rhythm, and, of course, offer her customers the best quality of hardware products in her store.

She requested a Kiva loan from MiCrédito in order to buy items like hammers, nails, and plumber’s wrenches, among others.  In the future she plans to open a branch in the city that she is from because the business is currently located in the capital.

loans.use: to buy items like hammers, nails, and plumber’s wrenches, among others.

loans.name: Zhamal

texts.ru: Жамал 39 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Жамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1992 году с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день у Жамал есть: 4 дойные коровы, 12 овец, 8 коз и 1 лошадь. Также Жамал ежедневно реализует молоко и молочную продукцию. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров и овец для увеличения поголовья скота, что непременно приведет к улучшению благосостояния семьи. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в постройку нового дома.
texts.en: Zhamal is a 39 year old married mother of three. Her children actively help her farm. Zhamal has a secondary education and is the main breadwinner for her family, she is engaged in animal husbandry which she began in 1992 by buying cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Today Zhamal has four dairy cows, twelve sheep, eight goats and one horse. Zhamal also sells milk and dairy products daily. Her monthly gross income is about 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Zhamal is asking Bank "Bau-Tushum" for a loan of the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and sheep for breeding, which will certainly improve the welfare of her family. With the income generated from the loan Zhamal plans to invest in construction of a new house.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos estudio hasta primer grado, ella era una de las mayores y tenia que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar para mantener el hogar, esta divorciada porque su esposo se fue para los Estados Unidos y los abandono, vive con su hija y un nieto, porque su hijo mayor ya se acompaño.

Rosa actualmente tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa y lo ha hecho desde hace 10 años, ademas vende tortillas tiene 2 puestos uno lo atiende su hija y el otro ella, horario de trabajo no tiene pues se levanta, muy temprano y termina por la tarde hasta que terminan de llegar clientes a comprar.

El dinero del préstamo sera invertido en comprar maíz para elaborar las pupusas, porque si compra por mayor se sale mas barato, ademas invertirá en la tienda, ya que hay momentos en los cuales no vende por no tener suficiente mercadería.


Los sueños de Rosa son tener una mejor vivienda de la que ahora tiene, por darle lo necesario a sus hijos para que no sufran lo mismo que ella, tener una tienda mas grande  y así obtener mayores ganancias, sabe que es un reto pero con la ayuda de Dios lo podrá hacer posible.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old. due to lack of financial resources she only studied up to Grade 1. She was one of the older children and had to help her parents support the household. She is divorced. Her husband left for the USA and abandoned her. She lives with a daughter and a grandchild as her older son is married.

Rosa has a store which sells basic food items in her house. She has had this for 10 years. She also sells tortillas. She has two stands one her daughter cares for and she takes care of the other. She has no set work schedule as she gets up very early and finishes in the evening when the customers have done their buying.

The money from the loan will be invested in buying corn to make tortillas. If she buys a lot the price is lower. She will also invest in her store as at times she has no sales due to a lack of product in her store.

Rosa's dreams are to have a better house that what she now has. She wants to provide for her children and not have them suffer like she did. She wants to expand her store and make more money. she knows that it is a challenge but with the help of God she knows it is possible.

loans.use: to buy corn to make pupusas

loans.name: Abispa Group

texts.es:
Maribel: Es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas, una menor de edad y una adolescente de 12 años, que cursa su quinto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 3 meses estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende granos básicos, pan, toalla sanitaria entre otros. Solicita su primer crédito para incrementar y diversificar su mercadería. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y construir su propia vivienda, ya que en la que reside actualmente es de una tía que se encuentra en el extranjero.

Daisy: Tiene 2 hijos.  Desde hace un año, es vendedora ambulante de ropa usada. Solicita su primer crédito para comprar una paca mixta (ropa para varón y mujer) de ropa usada. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, acondicionar y mejorar su vivienda: repellarla, instalar cerámica y construir las divisiones de los cuartos y fosa séptica, para contar con inodoro.

Damaris Teresa: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 menores de edad. Desde hace 4 meses instaló su pequeño negocio de venta de bastimentos, frijoles cocidos y tortillas. Solicita su primer crédoto para comprar más insumos que utiliza en su negocio, entre estos: frijoles, carbón, queso, plátanos, yuca, bananos, pilipitas, quequisque, malanga, cebollas, tomates, chiltomas. Su sueño es poder comprar una estufa (cocina de gas), ya que actualmente utiliza un barril de metal donde cocina los frijoles y tortillas; también sueña poder tener un local con mejores condiciones de trabajo y atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maribel: She is a single mother of 2 daughters, one of them is a 12-year-old teenage girl, studying 5th grade, and the other one is younger. Wanting to have her own source of income, she set up a small grocery store 3 months ago, where she sells basic grains, bread and toilet paper among other products. She is requesting her first loan to increase and diversify the products she sells. Her dream is for her business to grow and to build her own home, since the house where she lives now belongs to an aunt who is currently abroad.

Daisy: She has 2 children. As of 1 year ago, she is an itinerant vendor of second-hand clothes. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bale of mixed second-hand clothes (both men’s and women’s clothes). Her dream is for her business to grow, and to improve her house: to plaster the walls, install ceramics and build divisions for the rooms and the septic tank, in order to have a bathroom.

Damaris Teresa: She is originally from Puerto Cabezas, she is 28 years old and is a single mother with 2 young children. Four months ago, she began a small business selling clothes, cooked beans and tortillas. She is requesting her first loan to buy more inputs to use in her business, such as: beans, coal, cheese, sweet potatoes, bananas, yucca, onions, tomatoes. Her dream is to be able to buy a gas cooking stove, since she is now using a metal barrel. She also dreams of having a store with better work conditions and better facilities for her customers.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns and operates a general store, and sells a variety of different products to earn a living. For many years she has operated this business and was able to repay her previous loan that was used successfully for the business. 

She wants to improve sales due to her family's increasing needs. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Leokadia

texts.en:
Leokadia lives in Kampala. She is married with four children, two of whom go school. She takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She operates a pub from the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO of Ugandan shillings 800,000 to buy crates of beer, sodas, spirits and local brew. 

Leokadia's major business challenges are electricity and  defaulters. Her aspiration is to buy a new fridge and tables for her pub so as to serve customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, sodas, spirits and local brew.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 51 años de edad vive con su esposo junto a sus cuatro hijos que aun dependen del cuido de ellos. Graciela se dedica a vender productos de belleza y su esposo es un albañil reconocido en el lugar que habitan. La vivienda de Graciela está construida de adobe y hace su esposo pudo hacer la instalación interna para la luz eléctrica (ver fotografía). Graciela quiere repellar las paredes de su vivienda sabe que en el adobe puede esconderse la chinque y que las picadas de este insecto podría enfermar a toda su familia. Además como el dinero que ella disponía ya lo ocupó para las instalaciones de red interna para la electricidad (cableado, tomas, interruptores eléctricos) ha quedado pendiente el trámite para la concexión eléctrica con la compañía que da el servicio a la zona. Por lo anterior Graciela ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el cemento, arena para el repello de las paredes de adobe y además tramitará la conexión eléctrica para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Graciela, 51 years old lives with her spouse together with their four children who are dependent of their care. Graciela sells beauty products for a living; her husband is a recognized mason in the local community. 

Her home is constructed from adobe and her husband was able to internally install the electric light (see photo). Graciela would like to repair and stucco the walls of her home to conceal the adobe and keep out “la chinque,” an insect whose bite could make the whole family sick.  In addition with the money she has already used for the internal electric network (cables, outlets, power switches) just leaving behind the next step, which is to pay for and and set up an electrical connection with the company that provides service to the area.

For the former, Graciela is asking for a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, and sand to repair and stucco the adobe walls, and also set up an electrical connection for her home.

loans.use: To purchase cement, and sand to stucco the adobe walls, and also set up an electrical connection for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more frozen foods and processed foods needed for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, a mother of one, has managed a general store for a year and she earns a good income to support her child. She has sustained the business with her hard work.  

She is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  

In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella, a mother of one, has managed a general store for eleven years and she earns well to supplement her husband’s income. She has sustained her business with the support of the entire family. Her husband earns an income from his transportation services. The couple wants to provide a better education to their child so she had to work more for it. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for solar lighting systems

loans.name: Bhagya Laxmi Mahila Swa Sahaya Sangh Group

texts.en:
Ujavala is 43 years old and lives in Chinchali village, Raibag, Belgaum. She is an illiterate woman. She is married and has two children. Her son is studying in 11th grade, and her daughter got married. Her husband is a labourer in agriculture fields. They live in their own house, which was given by the government. 

Ujavala (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) has 20 years experience in animal husbandry, in particular goat rearing. She purchases a 1 or 2-month-old goat kid, and she rears it following all the requirements (veterinarian support, food, etc.) When the goat becomes 1 or 1½ years old, she sells it at a fair or weekly market. If she can sell it during festivals, she will make a better profit. For extra cash, Ujavala also works in agriculture fields for daily wages.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying one more goat kid and raising it. This enables her to generate income so that she can support her family in securing a better life. She hopes to save enough for her son’s education and make him well settled. She wants to see empowerment in her community in education, as well as economically. 

This is the first loan from Kiva for “Bhagya Laxmi Mahila SwaSahaya Sangh” Self-Help Group (SHG). Including Ujavala, there is a total of 19 members in this group. Ujavala leads this group; 12 members need loans for animal husbandry, 3 for petty shops, 1 for goat rearing, 1 for a cloth selling business and 1 for a cycle repair shop. They also are all daily-wage workers in agriculture fields.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old married father of two children who has been working selling and doing the necessary maintenance on motorcycles for nine years. He was only fourteen when he started working, since he had to quit school early to support his parents and earn his living. Today, Ali is running his own business in a well managed way so as to keep on developing it as much as he can. 

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special motorcycle spare parts and a newly released collection to keep his customers satisfied.

He hopes that in the future, he can stay capable of developing his business widely and increase his motorcycle selling capital through opening a special showroom.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special motorcycle spare parts and a newly released collection

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.en: Four years ago, Sanovbar began own business deal. She began her business with selling fruits. Little by little with the passing of time, she developed her business. Now, she sells fruits and vegetables in a store. Her store is located near a local bazaar. So, she begins her working day early, everyday. Sanovbar tries to develop business and to get enough income. She is bringing up three children. Her husband is a driver and helps Sanovbar with managing the business.  Sanovbar is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Aida Yolanda

texts.es: Aida, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro con su madre, hermano e hijos. Hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, el cual vende en la misma zona. Solicita el segundo préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y comprar semilla mejorada de maíz, ella espera mejorar la producción con esta inversión. Su plan es obtener mejores ingresos para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Aida is 28 years old. She is a single mother with three children and lives with them in the town of Morazán, Yoro with her mother and brother. She began cultivating corn five years ago in the same area. She is applying for a second loan of 5,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and improved maize seeds. Aida hopes to improve production with this investment. Her plan is to get better income to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved maize seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
This is Ruby, 47, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. Single, she works hard to provide for her everyday needs. She is also helping her family financially.

Ruby operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are sportswear and children's wear. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like sportswear and children's wear.

Ruby hopes to expand her business and help her siblings. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like sportswear and children's wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, flour, and dishes for her business.

loans.name: Ichsan

texts.en:
Ichsan runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for one year.  Ichsan lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Ichsan is married. As seen in the picture, Ichsan with his customer.

To increase the family income, Ichsan also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma four months ago to increase his income and feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Ichsan is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Ichsan is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer so he will be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using a printer

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 42-year-old, married father of three children, who puts so much effort to provide them with the best education, to make sure that they might benefit from a better future. Hassan has run his own bakery since 1995. He is specialized in preparing the traditional Lebanese Manakish (a folded dough served with different toppings upon customers' requests such as Thyme, Cheese...) He is well known in his region with the special products he serves, and prices he sets, and is recommended to others.

Today, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children’s increasing school tuition fees. This is his third loan acquired from Al Majmoua.  His previous loans where invested in developing his business and increasing its capital. He hopes to keep on developing his business to make sure that he can provide his family with almost everything they might need.

loans.use: to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en: Sanavbar is divorced. She is careful mother of a daughter. Her daughter is Aziza. Sanavbar is the only feed keeper of her daughter. She began her business deal with selling children’s clothes six years ago. At first, her working capital was 1,000 TJS. Little by little, she increased her working capital. Now, her working capital is 8,000 TJS. She sells children’s clothes in a local market and has regular customers. She runs the business well. She is going to buy children’s clothes for the new summer season, but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy children’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and purchase educational equipment.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 24-year-old, married father of one child who has been running his own grocery store for a year and a half, to provide his family with the necessary living needs. He is well-known in his region and his shop is located in a very attractive region, by the beach. For this reason, he has to keep his shop up to date upon customers' requests.

Samer is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase his business merchandise with special summer offers and ice cream that are highly requested by the beach visitors during the current and the coming summer season.

This is Samer's second experience as an Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development borrower. His previous loan was acquired for the same reason and it came with a very good income.

Samer hopes to develop his small store to a wider market in the future, where he can sell special beach needs and many other requested items.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special summer offers and ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Hace 47 años, Celestino se incorporó al mundo de la agricultura. Rodeado por un campo verde bendecido, donde año con año trabaja bajo la siembra de maíz y frijoles, que le permiten brindarles a sus seis hijos y a su esposa lo necesario para vivir bien.
Celestino tiene 61 años y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es por esto que diario se entrega con amor y pasión al trabajo con el cual fue honrado. Sin embargo, actualmente necesita de un préstamo de parte de KIVA -MiCrédito para la compra de abono y de alambres para mejorar los cercos para la próxima siembra de maíz y frijoles. Entre sus metas está, solicitar otro préstamo para incursionar en el mundo ganadero y comprar dos terneros para criarlos.
texts.en:
Celestino became a farmer 47 years ago. Surrounded by a blessed green field, he works year after year growing corn and beans, which allows him to provide his six children and his wife with what they need to live well.

Celestino is 61 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school. This is why he devotes himself daily with love and passion to the work that he is honored to do. 

However, currently he needs a loan from Kiva-Mi Credito in order to purchase manure, as well as wire to improve the fencing for the next corn and bean crop. Among his goals is to request another loan so that he can enter the livestock-raising business and buy two calves to raise.

loans.use: To buy manure, as well as wire for improving the fencing for the next corn and bean crop

loans.name: Risolat

texts.en: Risolat is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is a married parent of 2 children. Her children are little. With the aim to offer for her family all necessary things, she began her business. Risolat has been busy with this business more than 9 years. She sells children's clothes in a local market. Risolat every season renews the assortment of her goods because her customers demand fashionable clothes. Now, she is asking for a loan as she must buy children's clothes for a new summer season. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for new summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, such as thread, and to buy a showcase for storing them.

loans.name: Evid Antonio

texts.es: Evid es un experimentado hombre que ha hecho de las comidas rápidas su fuente de dinero y sostenimiento de su familia, trabaja básicamente los días jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos su principal deseo es poder reformar su hogar, brindarles a sus familiares mejores comodidades que ellos puedan disfrutar al máximo su juventud y vida rodeados de un hogar que les brinda. Se dedica a la venta de carnes asadas puntualmente las cuales son muy famosas por una salsa especial que le hecha, la cual es fabricada con un receta casera que le dejo su difunta madre, solicita un crédito para la adecuación de un nuevo local de venta y comprar surtido en cantidades para obtener una buena ganancia, siempre persiguiendo su sueño con sus familiares presente
texts.en:
Evid is a well-experienced man who has made fast food his source of income in order to sustain his family. He works primarily Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. 

His greatest desire is to fix up his home, bring his family greater comforts so that they can enjoy their youth and life within a home that offers them what they need. He makes a living selling barbecue, which are famous because of the special sauce that he adds to the meat. His sauce is made with a homemade recipe that his deceased mother left him. 

He is requesting a loan to fix up a new local and stock up on goods in order to receive a better income. He is always pursuing his dreams with his family around him.

loans.use: to renovate a new local and stock up to receive greater earnings.

loans.name: Linda Concha

texts.es: Doña Linda, de 74 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, y  vive con una hija actualmente en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa,Santa Barbara. Hace 5 años inicio con la venta de mercadería como es ropa variada para damas y niños, también lociones. Su venta es ambulante o por encargos. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos con lo cual ha mantenido esta actividad de negocio. Actualmente solicita otro por 3,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa como camisas, blusas, bóxer y lociones para aumentar el inventario y vender. Su plan es aumentar sus ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Linda is 74 years old and a single mother. She has two children and currently lives with a daughter in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.

Five years ago she started selling merchandise, such as a variety of women's and children's clothing, as well as lotions. She sells as a street vendor and through orders. 

She has requested various loans with which she has kept this business going. Now she is requesting another for 3,000 lempiras so that she can buy clothing such as shirts, blouses, underwear and lotions, in order to increase inventory and sales. Her plan is to increase her earnings so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as shirts, blouses, underwear and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saul, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Hace 15 años que se dedica a la produccion de café, el cual vende en grano en el mercado local. El préstamo es por 12,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar su finca de café y poder sacar mejor produccion. Su plan es mejorar la finca, obtener mejores ingresos y poder sembrar mas café para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Saul is 48 years old and married with two children. He lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. For fifteen years he has been growing coffee and selling the coffee beans at the local market. His loan is for 12,000 lempiras which will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to improve his coffee plantation so that he can be a better harvest. His plan is to improve the plantation, obtain greater earnings and plant more coffee to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee plantation and get a better harvest.

loans.name: Inka Raqay De Chahuaytire Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal INKA RAQAY DE CHAHUAYTIRE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa tiene 46 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, crianza de vacas, y venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank INKA RAQAY DE CHAHUAYTIRE.  The communal bank is located in the district of Pisac, the province of Calca, and the department of Cusco.  

The partner Luisa is 46 years old, has five children, and is single.  The partner alternates her daily activities with a business selling articles of clothing.  The partner has spent a lot of time making a living with this business which goes well thanks to the effort she puts into her business everyday.  The partner is a responsible and hard-working person.  The partner wishes to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.  The partner requests the loan in order to buy wool, among other things.  The partner feels grateful for the loan extended and commits to complying with the established fees.  

The other partners make their livings by raising small animals, raising cattle, and selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy wool among other things.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Kolaban est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que des Fruits et Légumes, Bois de chauffage, de la Restauration  etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix huitième prêt de groupe. 
Batoma est un membre du groupe Kolaban  assise au bout et à gauche, elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes (mangues, bananes, orange, Papayes, melons, etc.)  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des fruits et légumes en qualité et en quantité au fur et à mesure  qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kolaban comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Batoma  compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kolaban is the name of a group of women from the Sogomougou quarter of the town of Koutiala, who know each other well and who live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are aged 31 on average and have four children each.
