This group of women sell various goods, such as fruit and vegetables, firewood, food etc. To boost their business activities, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme. They are on their eighth loan. Batoma is a member of the Kolaban group, sitting at the bottom left of the photo. She sells fruit, vegetables (mangoes, bananas, orange, papayas, melons etc). She aims to use her loan in order to purchase quantities of good quality fruit and veg as she goes along. She sells them at retail to a mixed customer base, and procures her goods at the large market. 
Whereas the other members of the Kolaban group aim to generate an average profit of 90 000 CFA, on this cycle Mme Batoma aims to generate 105 000 FCFA. 
In addition to paying back her loans, she will use some of her revenue to meet her everyday needs and to boost her working capital.  The women would like to strengthen their relationship with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure that their inventory is never depleted.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Kabita Rani

texts.en:
Agriculture has been a prime source of livelihood in India for close to 60% of the population. India has one of the world’s largest productions of paddy crops in the world. Sometimes the marginalized people have land to grow but due to financial constraints, are not able to buy fertilizers, seeds, and irrigation facilities.

Kabita belongs to Kailashpur village in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal. Her husband usually goes out of the village in search of work. The current household income is not sufficient and with the daunting responsibilities that she will face in the future to finance their education, it is imperative that she exploits the land for paddy cultivation.
 
As a member of Parjit Self Help Group (SHG), Kabita is seeking a loan of INR 20,000 for her paddy cultivation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds etc. She expects to reap a profit of INR 50,000 per year. With her finances in place, she can expect to bring stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for paddy cultivation

loans.name: Mallika

texts.en:
Mallika, in her 50s, is mother of two sons. She was educated until the eighth grade. She has been associated with a Monimola Self-Help Group (SHG) for the past 12 years. She is running a tea shop in the village. She is supported by her husband and sons in this endeavor.

She hails from the village of Mahabbatnagar in West Bengal. The village lacks basic amenities like concrete houses, electricity, etc. But the village is rich in spirit and ideas. The local NGO Sabuj Sangha provides support to women in Sunderban region to contribute to the income of their families and improve the living standards.

Mallika will use the loan to buy a new stove, cylinder, chairs and raw material for her tea stall. This investment will increase the number of customers served and increase her earnings, which will help her to secure a good future for her family. 

Mallika wants to establish a big tea shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, cylinder, chairs and raw materials

loans.name: Sumati

texts.en:
Sumati, a woman in her 30s, is a graduate and has a wish to see her children grow in a healthy environment. In her family of four, her husband is the only earning member and both her daughter and son go to school. The income is not enough to meet the family’s expenditures.
 
She wants to take on paddy cultivation on their farm, which is currently mortgaged to the village landlord. Her only access to capital is from the village landlords at exorbitant rates. The landlords take the small land holdings of the borrowers as collateral. In case of non-repayment of loans with interest at the agreed tenure, the land holdings are taken by the landlords. This is huge strain on the families who already have lower income levels.
 
Sumati associated with “Chanchala” Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO called “Sabuj Sangha”. She is a native of the village of Nandakumarpur in West Bengal. Sumati will use the loan to repay her debt to the village landlord and free her land. On the land, she will do paddy cultivation, which will help her support her family’s income. The village has a large amount of agricultural land along with ponds and a river for cultivation.

Sabuj Sangha works in the field of women empowerment and provides them with necessary training to carry on various income-generating activities. Sumati wants to be a small entrepreneur and supplement her family’s income. Sumati thanks the investors for their humane perspective.

loans.use: to pay off a debt to regain her land

loans.name: Mahamaya Self-Help Group

texts.en:
The women of Mahamaya Self-Help Group are from the hinterlands of South 24 Parganas district, Mahabbatnagar village in West Bengal. They live in houses made of mud with mud-tiled roofing without access to electricity or clean drinking water. However, they’re working hard to overcome these anomalies. Radharani (face circled) is the leader of this group.

Radharani has tracts of cultivable paddy fields in the Mathurapur II Block of South 24 Parganas district of Sundarban region. The major part of the region is covered with agricultural land and ponds and the river flows close by the fields. With help from her family members, she is cultivating paddy. But the income generated is insufficient to support her family. Radharani wants to increase the productivity. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy better quality seeds and fertilizers.

Kanchan wants to start a fishery business. Anjali and Bandana want to invest in betel vine farms as the region has a huge demand for betel leaves.

loans.use: to buy better quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is married and the careful mother of three non-adult children. Gulchehra, as a responsible mother, began her business deal. For more than seven years, she has been busy with clothing sales. She sells children's clothes. There is a great demand for children's clothes in a local bazaar. She tries to offer high quality clothes to her customers. The business struggle is big in a local bazaar. She must buy children's clothes for the new summer season and with this aim, she is asking for a loan. Other businessmen already have renewed their assortment of goods. So, she must renew her assortment of goods quickly. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Anindita Self Help Group

texts.en:
Kanan (face circled) has been the leader of the Self Help Group (SHG) named Anindita for the last 17 years. 

This SHG is from Mahabbatnagar village in West Bengal.

Kanan, in her 30s, is the mother of two sons; both of them studying. She cultivates paddy with the help of her husband and sons. She wants to increase her cultivatable land to have higher earnings and fulfill her dreams of a more stable life.

Kanan will use this loan to buy high yield paddy seeds, pesticides and manure. She will also use the loan to increase the total cultivatable area. With this, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family and provide her sons with a platform for higher studies.

Kanan has admired her association with the group since her teens.

The group, in association with Sabuj Sangha, provides requisite knowledge, training and motivation to women to become independent.

loans.use: to buy high yield paddy seeds, pesticides and manure

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio es un señor de 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio populoso de Managua, se desempeña como contador en una empresa privada y su esposa es vendedora de cosméticos, don Sergio tiene  un hijo de 4 añitos, como todo padre desea darle las mejores condiciones de hogar por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales y construir e instalar el servicio higiénico, así garantizar la higiene de la familia .
texts.en: Sergio is a 46-year-old man.  He lives in a densely-populated district of Managua.  He serves as an accountant in a private business and his wife is a cosmetics salesperson.  Sergio has a four-year-old son. Like all fathers, he wants to provide the best household conditions. This is why he is requesting the loan to buy the materials and to construct and install a toilet, thereby guaranteeing the hygiene of the family.

loans.use: to buy cement, tiles, a toilet, pipes, and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, bread, juice, plantain, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some improvements to her day care like fixing the roof and the floor of the main room.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Abel Mauricio

texts.es:
Abel tiene 27 años de edad, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar; actualmente Abel ha sembrado  una hectárea de esparrago y por lo cual le da mucha atención y cuidado.

Abel esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes dar mantenimiento, entre otros y de esta manera poder tener un cultivo en buen estado para tener una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando y esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Poder tener un terreno propio”.
texts.en:
Abel is 27 years old and has been farming for 3 years, with which he can have income to pay his household expenses. Today he has planted a hectare of asparagus that he needs to tend and take care of.

Abel is thankful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his crops, in this way he will be able to have his crops in good shape resulting in a good harvest and the ability to keep working and working to make reality his great dream of being able to have his own land.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señorita Cristina  tiene 32 años y es casada,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en derecho en una de las universidades más reconocidas  de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Cristina trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja ayudando a su esposo ya que el es trasportista, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Cristina va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el pago de su titulación,  la Señorita Cristina enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Coqueni, su deseo es poder titularse lo antes posible para poder trabajar y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Cristina is 32 years old, married, and is studying for a career in law at one of the most well-known universities in La Paz. Cristina pays for her schooling by working helping her husband who works in public transportation. This is the first loan she has taken. Cristina is going to use this loan too pay degree certification expenses. Cristina encounters many challenges in her studies as her parents didn't have the economic resources to support her; having to work and study is very hard but she has the will to succeed and finish her studies and be able to practice her profession. They live in Coqueni zone. Her dream is to be able to graduate as soon as possible in order to be able to work and in this way have more income to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay degree certification expenses.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya lives with her husband in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. This will be Amalya’s second loan from Kiva for which she will be happy and thankful if she gets it. Amalya has a speciality as a nurse, and for 20 years she has worked at the Vanadzor Medical Center as a nurse. 

Simultaneously with her work, Amalya and her husband keep up with their small business. This is a business selling various things for the house; these can be towels, bedspreads, tableware, kitchen utensils, tea items, vases, souvenirs, etc. All these she sells at her own shop. She has a lot of regular customers who like her shop for its great and nice assortment and for Amalya’s kind and polite service. Amalya has two daughters, who are married and they live with their families.

Amalya needs a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to renew her shop assortment and also to buy some new souvenirs and accessories for house decorating.

loans.use: to renew her shop assortment and also to buy some new souvenirs and accessories for house decorating

loans.name: Eva Marcela

texts.es: La señora Eva tiene 25,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Eva va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Eva enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Eva is 25. She sells staple products in her neighborhood store, which is located in hr home in the Villa Copacabana area in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Eva is going to use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, such as produce, candies, cookies and a variety of beverages. Her reason for asking for this loan is that she needs to stock her store because there is a lot of demand at this time of year. Eva faces challenges in her business, such as the competition, because there are a lot of neighborhood stores in the area. She is going to use the profits to keep buying merchandise and thus increase her capital and be able to have a larger store, since this is one of her goals. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity that is being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is a hard-working woman with a kind nature. She has higher education and is a teacher in a local school, teaching lower grades. She has worked in a school for more than 40 years. 

Farogat has a small salary; that’s why she began an animal husbandry business some years ago. Farogat raises cows. She feeds them for several months and sells them in a local market. Her husband helps her with feeding cattle. Now, Farogat is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has five children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her largest monthly expense is school fees.

Maria has operated a coconut-selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman; she has eight school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mwanasha operates a cereal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Sulpukan

texts.ru: Сулпукан 69 лет, вдова, есть взрослый сын, он активно помогает матери по хозяйству. У Сулпукан среднее образование, на протяжении 21 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Сулпукан смогла развить свою деятельность до 1 дойной коровы, 1 теленка, 3 лошадей и 15 овец, что приносит ей прибыль в 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц от реализации молока, мяса и скота. Для содержания скота есть все условия, заготовлены корм и сено. Также у Сулпукан есть земельный надел, размером 2,40 ГА, где она выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сулпукан обратилась в Банк "Бай –Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита позволят Сулпукан расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Sulpukan is 69 years old. She has a grown-up son who actively helps his mother with her farm. Sulpukan has a secondary education. For the past 21 years, she has been practicing livestock breeding. She started this business with 5000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sulpukan's hard work, she has been able to develop her farm to include 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 3 horses and 15 sheep. This business brings in a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, meat and cattle. She has all of the necessary conditions to house cattle as well as feed and hay prepared. Sulpukan also has a 2.40 hectare plot of land on which she grows wheat, barley and potatoes for personal consumption and sale. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Sulpukan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She requested a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. The earnings from the loan will allow Sulpukan to expand her business and save money to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Hemos escuchado el dicho infinidad de veces que nunca te dejes llevar por las apariencias y María no es la excepción una ya veterana mujer que en muchas ocasiones pro su aspecto tan serio la tildan de una personal mala clase pero solo basta 30 segundos de conversar con esta mujer para sorprenderse y deleitarse de un carisma y una personalidad tan hermosa que hace de su negocio famosos no pro sus productos si no por la amabilidad y el manejo que tiene sobre los clientes, como es bien sabido la edad es un factor negativo a la hora de conseguir un empleo pero la determinación y verraquera de esta mujer no le permite quedarse en su hogar a solo esperar una ayuda o una colaboración ya que es autosuficiente para conseguir su propio bocado de comida con su esfuerzo. Atiende una papelería que ha ido posicionando poco a poco en el barrio y ahora necesita un crédito para surtirla y ofrecer más productos desde cuadernos, cartulina, colores, pegante, servicio de copiado, lapiceros entre otras cosas con esta ayuda María puede reformar su tienda y hacerla más atractiva para el publico
texts.en: We have repeatedly heard the old saying never judge by appearances (or never judge a book by its cover) and Maria is not an exception to this saying. She is an experienced woman who in many occasions has been so serious she is taken for being rude but after only 30 seconds of conversation with this woman one will be surprised and delighted by her charisma and beautiful personality that has made her business famous not only for her products but for her friendliness and customer service. It is well known that age is a negative factor when trying to get a job but the determination of this woman doesn't permit her to stay at home alone waiting for someone to help her. She is self-supporting and can feed herself through her efforts. She has a small office supply store that she has been positioning little by little in the neighborhood and now she needs a loan to stock it and offer more products, from notebooks, erasers, poster boards, color paper, boxes, photocopy service, pencil sharpeners and other items. With this help Maria can improve her store and make it more attractive to the public.

loans.use: to buy stock such as notebooks, erasers, poster boards, color paper, boxes, photocopy service and other items.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad. María es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas  desde hace 7 años. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas, para reparar parte del techo que se encuentra en mal estado y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, puertas, ventanas, lámina y polines.
texts.en: María is 54 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion who works in security. María is very hard working and she has been buying and selling fruit for 7 years. She wants to improve her home and so she has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying doors and windows, to repair the roof, which is in poor condition, and to put in a cement floor. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy cement, sand, gravel, doors, windows, sheeting and rods.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, doors, windows, sheeting, and rods to repair the roof and the floor in her home.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa is a 40-year-old refugee. He is married, has a son and two daughters, and the family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. He is a farmer and has been breeding up cows for 18 years. His monthly income is 230 AZN.

Husbandry is very spread in Azerbaijan. People buy cows and then fatten them. They produce milk and dairy products and sell those at local bazaar. 

Isa is a very responsible man and he does everything to cover family’s demands. But, unfortunately, his income doesn't cover full living cost and he has to increase income. He applied for 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy two new cows and improve the conditions of the stable for the cows.

loans.use: to buy two new cows and improve the conditions of the stable.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is from a rural area. She is a married and careful mother of three children. She lives with her family in the south of Tajikistan in a rural area. 

Eleven years ago Nargiz began a business selling children's clothes. She began this business with the support of her husband. Little by little during the eleven years, Nargiz developed her business. Now, she has her own selling place in a local market. 

Nargiz is going to buy children's clothes to increase her working capital. From the profits, she is going to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy children's clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children clothes to increase her working capital

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 31-year-old married woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be passionate. 

She operates a retail business where she cooks fried chicken to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a nice place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of chicken. 

Eunice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more chicken. 

Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: Artsvik

texts.en:
Artsvik lives in the village of Dvin in Ararat region. She lives with her son’s family. Artsvik has higher education and a specialty of pedagogy. She has unbelievably rich pedagogical experience of 38 years. She works at the village school as a teacher of elementary classes. 

Simultaneously with her teaching work, she is engaged in farming on her nice farm, cutely decorated with scarlet poppies. Her orchard is full of fruitful trees and the sweet smell of apricots, apples, peaches and grapes. For vegetables, she cultivates eggplants, tomatoes and beans. All these goods that she plants, waters, takes care of and protects from wind and bad weather, she sorts in their attic; some of her produce she uses for her family and the rest she sells to re-sellers. Artsvik also has 20 chickens and she sells eggs as well.

She wants to develop swine breeding on her farm and she asks for this loan in order to buy piglets. She will also use part of this loan to meet the costs of her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy piglets and cover agricultural costs

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda is 44 years old. She is a woman who has a great responsibility; she brings up five little children. Her husband is a farmer.

Ozoda also has been busy with an agriculture business. She has been busy with animal husbandry. Ozoda feeds cows and sheep. She has a cowshed in her house. She uses this cowshed for her animal husbandry business. Ozoda’s sons help her with managing the business. The only source of family income is from the agriculture business, so they live poor. 

Ozoda is going to increase her business and maximize profit. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Mourice

texts.en:
Mourice is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as jovial. He operates a retail business where he sells earrings, glasses, bangles and other items. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. 

Mourice will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of earrings, glasses and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of earrings, glasses and other items

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 21-year-old married woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

Violet operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have distributor shops within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a better business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркул 53 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. Вся семья активно и с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. Сама Чынаркул по характеру очень трудолювая, ответственная и целеустремленная. У нее- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи с 2005 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется собственный земельный надел, размером 1,45 ГА, где Чынаркул выращивает картофель под реализацию. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынаркул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Часть средств Чынаркул планирует потратить на весенне полевые работы. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Chynarkul is 53 years old, a widow, and a mother to 3 children. All of her family actively and gladly helps her with her farm. Chynarkul is very hardworking, responsible, and goal-driven by nature. She has a secondary education. As the main source of her income for family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2005 with the purchase of one cow. Thanks to Chynarkul's hard work, she currently has her own 1.45 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes for sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her farm, Chynarkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a bull calves to fatten up for future sale at the market for a high price. Chynarkul plans to spend a portion of the loan on spring sowing work. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan in future acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 39 years old and lives in the village Gugark in Lori region. Hamlet has a large family; he has five children: two daughters and three sons. His elder daughter is a student, one of his sons is in the army, one has graduated his school, and the other two children are still school-aged. 

His wife is unemployed and she takes care of their big family with numerous financial problems and needs. The only source of income for this family is from Hamlet’s small business. He buys crashed cars, repairs them, and resells them. One of his sons greatly helps him in his occupation. 

The income is not great, but covers the minimum needs of his family. His garage is rather famous in his small village and competitors are very few in his work. So his service is of great demand among his villagers. As he says, he dreams that all his children will manage to have higher education, so he is ready to work night and day to provide them with good future.
 
Hamlet asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) in order to buy spare parts for crashed cars to repair and sell them.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for crashed cars to repair and sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, irrigation, and pesticides).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother of six children; only one is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Rose has operated a grinding machine business at the market for the past 15 years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last 10 years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Misael Alexander

texts.es:
Misael joven ecuatoriano de 19 años de edad, oriundo de la ciudad de Latacunga , perteneciente a la provincia de  Cotopaxi, vive en casa de familiares desde hace varios años, es soltero, con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo terminar sus estudios secundarios, Misael es un muchacho muy emprendedor y trabajador él es un gran apoyo económico y moral para su familia, desde muy niño ha trabajado junto a sus padres en la crianza de animales menores y ganado vacuno, hoy en día Misael tiene su propia microempresa, la misma que se trata de la crianza y venta de cerdos de raza.  Para Misael no ha sido nada fácil superarse sin embargo él es un hombre emprendedor que no le ha importado ningún obstáculo desde muy pequeño aprendió a trabajar  debido a que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando.
A Misael le gusta mucho hacer deporte ya que esto le ayuda a mantenerse sano, hoy en día está solicitando un crédito el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de mas cerdos y una reproductora esto ayudará a incrementar sus gananacias debido a que sus ventas en los últimos meses han crecido, de esta manera crecerá la utilidad y por ende tendrán un mejor estilo de vida, es por esto que Misael agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Misael is 19 years old from the city of Latacunga, Ecuador, in Cotopaxi province. He has lived in a friend's house for a few years, he is single, and with sacrifice from his parents he was able to finish his secondary studies. Misael is a very hard-working and enterprising young man, a great economic support and support for his family. From a young age he has worked along side his father raising small animals and cattle. Today Misael has his own small business, where he raises and sells pigs. It hasn't been easy for Misael to succeed nevertheless he is an enterprising man that hasn't been stopped by any obstacle because as a young boy he learned how to work because of the lack of economic resources he couldn't continue on in school. Misael enjoys playing sports as this helps him stay healthy.

Today he seeks a loan to use in buying pigs and a female breeding pig that will help him increase his earnings because in the past few months his sales have grown. In this way he will grow his business and have a better quality of life. Therefore Misael thanks the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva to make it possible for his family and personal life to grow.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and a breeding female pig.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio en la venta de Hot Dog, pero hace un año decidió por vender mercadería como ropa variada, vende blusas, pantalones, camisetas, short, camisas etc. Esta mercadería es vendida de forma ambulante. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar ropa variada como blusas, pantalones, camisas, pantalones cortos y otra que le soliciten. Su sueño es ser gran empresario, darle lo mejor a su familia y lograr tener un local propio.
texts.en: Miguel is 32 years old. He is married and has a son, He lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. He has always been a merchant, selling hot dogs, but a year ago he decided to sell merchandise like a variety of clothing. He sells blouses, pants, shirts, shorts, etc. He sells the merchandise as a street vendor. He is asking for a second loan of 12,000 lempiras in order to buy a variety of clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and other things people ask him for. His dream is to be a great businessman and give his family the best and be able to have his own locale.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and others things people ask her for.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
Joana is 52 years old and lives with her family in a community called Teshie. She is married with three school-going children. 

Joana is a caterer who bakes bread and supplies customers. She works seven days a week starting at 7 a.m. and ending at 6 p.m. Joana supplies retailers, who then resell to community people, and she is paid instantly. 

Joana is requesting a loan of 1,000 GHS, which she will use to buy flour, margarine and sugar to bake bread for her customers. In the future, Joana wants to increase her customer base to make more profit. 

The Truth Group is made up of four people, who will receive a total of 4,000 GHS to invest in their respective businesses. They all have excellent repayment histories and are committed to continuing to improve their businesses and offer better products to their clients.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine and sugar to bake bread for her customers.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a 30-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a posho mill (a grinding machine) where he grinds maize to produce maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of maize. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize.

loans.name: Alga

texts.en:
Alga is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from three years to 10 years old. She describes herself to be hardworking and opportunistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft and shortage of stocks. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Duyshekan

texts.ru: Дуйшекан 58 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Дуйшекан высшее филологическое образование. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Дуйшекан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2003 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дуйшекан, в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок и 20 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от хозяйства позволили Дуйшекан вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, часть средств будет потрачено на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Дуйшекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также в будущем хочет сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Duyshekan is 58 years old, married, and has four children. Duyshekan has a higher education in the field of foreign languages. Her husband and her children help her with her farm. Her family is very close-knit and they have good relationships with one another. As an additional source of income for her family, Duyshekan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2003 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Duyshekan's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 bull calf and 20 sheep on her farm. This business brings in about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. The earnings from the farm allow Duyshekan to raise and provide for her children. For the purpose of the further development of her farm, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 120,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. A portion of the loan will be spent on purchasing sheep. Duyshekan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to make renovations to her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is still single with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, beans, sugar, an cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.ru: Сабине 24 года, замужем, 3 детей дошкольного возраста. У Сабины среднее образование. Она трудолюбива, ответственна и целеустремленна. Семья очень сплоченная, отношения в семье хорошие. Сабина в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2006 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сабины, в хозяйстве имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 12 овец, 8 коз и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, часть средств будет потрачено на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Сабина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также в будущем хочет построить большой сарай и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Sabina is 24 years old, married and has three toddlers. Sabina has a secondary education. She is hardworking, responsible and goal-driven. Her family is very close-knit and they have good relationships with one another. As an additional source of income for her family, Sabina practices livestock breeding. She started this business in 2006 with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sabina's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows, 12 sheep, 8 goats and 1 horse on her farm. For the purpose of the further development of her farm, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. A portion of the loan will be spent on the purchase of sheep. Sabina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to build a large barn and renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep.

loans.name: Hernándo Emilio

texts.es: Una rosa es quizás una de las formas más hermosos de expresar un sentimiento hacia un ser querido, también es una forma de pedir perdón, demostrar afecto o agrado hacia una mujer; pero en ocasiones desconocemos como provienen o el cuidado que se le da a este ya tradicional “regalo”, como saben las flores son cultivadas pero no solo es cuestión de plantarlas y esperar a que cosechen, el cuidado que se debe tener para generar un buen producto es gigante y acarrea muchos gastos es por esta razón que el señor Hernando un agricultor con más de 24 años de experiencia padre de 4 hijos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas los cuales tiene un alto costo desde pesticidas, fungicidas, larvicidas entre otros para poder seguir generando este bello producto que evidenciamos en la foto, de generar alegrías, amor y todos los sentimientos que depositamos a l ahora de regalar una flor
texts.en:
A rose is one of the most beautiful ways to express a feeling towards a loved one. It is also a way to apologize, show affection, or gratitude towards a woman. But sometimes, we don't know the origin or the care that goes into this traditional gift. It is known that it grows, but it is not just a matter of planting them and waiting for harvest. 

The care that is needed to have a good product is gigantic and it has a lot of costs. That is why Hernando is a farmer with more than 25 years' experience. He is a father of 4 children. He is asking for a loan to buy expensive agricultural materials, such as pesticide, fungicide and larvacide, among others. He is doing this to be able to keep generating this beautiful product, as can be seen in the photo. This will generate happiness, love and all of the feelings that we put into the moment of gifting a flower.

loans.use: to grow more beautiful flowers

loans.name: Basarbu

texts.ru: Басарбу 56 лет, вдова, 5 детей. Все дети взрослые и самостоятельные, они активно помогают по хозяйству. У Басарбу среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1992 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Басарбу, в хозяйстве имеется: 5 дойных коров, 4 теленка, 25 овец, 5 лошадей и 5 жеребят, а также есть поливная земля размером 1,60 ГА, на которой выращивается картофель, клевер, пшеница и кукуруза. Ее сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от хозяйства позволили Басарбу вырастить и обучить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков, часть средств будет потрачено на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Басарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также, в будущем хочет помочь сыну построить большой дом.
texts.en: Basarbu is 56 years old, a widow, and has 5 children. All of her children are grown-up and self-sufficient. They actively help her with her farm. Basarbu has a secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 1992 with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Basarbu's hard work, she currently has 5 milk cows, 4 calves, 25 sheep, 5 horses and 5 colts on her farm. She also has a 1.60 hectare plot of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes, clover, wheat and corn. Her agricultural business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) a month. The earnings from her farm allowed Basarbu to raise and educate her children. For the purpose of the further development of her farm, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 135,000 som (KGS) to buy bull calves. A portion of the loan will be spent on the purchase of sheep. Basarbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to help her son build a large house in the future.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamileth es una mujer preocupada por el bienestar de su familia, es casada con 1 hijo al que  le da el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, esta señora labora  en un centro de salud de la localidad donde vive con 5 años, actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar la vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizara en la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, zinc, perlin, cemento y mano de obra, para la construcción de un cuarto el que le vendrá a dar mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a woman who is preoccupied by the well-being of her family. She is married and has one son to whom she gives the support needed for his development. She works in a health center in her community where she has lived for 5 years.

She currently has the need to make improvements on her house. So she visited Ceprodel to request a loan with which she will buy construction materials like re-bar, zinc sheeting, rafters, cement and pay for labor. She wants to construct a room which will give her better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like re-bar, zinc sheeting, rafters, cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, children, and mother-in-low in North Tajikistan. Farogat began her new business six months ago. She sells men’s clothing. Farogat sells men’s clothing at a local market. She is going to increase working capital of her new business.

Farogat, with this aim, took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got a lot of new information for herself. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy men’s clothing to increase the working capital of the new business. She awaits your mercy. From the profit, she is going to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy men’s clothing to increase the working capital of the new business.

loans.name: Yonasani

texts.en:
Yonasani is a 54-year-old man, married with five children, and living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is in the retail business and obtains additional income from farming. He faces the challenges of customers who fail to pay their debts on time and the lack of enough capital to expand his business. He has a vision of educating his children in addition to a healthy family. 

Yonasani is therefore requesting a loan to buy bread and cooking oil to resell.

loans.use: to buy bread and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a 24-year-old married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells mattresses. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a vibrant location, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of mattresses. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of mattresses.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Dian Marcela es una mujer de 28 años que  tiene  a cargo dos hijos de  cinco y dos años de edad, a los cuales ha tenido que brindar un buen futuro, sacrificando muchas cosas, como no poder estudiar, trabajar más de  ocho horas diarias para poder llevar un buen sustento a la casa; todo esto se debe a que  el padre no se ha hecho responsable  de todo lo que representa el cuidado y amor, ya que para a él primero esta  los amigos y el trago.
Hace 6 meses tuvo que renunciar a su trabajo porque  tuvo un ataque de nervios y fue tan fuerte que perdió el control y cayó en la depresión, los hijos estaban muy sorprendidos y tristes por lo que estaba sucediendo, ya que siempre llevaban en la mente la imagen de que la mamá era una mujer luchadora e incansable.
Ella tuvo que pasar por momentos muy difíciles para poder darse cuenta que era una persona que tenía mucho futuro, que debía salir adelante, es por eso que escogió esta carrera, para poder brindarles un mejor futuro a los hijos y a ella misma.
Ella solicita el convenio de kiva porque en este momento no cuenta con la mejor situación económica ya que ella sola responde por los gastos de la casa y por los gastos que tiene los hijos y sin contar con los gastos que ella necesita en el estudio, con el convenio de kiva tiene la opción de poder pagar un valor más económico y poder terminar satisfactoriamente el semestre.
texts.en:
Diana Marcela, age 28, has two children, ages five and two, under her care.  She has had to provide them with a good future by sacrificing many things like not being able to go to school and working over eight hours a day to bring home good sustenance.  This is all because the children’s father has not been responsible for their care and love.  To him the first things are his friends and drinking.

Six months ago she had to give up her work because she had a nervous breakdown.  It was so severe that she lost control and fell into a depression.  The children were very surprised and sad about what was happening.  This is because they always had the mental image of their mother as a tenacious and tireless woman.

She had to go through some very difficult times in order to be able to realize that she was a person who had a big future and that she needed to get ahead.  That is why she chose this career, in order to be able to provide her children and herself with a better future.

She is requesting a Kiva loan because she is not in the best financial situation right now.  She is solely responsible for the household expenses and her children’s expenses.  She does not have what she needs to cover her educational expenses.  With a Kiva loan she has the option of being able to pay a lesser amount, and she will be able to satisfactorily finish the semester.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She explains that her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past twenty years. She sells fish to town dwellers and her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high costs of purchasing fish, especially during colder months.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to be able to access loans at lower costs to improve her business.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as optimistic.

She operates a retail business, where she cooks and sells food. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a semi-urban area. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of working capital.

She is requesting this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. This would be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional ingredients

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos de 14 años y 8 años de edad. Ana trabaja junto a su esposo en la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor en su vivienda y hacer la instalación de la energía eléctrica dado que por el momento no cuenta con el servicio.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and resides with her life companion and two children, ages 14 and 8. She and her husband have worked in agriculture for a long time.

With the desire to improve her living conditions, Ana decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a corridor in her home and to install electricity since she does not have receive this service at the moment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a corridor and to install electricity.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 41-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He and his wife have six children.

He is in the milk retail business and obtains additional income from the produce trade. His major business challenges include a lack of suitable transportation (ideally, a large van) to move his milk and a lack of capital.

In the future he hopes to be able to meet his family's needs. Moses is requesting a loan to buy a tricycle (a motorcycle with a carrier).

loans.use: to transport his milk more easily by purchasing a tricycle (a motorcycle with a carrier)

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a businesswoman who is very hardworking and enterprising. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Loice is engaged in the agricultural (crop farming) business. She has been in this business for the past two years. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

With the requested loan proceeds, she would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her business. She decided to join Yehu to be able to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as awesome and hardworking.

To earn a living, he operates a transportation business. He transports customers using his motorcycle. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He is requesting this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy fuel and spare parts to service his motorcycle. He hopes that, in the future, he will have more businesses. That is, he would like to use the profits he expects to generate as a result of this loan to open more businesses.

loans.use: to expand and improve his motorcycle transportation business by purchasing fuel and spare parts

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, ha tenido efectos positivos con el uso de los créditos, ya que puede efectuar la compra de la materia prima necesaria, su negocio tiene más clientes, las ventas y ganancias son mejores, las cuales invierte en los gastos de su familia y paga las cuotas de la deuda que adquirió.
Rosa requiere de más capital con el que podrá surtir el inventario con lo más necesario para elaborar la venta de pan, tamales, pastelitos entre otros antojitos, comprara maíz, pollo, harina, verduras, aceite, leña, condimentos, etc., así continuara contando con clientes satisfechos
texts.en:
Rosa experienced positive effects from the use of the loans. She was able to purchase basic necessities and her business has more customers, sales, and better earnings. Rosa invested in her family’s expenses and the payment of the debt of she acquired.

She wants more capital to invest in the necessary inventory for making and selling bread, tamales, and pastries, and other snacks. Rosa will buy corn, chicken, flour, vegetables, oil, firewood, condiments, and other items so that she can continue having satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, flour, vegetables, oil, firewood, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman. She has seven children, five of whom attend school and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Uchi operates a business selling cereals. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Manideepa Self Help Group

texts.en:
Animal husbandry in India is mainly a secondary occupation after agriculture, but in some cases, because of sporadic rainfall, it is the main livelihood. If successful, this can be a highly profitable allied agricultural activity.

Rikta (face circled), 40, of Nandakumarpur, South 24 Praganas, is a hardworking and tenacious lady. She is an active member of Manideepa Self-help Group (SHG) and has been associated with it for the last 10 years. They are helping each other out in periods of distress. Rikta has a family of four composed of her husband, son and daughter-in-law. The couples are involved in different occupations, but the family’s income is not enough to meet their basic requirements.

Currently, Rikta is looking to explore the goat-rearing business, in which they have some prior experience. For this, she is seeking a Kiva loan to buy a goat. She expects to earn 40,000 Indian rupees per year, which can bring some stability to her life and that of her family. Her credit repayment history has been good and she has never defaulted. 

The other member, Sujata, from her SHG is seeking a loan to buy paddy seeds for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy a goat

loans.name: Yuris Massiel

texts.es: Yuris es una joven con entusiasmo de mejorar el nivel de vida, soltera, con vocación de servicio hacia a los demás, trabaja en un centro de salud del municipio donde vive con 5 años de laborar, desempeñándose como auxiliar de enfermería, actualmente necesita mejorar la vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizara en la Compra de zinc, perlin, bloques, cemento, arena, piedrín, hierro y mano de obra, para la construcción de un cuarto  y tener mejores condiciones
texts.en:
Yuris is a young woman who is enthusiastic about improving her standard of living. She is single and devoted to serving others. Yuris works at a health center in the town where she lives. She has been at her job as a nursing assistant for five years.

At the moment, Yuris needs to make improvements to her home. For this reason, she visited CEPRODEL about requesting a loan. She will use the funds to buy zinc, crossbeams, blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron. In addition, she will pay for labor in order to build a room so that she can have better conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is a  Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself to be creative. 

Zablon operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture; he has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber and other carpentry materials. 

His business goal is to open more workshops within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 39-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell; he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food, and to add restaurant furniture. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food and to add restaurant furniture

loans.name: Nelly Faustina

texts.es:
Nelly vive en la ciudad de chincha, es una mujer muy carismática y sobre todo muy trabajadora, por las mañana y tardes trabaja como obrera de campo y por las noches trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas en la plaza de armas de su ciudad; de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar y por el cual se esfuerza mucho para darle una vida digna.

Nelly esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como galletas, chocolates, entre otros y de esta manera poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos; de esta manear podra seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Nelly lives in the city of Chincha. She is a very charistmatic woman, but most of all, she is a very hard worker. In the mornings and afternoons, Nelly works at her job as a field laborer. At night, she manages a small business in which she sells snacks in the main square of her city. This enables her to earn income so that she can get ahead. Most importantly, she does all of this because she has a son who is of school age. Therefore, she tries very hard to provide him a decent life.

Nelly is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will buy merchandise for her business such as cookies, chocolates, and other items. This will enable her to offer a wider variety of products and to improve her earnings. Nelly continues to work and strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of seeing her son pursue a profession and having a larger business.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolates, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ke Nyomo Group

texts.en:
Irene is part of the group called Ke Nyomo, and lives in Teshie. She is married to Joseph, a land guard, and they have one child. 

Irene has been doing commerce in fresh fish for many years. 

With the Kiva loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase fish from the harbor to sell to customer so she can earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a house, to work in farming, and see her children educated.

This is her second ID-Ghana loan. 

The members of the group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the total loan amount of GHS 2,700.

loans.use: To purchase fish from the harbor.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Baara est uniquement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, viandes,  charbon de bois, habits et arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 kg de viandes avec les bouchers   à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail dans le quartier à une clientèle mixte. Madame Maimouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Baara group consists of only monogamous women. They are on average 29 years old with three children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants of meat, charcoal, clothes and peanuts. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Maimouna (second position from left to right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling all kinds of food products. She intends to use her loan to buy 30 kilos of meat from butchers in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted locally to a mixed clientele. 

Mrs. Maimouna hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business. Her goal is to buy a lot for residential use through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy meat

loans.name: Nietaa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nietaa est uniquement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pâtes d’arachides, jus et  mèches. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des pâtes d’arachides de qualité dans tout quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de grains  d’arachides à Bamako qui seront transformés en pâte. 
Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, on trie les meilleurs grains, les grille, les épluches et les Broie au moulin. La pâte ainsi faite est prête à la vente en détails à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes au marché. Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The Nietaa group is composed of women, all living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 37 years old with four children. They all live in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood of Bamako and know each other as neighbors. The group members work as vendors selling peanut paste, juice and braid extensions. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Kadiatou ( the one standing on the far left in the photo) is  known in the entire neighborhood as a vendor of high-quality  peanut paste. She plans to use her loan to buy four bags of peanuts in Bamako, in order to process them into paste. In order to make peanut paste,   the best peanuts are selected, grilled, shelled and then ground them in a mill. The paste that is obtained  in this way is ready for retailing at the market place, mostly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs which will be used to reinvested in her business. Her goal is to maintain this relationship with Soro Yirwaso in order to have access to much larger financing.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a married man; he has three children. He describes himself to be creative.

He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a viable location, and his primary customers are locals. 

Abel will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber and other carpentry materials. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi G14 Group

texts.en:
Elisa is a father of three children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 10 years. 

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer for rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Giseke3 G3 Group

texts.en:
Athanase is 33 years old. He is a group leader. He holds a red file as an identification from other group members. He is married with one child. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with three children, two in school and one is under age. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Emily has operated a shoe selling business for the past two years. She sells from her shoe shop to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of shoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Coop Ngilyi Cyabigegaii G12 Group

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 37. He has five children, ages between 4 months and 14 years old. He has been a rice farmer for the past 20 years. 

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs, and for fertilizer during rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, and to support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Horonya  est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent  toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font  le petit commerce d’habits industriels d’enfants, du charbon de bois  et du jus. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sétou (assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits d’enfants de tous les âges. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 32 complets d’habits d’enfants de tous les âges en gros au grand marché. La revente s’effectue en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sétou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Horonya group consists of married women living with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They are on average 29 years old with four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the Mande district of the Kati circle, and became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship.

Group members are small retail merchants of children's clothing, charcoal and juices. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Setou (seated on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling children's clothing for all ages. She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale 32 full sets of clothes for children of all ages at the great market. Retail sales are conducted in the market and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Setou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, to be fed back into the business, and used to meet the small needs of her children.

loans.use: buy children's clothing

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Amina is in her mid twenties and is single. She has been managing a business selling kerosene candles, commonly known as Koroboi in Tanzania.  She makes these herself using simple materials like bottles. Amina has been in this business for six years and now is able to make a good monthly return. She runs her business from 07 am to 06 pm per working day. 

This will be her third loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous two loans, Amina bought candle making materials and she introduces a good product for her customers. She wishes of make more candles in future when she will be blessed with good working equipment.  Amina has been working hard and managed to receive a profit which she used to pay for her welfare. She has successfully repaid all loans. Amina will use this loan to buy business working materials. 

She will share this loan with her loan group” Paradise”, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business working materials.

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Asha is aged in her late twenties and has got one daughter who is at school. She is single and manages her family by managing a business selling beauty accessories like necklaces, rings etc. She has been in this business for three years now and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy new beauty accessories for her business. She used the previous loan to add to the product range for her business. Asha managed to improve her business and she received a profit, which she used to cover household expenses. She repaid successfully her loan. Asha dreams of expanding her business. 
She will share this loan with her loan group” Mti Mrefu”, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new beauty accessories for her business.

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi G13 Group

texts.en:
Onesphore is 33 years old. He has been in the business for the past eight years. He will use Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilzer and pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Herèmakono sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié,  de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons),  charbon du bois et lait.
