Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchata (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs d’oignon à Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïchata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four women  in the Heremakono group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 30 years old with eight children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the Mande district of the Kati circle. They became acquainted through kinship, friendship, neighborhood ties, and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants of condiments (onions), charcoal and milk. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aichata (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling onions. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 bags of onions in Bamako. Retail sales are made for cash and on credit at the market and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Aichata hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure her children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy onions

loans.name: Kuithum

texts.en:
Kuithum is a married woman with two school going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a business woman who is very hardworking.She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with one child who is underage.

Amina has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
This is Time. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support in her previous loan that greatly improved her living standards.

Besides the clothes selling business,Time operates a charcoal selling business
She is requesting for a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a married mother of one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.
 
Hope has operated an entertainment business selling various movies, music compact disks, and flash disks to passersby and neighbors. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase an additional stock of movies and music disks for her business.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of movies and music disks for her business

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman who has been blessed with six children, two of whom go to school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Biasha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Vinicio Angel

texts.es: Vinicio es un joven de 23 años, vive con su esposa Mariuxi de 21 quien está embarazada. Su domicilio queda ubicado en el Recinto Virgen del Cisne  Vía a El Carmen. Un recinto muy conocido por la producción de yuca y plátano, zona productiva. Vinicio trabaja como electricista, pero en vista de que estos ingresos no le ayudan a la manutención de su familia, decidió emprender en la venta de pescado y mariscos, ahora ya lleva 3 años vendiendo pescado y camarón en recintos aledaños. Vinicio recorre los pueblos en el carro de su padre. Dedica a este negocio los días miércoles y jueves todo el día. Necesita dinero para la compra de una moto para vender sus productos en vehículo propio, es por ello que se acercó a solicitar crédito ya que vecinos del recinto han sido beneficiados. Vinicio está feliz y muy agradecido con Fundación Alternativa y KIVA pudo ayudarle, con este dinero comprará su moto y también marisco para capitalizarse. Luego con estas ganancias desea comprar más mariscos para abrir mercado en la sierra.
texts.en:
Vinicio is a  young man, 23 years old, who  lives with his  21 year old wife Mariuxi, who is pregnant.  Their home is in the settlement of Virgen del Cisne on the way to El Carmen.  This is a productive area, very well known for growing yucca and plantains.

Vinicio works as an electrician, but because his income does not help him enough to support his family, he decided to begin selling fish and shellfish.  Now he has been selling fish and shrimp for three years in nearby settlements.  Vinicio goes through the towns in his father's car.  He works all day at this business every Wednesday and Thursday.  He needs money for purchase of a motorbike in order to sell his products using his own vehicle.  This is why he came to ask for a loan since neighbors in his settlement have benefited from loans.  Vinicio is happy and very grateful that Fundacion Alternativa and KIVA  could help him. With this money he will buy his motorbike and also shrimp to sell advantageously.  Then with these profits he wants to buy more shrimp in order to begin marketing them in the mountains.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and sell his products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of needles, threads, scissors, knives, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps, toothpastes, toothbrushes, books, pens, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to his shops.

loans.name: Kafo Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Kafo sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, du pain, des condiments, du jus et  des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djétenin (debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 90 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djétenin espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Kafo group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 34 years old with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the Mande district of the Kati circle. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants of clothes, bread, condiments, juices and cosmetics. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djetenin (standing at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation in selling pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric) . She intends to use her loan to buy 90 lengths of pagnes wax at the great market. Retail sales are conducted for cash and on credit, at the market and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Djetenin hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure her children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread and other weaving materials in order to weave cloth for sale

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Jesca is a mother of two daughters who are enrolled to school. She is a widow and for twelve months now she has been taking care of her family by managing a small business (kiosk), selling soft drinks and bites. Jesca runs her business at school where she sells to students. She opens her kiosk from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair profit. Despite the small profit she gains, Jesca is always working hard to maximize her profits, and is able to pay her daughter’s school fees and home food expenses.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Jesca's third loan request which she will use to buy the products in high demand for her business. She used the previous loans to buy a fridge to keep soft drinks cold, and she purchased juices and sodas. She successfully paid back all of her previous loans. Jesca received a profit which she used to cover home food expenses and saved a portion of for her future. She dreams of becoming a successful woman. 

Jesca will share this loan with her loan group ”Songa Mbele” which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the products in high demand for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions, pepper, and other items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. Besides her clothes selling business, she operates a kiosk shop. She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar for her kiosk. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar for her kiosk.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para mantenerse constante en los trabajos agrícolas y obtener una mejor producción de maíz y frijol tanto para el consumo familiar como para su comercialización, comprara fertilizantes, semilla, abono, insecticidas, pago de mano de obra, que le servirán para preparar el terreno y luego sembrar.
Con el financiamiento anterior su producción fue mayor dándole ganancias que ha utilizado para cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hijo enfermo.
texts.en:
Maria needs capital in order to be constantly involved in agricultural work and  get a better yield of corn and beans for family consumption as well as for sale.  She will buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, insecticides and will hire labor, which will help her to prepare the soil and then to sow seeds.  

With the previous loan, her production increased, providing  profits Maria has used to pay off her debt as a good creditor and to cover the basic needs of her sick child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, insecticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is married and has three school-going children.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Biasha has operated a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge. With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods like maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cooking oil for the business. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap and popcorn for her business.

loans.name: Kpangmanga-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Muniratu is 30 years old and has five children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women group from Bagurugu in the northern region of Ghana. Muniratu is wearing a white veil and is in 6th place as you count squatting group members from your right as you face their photo. Their group is called ‘Kpangmanga-Bagurugu’ Women Association.
 Muniratu has been in this business with 31 others in the group for the past three years. A new loan of GHȼ 9,300 will support her and hert colleagues to buy 80 bags of shea nuts and pay for fuel to power stoves for the processing of premium shea butter. There are organisations and individuals who will buy the shea butter Kubura processes.
She intends to expand the business venture and thereby increase her income and sustainability. With increased income she will be able to repay the loan, stay in business and also support her children to have a better education and better food to eat.

loans.use: to buy 80 bags of shea nuts and pay for fuel to power stoves for the processing of premium shea butter.

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en:
This group, called Nyonko Do, is made up of nine members. They are into the sale of spare parts, electrical appliances and metal work as well as cereals, bread, fish, tea, cloth, lining and lace. They have applied for a loan total of 3,600 GHS from ID Ghana.

Amina is a 28-year-old married mother of two children living in Teshie. She is the featured borrower of this group. In 2010, Amina started her own business selling spare parts and electrical appliances. Now she has become an expert in this business. Customers can always get different types of spare parts and electrical parts, making her very reliable and effective. 

Amina wants to expand her business. Unfortunately though, she suffers from a lack of business capital. As a result, Amina and her friends are applying for a loan so that they can serve their customers better. She will use her loan to purchase car engine oil, brake fluid, gaskets, tyres, bulbs, wires and switches, to sell to her customers. 

Amina's vision is to expand her business and increase its capital. Also, she hopes to sell her products to the trading stores around the city.

loans.use: to purchase car engine oil, brake fluid, gaskets, tyres, bulbs, wires and switches to sell to her customers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is an artisan who specializes in wool rugs and tapestries. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca yarn and dyes for his designs. David has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "My grandparents and parents were weavers who inherited this art from their predecessors. I essentially learned through observation. Nevertheless I have taken several textile courses. My work focuses on resuscitating our ancestral culture and linking it to the present. I work with my family, and our materials include wool, cotton, and both natural and industrial dyes. For the natural dyes, we cultivate the plants (walnut, tare, molle and alder)." "Many thanks for your support! Every piece we weave is made with great love and dedication for our craft. We pour everything we have into each work in order to achieve the very best result possible." Use the link below to view David's wool rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1857

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca yarn and dyes for his designs

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Cándida se preocupa por la salud de los demás, de profesión auxiliar de enfermería con 26 años de laborar en un centro de salud de la zona donde vive, es casada con 1 hijo a su cargo al que le da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo, actualmente por la época de invierno tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de cemento, zinc, perlin, arena, piedrín, bloques, clavos y mano de obra, lo que le permitirá construir el cuarto que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Cándida looks after the health of others; she is a nurse's assistant by profession with 26 years of working in a health center in the area where she lives. She is married with one child in her care, to whom she gives all of the support for his development. 

Currently, because of the winter season, she has an urgency to renovate her home. Thus she visited CEPRODEL to apply for a loan that she will use to purchase cement, zinc, purline, sand, gravel, cinderblock, nails and labor. This will allow her to build the room that she needs so much and, in this manner, improve the conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, purline, sand, gravel, cinderblock, nails and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread and other weaving materials in order to weave a lot of cloth for sale.

loans.name: Coprorizngiryi Kajinja &kigarama G4 Group

texts.en:
Vianney is 49 years old, and he is a father of five children. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. These farmers need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, Vianney wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Akadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA est responsable du groupe AKADI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgés à 17ans. Deux (02) vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du jus et de l’eau fraiche depuis 03ans .Elle vend aussi des layettes maintenant. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 20paquets de sachets d’eau pour revendre, 04paquets de sachets pour conditionner le jus et 23douzaines de laine pour faire les layettes.
 Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Alizeta is the person responsible for the Akadi group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 17, and two of them attend school.

For the past three years she has been selling juice and fresh water. She also sells layettes now, and gets her supplies from markets in the area.

She wants to buy 20 packs of water bags for resale, four packs of bags for the packaging of juices, and 23 dozen wool skeins to knit baby layettes.

She wants to strengthen her business with her profits, and aims to expand her business and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: buy 20 bags of water for resale, 4 packs of bags for the packaging of juices, and 23 dozen wool skeins to knit baby layettes.

loans.name: Javier Danilo

texts.es: El señor Javier es un campesino dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria hace más de 30 años y con la ayuda de esta ha logrado mantener a su familia constituida por su esposa y tres hijos, ya que como buen campesino su prioridad es su familia. Debido al bajo costo de la leche se ha visto en la necesidad de buscar la manera de duplicar sus recursos y es la razón pro al que necesita un crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras para seguir con su tranquila vida en el campo e incluso con los recursos obtenidos pensar en introducirse en otra actividad agrícola ya se cría de ganado, de pollos o de cerdos pero para esto necesita el éxito de este negocio que es la base de su cartera y con lo que espera seguir por muchos años más hasta dejar un legado muy firme a su descendencia
texts.en:
Javier is a farmer who has been working in agriculture and the care of livestock for more than 30 years.  Helped by this work he has been able to support his family made up by his wife and three children.  As a good man from the country, his priority is his family.   

Because of the low cost of milk Javier finds himself needing to find a way to double his resources.  This is why he needs a loan to buy two milk cows in order to continue his  quiet rural life.  With the resources obtained, Javier is even thinking of starting another agricultural business raising cattle, chicken or pigs.  However for that he needs this business, which is the basis of his income, to succeed.   He hopes to continue with the business many years more till he leaves a  solid legacy for his descendants.

loans.use: to buy two cows with which he can double his milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is in her 60s. She cultivates paddy on her three bighas (acres) of land. The income of INR 3500 from the yield is not enough to support her family. She lives with her son who works as a laborer and a daughter who helps her in paddy cultivation. 

Shephali is a member of Preetilata Self Help Group (SHG) of Sabuj Sangha, a local NGO. She has been a member of this SHG for the past 19 years and has benefited from this involvement through training and employment opportunities provided to the SHG. She hails from Narendrapur village in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal, which is characterized by a lot of agricultural land but poor financial support to help people alleviate poverty.

Shephali is very energetic, enthusiastic and determined to shape her future through sheer hard work and cooperation. Now she motivates and encourages other members on activities to support their families and their children’s education.  

Shephali has taken loans with the SHG eight times in the past and repaid all of them on time.

Shephali will be using the Kiva loan to buy seeds for paddy cultivation. Her work will help her to have better prices both at the time of buying and selling. 

She is very thankful to the NGO for their support, which has been helping her to raise her standard of living, and to the generous investors who stand for her cause.

loans.use: to buy seeds for paddy cultivation

loans.name: Milagro Guadalupe

texts.es:
Milagro, nuevamente solicita un crédito para fortalecer su negocio lo invertirá en la compra de discos, fajas, grasa, un tanque para el agua, azúcar, sal, arroz, bebidas, golosinas, jabón, aceite, etc., con ello tendrá en buenas condiciones el  molino de nixtamal y la tienda estará abastecida lo suficiente con mercadería que sus clientes necesitan.
El capital anterior le ha sido de ayuda para mejorar el inventario de su negocio, los nuevos ingresos son utilizados para cancelar sus compromisos económicos, su familia vive en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Milagro newly applies for a loan to strengthen her business. She will invest it in the purchase of CDs, belts, grease, a tank for water, sugar, salt, rice, drinks, snacks, soap, oil, etc. With this, she will have the corn mill in good condition and the store will be stocked with the sufficient merchandise that her customers need.

The previous capital has been of help for improving the inventory of her store. The new income will be used to pay off her economic obligations. Her family will live in better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy CDs, belts, grease, a tank for water, sugar, salt, rice, drinks, snacks, soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Chetana Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Chetana Self Help Group (SHG) hails from Nandakumarpur village in West Bengal. The SHG works under the aegis of Sabuj Sangha, which provides training to women in rural areas so that they can contribute to the income of their families and improve their living standards.

Jharna (with her hand raised in the photo) has good experience in the decorations business. She lives with her husband, son and daughter. She has passed class IX. Her daughter Bidisha is in class X, while her son Ayan is in class III.

Jharna is helped by her husband in the business. Now she wants to expand her decorating business and have a sustainable income to support her children’s higher education. She is looked at by the other women in the village as a role model and she often motivates them to be a part of this change by being independent. 

With this loan, Jharna wants to buy raw materials and new tools for her decoration business while the other member will use her loan for paddy cultivation.

Jharna dreams of growing her decoration business into a big-scale business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and new tools for her decoration business

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es:
Martha es una emprendedora mujer de campo, dedicada su esposo y a su hijo de 5 años.
Trabaja diariamente en su oficio de ganadera para ganarse el sustento de su familia y poder garantizarle un buen futuro a su hijo.
Se dedica especialmente a la labor de producción y levante de ganado bovino, trabajo que aprendió al lado de su padre; y alterna este oficio con un trabajo en confecciones que tiene por días con el afán de conseguir más ingresos.
Ella desea poder expandir su negocio y por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar algunas cabezas de ganado e incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising woman of the country, dedicated to her husband and her child of 5 years. She works daily in her field of cattle raising to earn sustenance for her family and be able to guarantee a good future for her child. She works specially in the labor of producing and raising bovine cattle, work that she learned alongside her father.

She alternates this work with a job in sewing that she has during the day with the zeal to obtain more income. She wishes to expand her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy some heads of cattle and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy some head of cattle.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a member of “Sagarika” Self-Help Group (SHG). She hails from the village of Nandakumarpur in West Bengal. The village is one of the most remote in the region and lacks basic amenities like pakka houses (made of concrete and mortar), electricity, etc. But the village is rich in spirit and ideas of its women folk who want to be someone in life. This change in attitude was brought by the continuous efforts of Sabuj Sangha, a local NGO supporting the SHG.
 
Anjali, in her 50s, is mother of two children who are both graduates. Her son works in a local nursing home. Her husband and daughter help her with paddy cultivation. This village has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers, making paddy cultivation possible.

Anjali has had previous loans from the NGO and has never defaulted. She has provided a higher education to her children by working day and night in her paddy fields.
 
Anjali will invest this new loan in buying high yield paddy seeds, fertilizes and manure. She also wishes to increase her total cultivatable area.

loans.use: to buy high yield paddy seeds, fertilizes and manure

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna hails from the village of Nandakumarpur in West Bengal. The village is the one of the most remote in the region but is rich in spirit and ideas of its women folk who want to be something in life. This change in attitude has been brought by the continuous efforts of Sabuj Sangha. The village also has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers.

Aparna, in her 30s is a mother of three daughters. Her daughters study in the eighth, seventh and fourth standard. She is successfully running a confectionery shop in the village, which is famous for chocolate flavored biscuits. She is supported in her endeavor by her husband and daughters. She wants to give her daughters the best education. At the same time, she wants to expand her confectionery business, as the income from the current business is too low to fulfill her dreams.
 
Aparna has been associated with the “Sarajibon” Self-Help Group (SHG) for the past 18 years.

Aparna will invest the loan to buy a new variety of materials for her cookies along with a new oven. This investment will increase the number of customers served and increase her earnings, which will help her secure a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of materials for her cookies and a new oven

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is an artisan from Peru who specializes in natural gemstone sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones for his hand-carved pieces.

Cesar has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have worked as a stone carver since 1988. Of my four children, the eldest girl shows the most interest in my art and even assists me. I work with serpentine, rose manganese, calcite, celestite, red jasper, mottramite, chrysocolla, rhodochrosite and quartz. I work in stone because of the beautiful things that can be made with each kind. I like stone's naturalness and purity of color."

"I would like to use this microcredit to purchase gemstones, which are becoming harder to find at a good price. This will allow me to continue working at a good pace in order to keep up with demand. Thanks!"

Use the link below to view Cesar's natural gemstone sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3600

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones for his hand-carved pieces

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, peanuts, charcoal, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like corrugated iron sheets, sand, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Sandra Lucia

texts.es: Sandra es una  joven casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, bisutería y cosméticos por  catalogo,  por pedidos y puerta a puerta, su esposo trabaja en una planta florícola,  tienen una hija de 2 años con la que siempre sale por las calles a entregar los pedidos de ropa y cosméticos a sus clientes, Sandra se dedica unos 4 años a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para luego venderlos, su aspiración es ampliar su negocio para que sus ingresos le permitan terminar sus estudios secundarios que los realiza a distancia o sea asiste solo los días sábados en donde estudia manualidades femeninas y aprende a confeccionar ropa, ella aspira en lo posible asistir a la universidad para obtener un título y encontrar un buen trabajo y así dar un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en: Sandra is a young married woman who sells clothing, jewelry and cosmetics by catalogue on a door-to-door basis.  Her husband works for a flower factory.  They have a two-year-old daughter who always accompanies Sandra when she goes to deliver clothing and cosmetics orders.  She has been in business for four years and will use the loan to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.  Her goal is to broaden her business so she can afford to finish her high school education which she does by distance learning.  She only attends class on Saturdays and studies women's crafts and how to make clothing.  She wants to go on to university and get a degree, find a good job and give her daughter a better future.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana, forma parte de una familia integrada por su esposo, dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, con el fin de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace cinco años que inicio su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de ropa y cosméticos de manera informal por los alrededores de la zona donde vive, trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, lo realiza 4 días por semana, ya cuanta con muchos clientes que prefieren sus productos.
Invertirá en la compra de faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, camisetas, lociones, labiales, cremas corporales, entre otros productos para diversificar su mercadería y así amentar las ventas, teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos.
Su visión es ahorrar para incorporar el destazo de cerdos y así tener un negocio más rentable que le ayuden a mejorar su vivienda y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana has a family comprised of her husband and two children, ages 4 and 1.  In order to help her husband cover household expenses, Ana started selling clothing and cosmetics on an informal basis around the area where she lives.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., four day a week.  She has many loyal customers who prefer her products.

She will buy skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, socks, t-shirts, lotions, lipsticks, body lotions and other products to diversify her merchandise and increase sales so she can improve her income.

She wants to save to start selling pork meat and have a more profitable business so she can renovate her house and continue helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: To buy skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, socks, t-shirts, lotions, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Eufemia Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Eufemia, tiene 37 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  13, 10 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Eufemia desde hace cinco años y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos instalo un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí vende ropa, zapatos, bisuterías, tarjetas, perfumes y obsequios. Trabaja todos los días y así ella se gana algo por el bien de su familia y está al tanto de sus hijos.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque gracias a sus ganancias han podido salir adelante, ahora solicita este nuevo crédito para seguir adelante en su negocio, va a utilizar este crédito para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Every fifteen days, the Tosagua Loan Team meets in the city of Tosagua. It's a dynamic city where most of its residents are in agriculture or raising animals, as it's an area with a lot of vegetation. This is where Eufemia, 37 years old, lives. She's married, and she and her husband have three children, ages 13, 10 and 9. Her children are all in school, and her husband is a farmer. Five years ago Eufemia opened a small retail shop in her home with the help of a loan. There she sells clothing, shoes, jewelry, phone cards, perfumes, and all sorts of gifts. She works every day during the day and is able to earn a little bit to help the family while still being there for her children.  With this loan, she will buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and undergarments. She's been on the Loan Team for ten years and she likes that the loans let her open her business. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and lingerie.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos. El marido es chofer. 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, zapatos, productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta y trabaja  cuatro días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 11  años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que esta es la forma como ella puede financiar su negocio, sus ganancias le sirven para comprar cosas necesarias para el hogar y medicinas para ella y su marido.  Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, sabanas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito.. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, every two weeks the Tosagua communal bank group meets. This area is known for being very dynamic. The majority of inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock because it is a region with much vegetation. This is where María lives. She is 65 years old and married. She has four adult children. María lives with one of her children. Her husband works as a driver. 

María sells clothing, sheets, quilts, shoes, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (women's beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories). She sells her products door-to-door, four days a week. She allows her customers to make purchases on credit and she collects payments weekly. María has been working in this way for over 11 years. 

She is taking out a new loan to finance her business.  Her profits go toward buying necessary household items and medicines for her and her husband.  This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. María was an original member of the communal bank group.  Her dreams are to move forward and to stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ronal Felipe

texts.es:
Ronal tiene 53 años, es padre de 3 niños y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de de alquiler de caballos para arado de campos agrícolas, el trabaja en este negocio hace 20 años y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su familia.

Ronal esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un caballo y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Ronal, 53, is the father of three children and he has a small business renting horses for farm work.  He has been in business for 20 years and has earned a living this way to get ahead and cover household expenses.

Ronal is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he is able to buy the horse and improve his income to continue working and struggling toward his goal which is "To finish building his house".

loans.use: To buy a horse.

loans.name: Dios Proveera 3 Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the group called Dios Proveera 3 ("God Will Provide"). This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, a city formed by the sugar cane industry (the city's main economic activity) and by luxury tourism with high scale resorts. Sofia is one of many women whose long-term partner or other family member depends on work in the sugarcane industry. They live in a Batey, a rural area where most of the sugar cane workers live.

Sofia is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her retail business. She will buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics (like perfume, body lotion, etc.) Her profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She wants to make big sales for Mothers day, which is at the end of May in the Dominican Republic, and continue saving for her goal of having her own house.

She currently makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (shoes, clothes, cosmetics) to sell

loans.name: Srieng

texts.en: Srieng is 57 years old. She is a widow who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable vendor and earns approximately $4 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $850 to purchase a motorbike for carrying her vegetables and for providing transportation services to clients. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and build a toilet.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry vegetables and provide transportation services

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school/college fees for her children

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose tiene 39 años, el se dedica a la cerrajería realiza variedad de armazones de metal a pedido, su cerrajería se encuentra ubicado en la zona 31 de Octubre, el señor José está solicitando este crédito para la compra de oxígeno y bombillas para la realizar mejor su trabajo, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor José es una persona trabajadora tiene el deseos de superación ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite solventar sus gastos, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: José, 39, is a locksmith. He makes a variety of metal frames to order. His workshop is located in the 31 de Octubre area. Jose is asking for a credit to be able to buy oxygen and light bulbs to be able to do his work better. This is his first loan cycle with the institution.  José is a hard-working person who has the desire to improve as this is the only activity that allows him to cover his expenses. He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy oxygen and light bulbs.

loans.name: Luz Alba

texts.es: Luz es una señora casada, tiene 53 años de edad vive con una hija que es soltera y con una nieta de 2 años a la que le cuida mientras la madre de la niña está trabajando, Luz reside en una comunidad donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores ya que esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos un esta comunidad, comenta Luz que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era una niña y que gracias a su experiencia le va muy bien en este negocio, su esposo  se dedica a la agricultura y  ayuda a Luz con el cuidado de los chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia, ella aspira poder sacar adelante a su nieta así como lo hizo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, 53, is married and lives with her daughter who is single and a 2-year-old granddaughter.  She looks after her granddaughter while the girl's mother is working. Luz lives in a community where the majority of the population work in agriculture and the breeding of small animals, as this is the only source of income in the community. 

Luz has been rearing pigs since she was a girl and thanks to her experience she is doing well in this business. Her husband works in agriculture and helps Luz with the care of the pigs. 

They are going to invest the loan in buying more pigs to expand their business to cover the household expenses. 

She hopes to be able to raise her granddaughter as well as she did with her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lilian Carmen

texts.es: La señora Lilian, tiene 42 años,  ella tiene dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 15 años, ella se dedica a la confección de  sabanas,  ella confecciona según pedidos como también entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad de La paz y el alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Lilian va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una máquina de coser ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fechas ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno,  la señora Lilian a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder tener un taller más grande confeccionar en mayor cantidad y entrar al mercado a nivel nacional, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lilian, 42, has two children, aged 6 and 15. She works making bed sheets.  She makes to order and also delivers to different markets in the city of La Paz and El Alto.  

This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She is going to use this loan to buy a sewing machine since she has many orders around this time as the winter season approaches.  She is going to use the profits to continue improving her business. 

Her dream is to have a bigger workshop, drawing in a greater quantity of orders and enter the market at a national level. 

She feels grateful for this opportunity offered to her through the loan system.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Larry

texts.es:
Larry tiene 26 años, trabaja en una pequeña empresa de televisión de su ciudad en el área de producción desde hace un año, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder salir adelante; Larry pudo obtener el empleo ya que el estuvo estudiando la carrera de ingeniería de sonido, sin embrago debido a sus pocos recursos económicos no pudo concluir.

Larry esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda donde habita y solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Larry, 26, has been working in production for a small television company in his city for a year, which gives him enough income to get along.  He got the job because he was studying sound engineering. However, because of his scarce financial resources, he could not complete his studies.

Larry is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to make some improvements to his home and solve some personal expenses. In this way he can improve his standard of living and continue to strive to fulfil his great dream. "To have his own home and have a better job".

loans.use: to improve his home and cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials like corrugated iron sheets, sand, nails, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to secure the lease for the location of her start-up college

loans.name: William

texts.en:
Bill has been helping love flourish through officiating weddings for over 30 years. Starting out by doing wedding ceremonies as a military chaplain, he eventually moved into performing a wide variety of civil, religious and interfaith wedding ceremonies. 

One of the things Bill enjoys most about his job is meeting young couples whose excitement for marriage is contagious to everyone around them and helping them plan beautiful and meaningful wedding ceremonies. He is committed to personalizing his ceremonies to a couple’s unique personalities and takes the time to meet them face-to-face so that he can learn more about them and creatively come up with their dream wedding. 

After performing hundreds of wedding through the years, Bill has finally formalized his officiating services in a company in February of this year. In the past three months alone, Bill has already performed 17 weddings and already has 13 requests for 2015.  

This Kiva loan of $2,000 will help Bill get his business on weddingwire.com, a nationally known wedding website that will connect Bill to new clients and spread information about his services to a larger audience. 

Looking forward, Bill would like to grow to a point where he can open a local office so that he has a space to meet his clients. 

Check out Bill’s website at: http://weddingofficiantceremonies.com/

loans.use: to advertise on weddingwire.com

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a well-known town that is famous for its very large weekly market as well as the colorful traditional outfits that the women of the town wear. It has a long and rich cultural history. In a rural area outside of the town, the new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bendición de Dios” or “Blessing of God” has recently been formed. It is composed of eight enthusiastic women who are anxious to empower themselves and eliminate poverty.

Each Friendship Bridge Trust Bank has a Board of Directors that includes a President, Secretary and Treasurer. In the “Bendición de Dios” Trust Bank, Micaela is the Secretary which is very exciting to her as she wants to develop her leadership skills. Micaela is 20 years old and married when she was 15. She has 3 sons. Because of the economic situation of her family, she was not able to attend school past the 6th grade. Micaela ponders the future of her sons and wants them to have a different life and reap the benefits of a good education. She works hard in her textile business and creates typical handmade blouses called “huipiles”, tablecloths and woven belts. Her textiles are beautiful and carefully made. Micaela is requesting her first loan from Friendship Bridge which she will use to purchase a variety of threads and other materials for her work.

Micaela is also excited to participate in the non-formal educational trainings that a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer offers each month for the Trust Bank. She wants to learn more about business administration, customer service, and budgeting, women’s health and hygiene as well as children’s rights and education. Other topics include self-esteem and nutrition. It is the combination of the loans and the educational component that comprises the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge.

Each of the 8 ladies in the “Bendición de Dios” Trust Bank appreciate the assistance and generosity of Kiva investors. They are committed to paying back their loans fully and on time. The women look forward to sustaining and expanding their small businesses. We look forward to reporting on their progress in the future!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of threads and other materials for her work

loans.name: Enmanuel 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Emmanuel 1 & 2 (Emmanuel). She began with Esperanza, because she wanted to start a business. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Maria makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children.

Maria has run her business for over 10 years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, oranges, mangoes, and other products like meat, rice, bean, flour, sugar and, etc. She is excited to be taking her 19th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and to save for her family’s needs. She says that her most difficult challenge is to progress in her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Elva Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Elva Maria ella se encuentra estudiando Auxiliar De Enfermería 2 semestre, ella trabaja en una estética en el cual labora medio tiempo en la mañana y medio tiempo en la tarde, ella tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y el menor se encuentra en primaria, ella es madre soltera y trabaja para poder brindarle a los hijos una mejor estabilidad económica. 
Ella está estudiando enfermería porque el primer programa que estudio es  estética y a través de este segundo programa se puede especializar y ofrece un  mejor aspecto laboral.
Ella solicita el convenio de kiva porque es la única persona que responde por los gastos del hogar y los gastos que se le presenten en el estudio, con el convenio kiva ella le podría quedar la facilidad de pagos y el dinero que se ahorre lo puede invertir en otros gastos que ella necesite.
texts.en:
Elva Maria is currently studying her second semester as a nursing assistant. She works in a beauty salon; half of the time in the morning and the rest in the afternoon. She has two children, one of them is studying at university and the other child is at primary school. She is a single mother and works to give her children better economic stability. 

She is studying nursing because in the first part of the course she studied aesthetics and now in the second part she can specialize and offer better employability.

She is asking for a loan from Kiva because they are the only people who help her with the household expenses and the education fees. With the Kiva loan system making payments are easier and the money she saves can be invested in other necessary expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's education fees.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is 44 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling food in her community and has been doing this for five years. Koreti has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, rice, soy sauce, peanut oil, frying pan, cooler, onions, foam plates and tin foil. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. Koreti will use her earnings to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice, soy sauce, peanut oil, frying pan, cooler, onions, foam plates and tin foil.

loans.name: María Cesibel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito  Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 3 años, el mayor  estudian en colegio y dos en  escuela. El marido es maestro albañil. 
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su  forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los días ya sea en la mañanas o en las noches ya que a estas horas se le hace más fácil salir a realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior de niños y así aprovechar la temporada que se venden muy bien estas prendas. Lleva 6 años  en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals because it is a place with a lot of vegetation.

This is where María lives. She is 31 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has four children, aged 13, 11, 9 and 3. The oldest is in high school and two are in primary school. Her husband is a master bricklayer. María is a housewife, who in order to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses sells clothing of all types and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door and works every day morning or evening because it's easier for her to make her rounds at those times. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this activity for 6 years and with it she helps her children with their education expenses.

This loan is to buy children's under wear so she can take advantage of the season when these articles sell very well. She has been in the credit group for 6 years and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy children's underwear.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is a 47 years old and a widow with nine children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Emi has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil and baking soda, and a large cooking pot and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Emi will use her earnings to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and baking soda, and a large cooking pot and new oven.

loans.name: Luluama

texts.en: Luluama is 37 years old and has been with her partner for six years. Together, they have three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Luluama has requested a loan to buy a new oven, large frying pan, bag of flour, a bag of sugar and yeast. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. Luluama will use her earnings to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new oven, large frying pan, bag of flour, a bag of sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos es un señor preocupado por el bienestar de su familia, es casado sin hijos a su cargo, este señor trabaja en un colegio de la zona desempeñándose como maestro de educación primaria con 29 años de laborar, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su casa la que está en mal estado, por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento que utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos para  zinc, clavos de 5 pulgadas, alfajillas, zinc liso, reglas, transporte y mano de obra. Y de esa manera  mejorar el techo  de su vivienda el que le protegerá principalmente en esta época de invierno, ya que el objetivo de efectuar esta inversión es por la época misma y no tener perjuicios sino mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is a gentleman who cares about his family. He is married but has no children. He works at a local school. He has been a primary school teacher for twenty-nine years.

His house is in bad shape, so he needs to make some improvements. This is why he visited CEPRODEL and requested a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc sheets, different types of nails, battens and rulers, and to pay for the transport and the labor. He will fix the roof of his house, especially now that the rainy season is coming. His objective with this investment is to avoid further damages and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, different types of nails, battens and rulers, and pay for the transport and labor.

loans.name: Yojana Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito  Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yojana, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  17, 13 Y 11 años, los mayores  estudian en colegio. Su esposo es maestro albañil.
Doña Yojana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta toldos, sabanas, toallas, edredones, entre otras cosas, con este crédito también va a comprar ropa interior de niños ya que en esta temporada es muy buena la venta porque es inicio del año escolar y por lo general los  padres compran estas prendas para sus hijos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y que cobra cada quince u ocho días de acuerdo a como quieran sus clientes. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para Lleva más de 5 años  en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un carro para salir a realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. It is a place known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals because it is an area with a lot of vegetation.  

This is where Yojana lives. She is 33, married and has three children, aged 17, 13 and 11. The oldest ones are in high school. Her husband is a master bricklayer. Yojana is a housewife who in order to earn her own income to help her husband with the household expenses sells bedspreads, sheets, comforters, and more. With this loan, she is also going to buy children's underwear because at this time of year it sells very well because it is the beginning of the school year and in general parents buy clothing for their children. She sells door to door and on credit, collecting every week or however her customer prefer. She has been doing this activity for 5 years and it id going well for her.

She has been in the credit group for more than 5 years and she likes it because with the first loan she started her business that allows her to get ahead to day. Her dream is to have a car to go out and do her rounds.

loans.use: to buy comforters, sheets, towels and underwear.

loans.name: Segundo Ananias

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el se dedica a la agricultura y actualmente tiene su cultivo de cacao, asimismo ha sembrado maíz y también cría animales vacunos, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, asimismo poder poder tener alimentos para su hogar.

Segundo esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, dar mantenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera poder tener una mejor cosecha y poder seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una buena cosecha y su negocio sea mejor cada día”.
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old. He lives in the city of Pucallpa. He works in agriculture and right now he has his cacao crop. He also grows corn and raises cattle in order to have income to get ahead as well as have food for his home. 

Segundo is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to buy fertilizer and do crop maintenance. This way, he will be able to have a better harvest and keep striving to make his big dream come true: to have a good harvest and for his business to be better every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and do crop maintenance.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is a businesswoman from Mangidkid, Plaridel. She is 47 years old, married, and a microfinance member of PMPC. To support her husband's income, she took initiative to begin a piggery business. She labors a lot for her business, but she is thankful that she is able to overcome the odds. For her capital, she has Paglaum MPC as her financing partner. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional piglets to raise. Glory thought of adding more pigs, so she will have more income. In the future, she wants to build concrete pig pens to house her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en: Aotoa is 18 years old, and a single woman with no child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yam, and banana, to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Aotoa has requested a loan to buy chemicals,a weed sprayer, bush knives, an axe, a chainsaw, etc. She joined SPBD this year (2014) to gain access to financial services. With her profits, Aotoa will save for unexpected emergencies and will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for farming

loans.name: Motumotu

texts.en: Motumotu is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, bananas, yams and taro, to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Motumotu has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, etc. She has been a member of SBPD for two years. With her profits, Motumotu hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe.

loans.name: Faatauu

texts.en:
Faatauu is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Faatauu has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, filing, an axe, bush knives, chemicals, etc... 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. 

With her profits, Faatauu hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, filings, an axe, etc...

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya smiles at the thought of sustaining her timber selling activities. She supported her family doing this type of work. At the age of 50, married and with children to feed, Ligaya did not rest comfortably doing nothing. She invested her time and effort running her own business. 

She approached PMPC for her capital needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase a second-hand power saw. 

She want to invest more and be able to earn more. Ligaya wishes to maintain her membership with PMPC so she can enjoy the benefits that the coop offers.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand power saw

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is a 45-year-old married  woman with 10 children. She sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Merita needs a loan to buy a fishing net, goggles, spears, knives, a torch, etc... 

She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Merita has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, goggles, spears, torch, knives, etc.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception has found a way to earn a meager income, in her retail business selling a variety of consumable items. She sells biscuits, candies, toothpaste and other things. At the age of 60, and widowed, she armed herself with courage to raise alone her children. She never gets tired of managing her business.

Recently, she applied for a loan. She will use it to purchase additional inventory, like canned goods, noodles, soap and sugar. Conception wishes to sustain her business and pass on it to her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory, like canned goods, noodles, soap and sugar.

loans.name: Arieta

texts.en: Arieta is 22 years old and is single, with no children. She makes and sells handicrafts to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Arieta has requested a loan to buy Samoan Tapa (barkcloth), cava bowls, elei printed shirts, and coconut carved earrings. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy Samoan Tapa (barkcloth), cava bowls, elei printed shirts, and coconut carved earrings

loans.name: Marebel

texts.en:
Marebel enjoys raising pigs at her own backyard in Mangidkid, Plaridel. At the age of 39, she found comfort supporting her family with her piggery business. 

Marebel signed up her membership with PMPC because she needs capital. 

She wants to purchase bags of animal feed with her new applied for loan. 

Marebel deeply hopes to sustain her business so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: At the age of 27, Ailyn earns a living with her retail business. She sells a variety of items, at her own home in Kauswagan, Plaridel. Ailyn has become a bread winner to her family, despite being single. She signed up for her membership in PMPC, on account of her need of capital. She wants to expand her inventories of sugar, oil, beverages and soap. In the future, Ailyn hopes to maintain her membership with PMPC so she can continually enjoy the benefits that the co-op offers.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, oil, beverages and soap

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old and married. She has three children. She makes and sells handicrafts to earn a living, and she has been doing this for one year. Grace has requested a loan to buy ink, stencils, a roller set, brushes, cava bowls and Samoan bracelets. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ink, stencils, a roller set, brushes, cava bowls and Samoan bracelets

loans.name: Atelina

texts.en:
Atelina is 51 years old and married. She has five children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu. She can sell her crops in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Atelina needs a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a chainsaw, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Atelina will use the profits from her sales to extend her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for farming

loans.name: Eleitino

texts.en:
Eleitino is a 25-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells snacks, cooked noodles and tea in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Eleitino needs a loan to buy twisties, foam cups, soft drinks, noodles and a cash register machine. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her house. 

Eleitino has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy twisties, foam cups, soft drinks, noodles and a cash register machine

loans.name: Falesa

texts.en: Falesa is 31 years old and married. She has four children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling cream buns, pancakes, donuts, custard pies, coconut buns, etc., to sell in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, a frying pan, a gas oven, custard, baking powder, and other items. In the future, Falesa hopes to save her profit for her children's school fees and for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2011, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start up her business making and selling cream buns, pancakes, donuts, custard pies, coconut buns, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 37-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Maria has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves, a crowbar and a shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Maria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves, a crowbar and a shovel

loans.name: Tapuono

texts.en:
Tapuono is a 39-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Tapuono has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a file and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. With her profits, Tapuono hopes to maintain her business standard for the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a file and an axe

loans.name: Angela Sipriana

texts.es:
Doña Ángela es una señora dedicada a la actividad comercial, como es la compra y venta de cerdos, de la cual tiene 6 años de ejercer dicha labor como fuente de ingreso,   es casada sin hijos a su cargo.
Actualmente tiene la necesidad de satisfacer la demanda existente, por tal razón visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la   Compra de Cerdos Medianos, el que le ayudara a incrementar los niveles de venta y lograr mejores condiciones y nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Angela has a business buying and selling pigs. This work has been a source of income for her for six years. Angela is married and has no children.

Angela currently needs to satisfy customers' demands and has come to "Ceprodel" for a loan to buy pigs. This loan will help Angela to increase sales and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sells pigs.

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Sari Wangi Ternak Group is located in Pemuteran village, north Bali. Their place is near a tourism destination. As the villagers, most of their daily life is spent at their garden. Beside becoming farmers, they also raise pigs at home to get more income. The Sari Wangi Ternak succeeded in selling all of their pigs and they were satisfied with the results. With good treatment, all the pigs can grow healthy and be free of disease.

Ni Kadek sold her three pigs to the big buyer. She earns a profit, and the result can support her family needs. She is also setting aside savings for future needs. 

Now she and the Sari Wangi Ternak request a new loan to increase the population of pigs, buy feed, and also renovate the cage. With only five members, the group receives 7,500,000 IDR. 

Ni Kadek receives 1,500,000 and uses it to purchase superior piglets. She’s still with fattened pig plan. 

She has a dream to support her children's education until a high level from the pig business. And now she has started to saving all the profit. Her daily needs will be fulfilled from her husband's income, and also from her garden. 

She said thank you to all Kiva and MUK lenders for giving her and the group an opportunity to develop their life by receiving the loan and training.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is a member of the group called Dios Proveera (God Will Provide) 1. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane industry. She is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business.

Santa plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling groceries products like candies, snacks, gum, cookies and other kinds of these products for her grocery stall. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and help her long-term partner with their family expenses. She is a mother of four children, and she lives together with her and her long-term partner, also her children's father. 

She dreams of having a successful business to provide enough support for her family's needs. Santa thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy candies and other groceries

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana has operated a snack-selling business for the past five years. She sells from the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a food stall at a school canteen.

With the loan, she wants to purchase snack ingredients. She decided to join PMPC to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase snack ingredients

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is from Usocan, Plaridel,  43 years old, and married. Fe supported her family with selling fish in their barangay. 

She signed up her membership with the PMPC for the financial support. 

Recently, she applied a loan to buy more fish to sell.

Fe has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 76, a widow, and a resident of Cartagena Proper, Plaridel. All by herself she is able to sustain her business due to her hard work. She experienced many challenges doing the business, but she treated it as a motivating factor to move forward.

Recently, she took another loan from PMPC to to purchase bags of rice and cases of soft drinks to sell. She wanted to expand her inventories to earn more.

Remedios now smiles at the thought that despite her  age, she is still able to manage the business she started many years ago.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a farmer who plants various crops. She is 52 years old, married, and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel. She has a farming business to earn a living. This is the type of business she enjoys. Merlyn supported her husband, who is her hands-on partner in managing the farm.

She smiles at the thought of maintain her membership with PMPC, especially since she has applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs. 

Merlyn commits herself to fully repay the loan without any record of default. 

She is happy with her newly concreted house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio is 74 years old and comes from Northern Poblacion, Plaridel. He has had a tailoring business for more than three decades. This is how he supported his family, earning a monthly income of approximately PHP 8,000.

Recently, he applied for a loan. He will use it to purchase textiles, buttons and thread. This will be helpful to supply enough inventory to use in his tailoring business, increasing his income. He deeply wishes to maintain his membership with the Paglaum Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, buttons and thread

loans.name: Betty Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ellos vive un nieto que es como su hijo y es mayor de de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
