Doña Betty junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen un local y un carro en el cual entregan a domicilio arroz por quintales y por saquillos desde diez libras en adelante, el recorre los campos vendiendo este producto de consumo masivo y a la vez compra huevos y gallinas criollas las mismas que luego las vende en el centro de la ciudad. Su marido lleva como 50 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual siempre saco adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, gallinas y huevos criollos. Lleva más de 16 años  en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank of the same name meets every fortnight. Tosagua is known for being very dynamic; the majority of people here work in agriculture and raising animals, as there is a lot of vegetation.

And it is here in Tosagua that 66-year-old Betty lives. She is married and has five children, who are now independent adults. Betty has one grandson who lives with her, though he is like a son and is now also an adult. Betty's husband is a businessman.

Alongside her husband, Betty is also a businesswoman. The couple have premises and a car for delivering hundredweights of rice, as well as smaller bags starting from 10 lbs. Betty's husband goes around selling the rice in bulk, while also buying hens and eggs to sell in the city centre. Betty's husband has been doing this work for 50 years and, through it, he has always helped his family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy hens, eggs and rice. Betty has been part of the Tosagua loan group for over 16 years and she likes it because the loans are of great help. Betty's dream is to stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, hens and eggs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
At the age of 59 with eight children to feed, Lilia busies herself selling fish. A hardworking  mother in Danao, she has requested a loan to purchase "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell. Lilia wants to expand her business to neighboring towns and municipalities.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has operated a fruit-selling business for the past four years. She sells from the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a food stall in the future.

With the loan, she wants to buy stock of fruit to sell. She decided to join PMPC to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en las actividades agrícolas junto a sus hijos, comprara fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas y semilla, de esta manera sembrara sin problemas maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le ha permitido tener cosechas libres de plagas, pero el negocio solamente es para subsistir, con las pocas ganancias que ha tenido ha cancelado su deuda.
texts.en:
Juana has decided to take out another loan in order to continue working in farming with her children. She will use this loan to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-diseases treatments, weed-killers and seeds in order to grow corn and beans without any problems.

Juana's previous loan helped her to grow disease-free harvests. The business helps Juana just to survive; with her small profits she had to pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-diseases treatments, weed-killers and seeds.

loans.name: Delmy Emely

texts.es:
Delmy, invirtió el crédito anterior en mercadería para su negocio, con lo que ha mejorado su situación económica, actualmente instalo una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde.
El capital que requiere será utilizado para comprar pollos de un día de nacidos, concentrado, vacunas, huevos, aceite, golosinas, bebidas, pan, fortalecerá la granja y surtirá la tienda con el fin de ofrecer a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Delmy invested her previous loan in merchandise for her business. This helped her to improve her financial situation and she set up a small farm to fatten up chickens.

This loan will be usedto buy one-day-old chickens, feed, vaccines, eggs, oil, sweets, drinks and bread. This will strengthen the farm and stock up her business so as to offer customers the items that they need.

loans.use: to buy one-day-old chickens, feed, vaccines, eggs, oil, sweets, drinks and bread.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, se ha decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito que le ayudara a comprar tela, hilos, botones, broches, zippers y repuestos para la máquina de coser, de esta manera continuara trabajando y mejorando la calidad de sus prendas, con sus ganancias pagara sus cuotas y ofrecerá una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Con la oportunidad que tuvo de invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio Rubidia, cumplió con la demanda de sus clientes en su momento, los ingresos han mejorado y ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubidia has decided to apply for another loan, which will help her to buy material, thread, buttons, broaches, zips, and spare parts for her sewing machine. With this loan, she will continue to work and improve the quality of her products. Rubidia will use her profits to pay off her loans and to offer her family a better quality of life.

Rubidia used her previous loan to meet customer demand. Her income has increased and she has been able to cover household costs.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, buttons, broaches, zips, and spare parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en: Sala is 26 years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods. She has been doing this for five years. She needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of flour, a freezer, a cash box,  etc. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in March of this year, 2014, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of flour, a freezer, a cash box, etc

loans.name: Saiaiga

texts.en:
Saiaiga is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small food stall in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Saiaiga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, coconuts, cooking oil, a large frying pan, and a stove. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Saiaiga has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, coconuts, cooking oil, a large frying pan, and a stove

loans.name: Faamalepe

texts.en:
Faamalepe is a single 22-year-old lady with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Faamalepe needs a loan to buy a spade, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Faamalepe will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to improve her plantation.

loans.use: to buy a spade, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals

loans.name: Rosevonne

texts.en: Rosevonne is a 33-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She runs a small 'Elei' printing shop in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. Rosevonne has requested a loan to buy stencils, fabric paint, brushes, a roller set and cloth to decorate. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy stencils, fabric paint, brushes, a roller set and cloth, for her elei-making

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur, who sells dried fish to earn a living. She is a resident of Disud, Sindangan. She is 44 years old and married, and she is a microfinance member of PMPC. She has maintained her membership with the Cooperative, and she took previous loans that she repaid in a timely manner. With this latest loan of PHP 20,000, Rubie did not miss the chance to invest more in her business. She wants to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell. She hopes that she will repay her loan in a few months, and be able to save some of her income in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a 34-year-old, married woman, and she has three children. She makes and sells meat buns in her community, to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Ruta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, mutton flaps, cooking oil, a bag of salt, and a new stove. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Ruta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, bags of flour, mutton flaps, cooking oil, and a bag of salt

loans.name: Maria Nive

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and married; she has six children. She runs a small plantation, where she grows tomatoes, cabbages, cucumbers, and beans, which she sells in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Maria has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, and a wheelbarrow. She joined SPBD in March this year (2014), to gain access to capital. Maria will save her profits for her children's education, and will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Flor is a member of the group, “El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 y 5” (The Sun Rises for Everyone 4 & 5). She’s married, and she started her business with the first loan she got from Esperanza. Flor and her group are from the city of Hato Mayor, in one of the most rural parts of the country. The area's economy depends mostly on agriculture. The group members are micro-businesspeople, in clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoes, food sales, etc.

Flor is receiving her 17th loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily, and she has made good investments. She is currently selling clothes and running a fruit-and-vegetables stall. She is planning to use the new loan to buy chicken, bananas, potatoes, papayas, and yucca, and also pants, t-shirts, skirts, and other types of clothing.

This associate of Esperanza is a mother of three children, and they live together with her and her long-term partner. She will use profits to save, because she wants to finish building her house. Her favorite pastime is to do business, and her main challenge is to live in a safe home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes and products for her food store

loans.name: Lester Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lester, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Lester es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad, allí los días sábados y domingos vende legumbres, papas, cebollas, tomate, zanahorias y todos tipo de verduras, solo trabaja en este lugar estos días porque es cuando más personas se abastecen de estos productos para toda la semana, pero ella también vende en su casa todos los días, ya son más de 20 años dedicada a esta profesión con la cual salen  adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar legumbres y verduras. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un hijo.
texts.en: Every two weeks the Communal Bank Tosagua meets in the city of Tosagua. This is a place known for being very dynamic, where most of its inhabitants work as farmers and raise animals, being a place full of vegetation. Here is where Lester lives. She is 59 years old, married, but has not been able to have children. Her husband is a farmer. Lester is a hardworking woman, who likes to earn money to help her husband with household expenses. She has a market stall in the city. From there on Saturdays and Sundays she sells vegetables, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots and all types of vegetables. She only works in this place these days because it is when most people stock up with these products for the whole week, but she also sells from her home every day. It has been more than 20 years that she has worked doing this and it helps them move ahead. This loan will be used to buy vegetables and greens. She has already been two loan cycles in the Credit Group, and she likes that the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to have a child.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and greens.

loans.name: Cruz Lourdes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 21, 16 y 14 años, los tres menores estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Cruz con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos por catálogos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella también vende en su casa lugar en el cual tiene unas vitrinas donde exhibe su mercadería, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y  esto lo viene realizando desde hace 15 años.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Tosagua Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. This location is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its residents work in agriculture and raise animals since it is an area with much vegetation.

This is where Cruz lives. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children, ages 22, 21, 16, and 14. The youngest three study in university and high school. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Cruz, with the goal of earning her own income, sells all types of clothing and products from the Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). Her sales method is door-to-door and by orders. She also sells in her home, where she has some display cases where she exhibits her merchandise. She works on credit and charges monthly. 

She loves selling products and has been doing it for the past 15 years. This loan will help her to purchase clothing, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, and lotion. She has been in this credit group for the past 8 years and likes it because the loans allow her to move forward.

Her dreams are to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, and lotion.

loans.name: Felicita Ramona

texts.es: Felicita es una señora emprendedora, además de ser maestra de educación primaria también ejerce un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación como otra fuente de ingreso, actualmente es subdirectora de un núcleo educativo rural con 28 años de laborar para el ministerio de educación de la zona donde vive, soltera sin ningún hijo, esta señora tiene una necesidad de darle mejor seguridad a su vivienda por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro3/8, hierro ¼, piedrín, cemento, arena, clavos, zinc, transporte y mano de obra, para la construcción de verjas y mejorar el porche de su casa el que le vendrá a dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita is an entrepreneurial woman. Aside from teaching elementary school, she also runs a small business in her home as another source of income. She is currently the subdirector of a rural school district. She has worked for the ministry of education for 28 years in the zone where she lives. She is single and does not have children.

She needs to improve the security of her home, so she visited Ceprodel to request a loan, which she will use to purchase construction materials like: 3/8 iron, 1/4 iron, stone, cement, sand, nails, and zinc, and to pay for transportation and laborers. This will be used to build fences and improve her home's porch, which will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 3/8 iron, 1/4 iron, stone, sand, nails, and zinc, and to pay for transportation and laborers.

loans.name: Iupita

texts.en:
Iupita is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small cava plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Iupita has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed-spray, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, shovels, a crowbar and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since this year.  With her profits, Iupita hopes to extend and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed-spray, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, shovels, a crowbar and gloves

loans.name: Peau

texts.en:
Peau is 63 years old a married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Peau has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a file and an ax. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Peau hopes to develop her family's living conditions and also her children's.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a file and an ax.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en:
Ivoga is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Ivoga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sacks of cement, and barbed wire. The remaining amount of the loan will be used to pay for her children's education. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Ivoga hopes to extend and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sacks of cement, and  barbed wire

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Cecilia Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho, y para poder salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 2 años y con ello puede salir adelante y solventar sus gastos.

Nancy esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y  algunos gastos personales y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ventas y poder seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old. She lives in the San Juan de Lurigancho district and started her small clothing sales business two years ago so that she could move forward and pay for her expenses.

Nancy is grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the support they have provided, she has been able to purchase merchandise for her business and pay for personal expenses. This way, she has improved her sales and can continue to work to be able to realize her greatest dream: "to have a larger business".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 46 years old. She is a married mother with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ma. Cecelia has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Ma. Cecelia requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and other personal products.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and other personal products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 54 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 44 years old and married with four children.

Analie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analie has borrowed and repaid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Analie aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from trisikad (motorcycle with sidecar) transportation. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her cafeteria. Elena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more foods to sell in her food stall.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business and buy an additional trisikad (motorcycle with sidecar) unit.

loans.use: to buy more foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Pea

texts.en:
Pea is a 61-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small tailoring business. Pea is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. She will use the loan to buy iron roofing sheets, timber, sacks of cement, nails and a saw. 

Pea joined SPBD in 2002 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing sheets, timber, sacks of cement, nails and a saw

loans.name: Jekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Jekadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes), charbon du bois et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Dibi (femme  debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 paires de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges  au grand marché. La revente se fait au Banconi-Flabougou une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Dibi espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Jekadi are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 37 years of age and four children each, all living in Banconi-Flabougou, a district  in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Banconi-Flabougou market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving plastic shoes (for men or women), charcoal, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Dibi (standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling plastic shoes (for men or women). She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 pairs of plastic shoes for all ages at the big market. Her sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women in Banconi-Flabougou. 

With this loan, Ms. Dibi hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and covering the children’s healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes

loans.name: Yereye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Yereye  est majoritairement composé des femmes  mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies de meilleures qualités, lait et produit cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des friperies de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Yereye is mostly composed of married women living with their husbands and their children in nuclear families. The women average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. The group members have small-scale businesses involving secondhand clothing of the best qualities, milk, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sitan (second from the right in the photo) is known for selling used clothing of the best qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of used clothing in Bamako. At the market and by hawking, her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting the various needs of the children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family. She sells purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and their repair shop. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of drinking water to offer for sale.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of drinking water to offer for sale.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estela has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 54 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, canned goods and other groceries.

Elma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as retail shampoo, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 56 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Eda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eda requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eda has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eda would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 41 years old, married, and has two children.

Leny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending and furniture making.

Leny requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Leny aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is 29 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Madel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Madel requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business. In the future, Madel would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for masonry block, sand, iron, and labor costs.

loans.name: Yusleydy Isabel

texts.es: Yusleydy es madre de un hijo por quien lucha a diario para que no le falte lo necesario en la vida, la alimentación; su actividad comercial es la venta de ropa y un poco de cosméticos por encargo, el mayor  deseo de Yusleydy es ir creciendo poco a poco  alimentando su negocio, mejorando sus ingresos diarios, para poder lograrlo solicita el crédito  para invertir con productos de interés de sus clientes como ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: Yusleydy is the mother of one child who she struggles for daily so that he doesn't go wanting for food and what he needs. Her business is selling clothing and a bit of cosmetics on order. Yusleydy's main goal is to grow little by little expanding her business and improving her daily income. In order to do this she is requesting a loan to buy products of interest to her clients like clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women and buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for bags of rice and maggi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for trays, foam plates, paper plates and food foil.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Amadu.  He is single and has no children.   In 1989, Amadu established his tailoring business. He began his business because he wanted to be independent. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

Amadu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires this loan in order to buy poplin rolls, thread, and stickers. He hopes that this loan will help improve his life as a result of his investment to the business. 

In the future, Amadu plans to get two more machines, wherein he can employ more workers and get young trainees. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for poplin rolls, thread and stickers.

loans.name: Melani A

texts.es: Es originaria del municipio de Waspam, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, todos asisten al colegio. Cuenta con una experiencia de aproximadamente 11 años de ser docente. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera: laminas de zinc, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las acondiciones para vivir de manera segura, digna y apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en: Melani A is a native of the municipality of Waspam. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children all of whom study at High school. She has approximately 11 years of experience as a teacher. With the goal of making improvements to her house which is made of wood and built on stilts she is requesting a loan to buy zinc sheeting, nails, wood and to pay for the cost of labor. Her dream is to have a house that offers a secure and dignified place to live and be able to support the professional development of her children.

loans.use: to buy material to make improvements on her house like zinc sheeting, nails, wood and pay for labor.

loans.name: Somnayalgue Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA est responsable du groupe SOMNAYALGUE. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 21ans. Deux (02) vont à l’école. Elle a 02personne en charge.
 Mme vend de l’atiéké (couscous de manioc) depuis 02ans .Elle vend aussi des layettes maintenant. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 05 sachets de couscous de manioc (atiéké) et 01 carton de poisson.
 Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son restaurant et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. AWA is the official of the group SOMNAYALGUE. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 21. Two go to school. She has two persons to support. 

Ms. AWA has been selling atiéké (cassava couscous) for two years. She also sells baby clothing and accessories now. She gets her supplies from the markets in her sector. 

She wants to purchase 5 bags of atiéké (cassava couscous) and a box of fish. She wants to bolster her business using her profits. Her ambition is to expand her restaurant and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of cassava couscous (atiéké) and a box of fish

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 48 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Замиры среднее образование. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Замира на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки 3 коров и 10 овец. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Замиры имеется 1 теленок, а также есть поливная земля размером 0,85 ГА, на которой выращивается картофель и подсолнухи. Сельскохозяйственная деятельность Замиры приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, часть средств будет потрачено на культивацию земли и подготовку к весенне-полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет построить просторный сарай.
texts.en: Zamira is 48, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. Her spouse and her children help her around the farm. She raises livestock and plants crops, which she started 10 years ago when she purchased 3 cows and 10 sheep. She currently has one calf and 0.85 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and sunflowers and she earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Zamira applied for a loan with the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep and to prepare her land for the spring harvest. She plans to use the profits to invest in her farm and to build a spacious barn.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 49 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Анаркан среднее образование. С 1999 года занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Анаркан имеется 2 дойные коровы. Она реализует молоко и молочную продукцию. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, что приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Anarkan is 49 years old, married and has two children.  Anarkan has a high school education.  From 1999, she has been raising livestock - a business that she started with 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, Anarkan has two milk cows and she sells their milk at the market. Her monthly income is approximately 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her business, Anarkan turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow.  Profits from her business, Anarkan is planning to use for further expansion of her enterprise, which will yield higher earnings for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (mèches) de meilleures qualités et d’habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques et des mèches pour cheveux. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 paquets de mèches à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au Banconi-Flabougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group called Sabougnouma is composed of four married women, mostly living in monogamous households. They have an average age of 32 and two children, on average. They all live in  Banconi-Flabougou, a neighborhood of Bamako, and met through being neighbors. The members of the group have small businesses selling high quality cosmetics (hair extensions) and clothing. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Ami (the lady sitting on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation for selling cosmetic products and hair extensions. She intends to use her loan to buy 25 packs of hair extensions in Bamako. She will resell them by the piece in Banconi-Flabougou to a clientele composed mostly of women. Madame Ami hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal in collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso is to be able to buy a plot of residential land.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children aged thirteen and nine. In 2003, Fatmata established her ladies shoes business. She began her business because she wants to be a woman of substance especially to provide for her well-being and for her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy additional ladies shoes. In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support and wishes you all the best.

loans.use: to pay for ladies shoes.

loans.name: Mamadu

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Mamadu. He is married and has one child aged ten. In 2009, Mamadu established his provision (milk, sugar, eggs and drinks, etc.) business. He began his business because he wants to be independent. His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are all ages. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mamadu requires a new loan in order to buy additional milk, sugar, eggs and drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will add to his stock and he will make more profit. In the future, Mamadu plans to use the proceeds of his loan to educate his child. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for milk, sugar, eggs and drinks.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Osman. He is married and has no children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him. In 2009, Osman established his electrical products business. He began his business because he wants to be independent and to make more profit. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,460,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Osman requires a new loan in order to buy additional phones, televisions and wall fans. He hopes that this loan will add to his stock and he will make more profit. In the future, Osman plans to increase the stock and to make more profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for phones, televisions and wall fans.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Hawa. She is married and has one child, aged thirteen. In 2002, Hawa started a local food stuff business. She sells mainly groundnuts, palm oil and garri). She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Hawa opens her business every day but often closes her business early on Sundays. She earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy groundnuts and palm oil. In the future, Hawa plans to have a store on her own where her food stuff will be kept and give the best education to her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for groundnuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 3 years. In 2011, Mohamed established his plastic slippers business. He began his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more plastic slippers for resale. In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop for more profit. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers of different sizes for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Adama. She is married but has no children.  In 2004, Adama established her glass plate, glass cups, small serving bowls and set dish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to foster the smooth running of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to pay for additional stock. She hopes that this loan will help support her to get more customers and help increase her profit margin. In the future, Adama plans to open another shop and to be a supplier. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for glass plates, glass cups, and small serving bowls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for flasks, dishes, pots, and Coleman stoves.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Isatu. She is single and has two children aged 17 and 14. In 2002, Isatu established her T-shirts, skirts, blouses, and jean trousers business. She began her business because she was faced with many difficulties in life so the only way out was to engage in business. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to pay for additional T-shirts, skirts, blouses and jean trousers. She hopes that this loan will support her to change the looks of her business thereby attracting more customers and realize more profit. In the future, Isatu plans to explore the possibility of adding sandals and slippers for ladies to her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for T-shirts, skirts, blouses and jean trousers.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu is 31 years old. She is single and has one child aged six. In 2000, Abibatu established her drug store (medicine) business. She began her business because she wants to take good care of her child and to meet her personal needs. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy additional medical drugs. In the future, Abibatu plans to improve her pharmacy and educate her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for medical drugs.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is a fifty-three year old Cameroonian.  She is married and has four children, the oldest is thirty-two and doing business, while the youngest is twenty-three and going to university. 

She has been in this business for more than three years which makes her very experienced. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will be use to increase her turn over by fifty percent.

loans.use: to buy rubber shoes in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Ifashe Group

texts.fr:
M. Rose  fait partie du groupe Ifashe et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 39 ans  et est mariée  à Roger, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 15 à 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de bière   depuis  18  ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  bière  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  avoir une capacité de nourrir ses enfants sans difficultés.
texts.en:
M. Rose  is part of the group called Ifashe and lives in Gitega.  She is 39 and married to Roger, a businessman. Together they have six children aged from 15 to 17. She has been selling beer for 18 years. She is on her second loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, she is planning to grow her working capital so that she can buy a large quantity of beer for resale, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, she would like to be able to feed her children without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy a big quantity of beer so as to increase her earnings

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Runa is married and has two young children (one son and one daughter).  She is only 22 years old and lives with her children and husband Akibul, aged 32 years, in a small village Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district in their small kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).  Runa studied till grade 5 but her husband is uneducated and can sign his name only. One of their children (their son) is a student in grade 1.

Runa's husband is a farmer by trade. He has been busy growing a variety of vegetables, mainly potatoes, chillies, beans, etc.  He has great experience in this field.  He works hard from early morning till dusk to provide his family a decent lifestyle, but he can't.  His main challenge is food and also his son's education.  Runa helps her husband in his agricultural work like planting, sowing, and harvesting, while managing her household.  In order to grow more they want to cultivate a profitable crop.  They have chosen bitter gourd for cultivation in their farmland. Bitter gourd is a vegetable which is in great demand, as it is used widely in a tropical country like India.

So Runa has taken a loan from BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs to start the cultivation as early as possible.  She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will be of much help to improve their poor financial condition.

Her dreams are to progress in her business and educate her children well. She will be much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating bitter gourd.

loans.name: Magdalen A

texts.es: Tiene 45 años de edad, casada, con 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 cursan su secundaria. Habita en la comunidad de Bilwas, que se localiza a 45 minutos del área urbana de Waspam. Cuenta con una experiencia de aproximadamente una década de ser docente. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir cocina: láminas de zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las acondiciones para vivir de manera segura y digna.
texts.en:
She is 45 years old and she is married with 5 children, of whom two are grown up and independent, and three are in high school. She lives in the community of Bilwas, which is located about 45 minutes from the urban area of Waspam. She has about a decade’s experience as a teacher. 

She is seeking financing to purchase materials for building a kitchen, such as zinc sheeting and nails; and to cover the cost of labor. Her dream is to have a home that would provide safe and decent living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a kitchen, such as zinc sheeting and nails; and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Zaniab. She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 18 years. In 2011, Zaniab established her plastic utensil business. She began her business when she discovered that her husband was not getting enough income to provide for the basic needs of their family. This business now brings in additional income to provide for most of the needs of Zaniab’s family. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Zaniab requires a loan in order to buy more plastic utensils for her business. In the future, Zaniab plans to improve her business to the point of becoming a wholesaler and to educate her children to university level. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic utensils for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ladies' blouses, trousers, and skirts.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children and 2 additional dependents whom he looks after due to the death of his parents. Denis is honest and hard working.  Denis is a boda-boda rider and an agriculturalist, who majors in Coffee growing and owns about 2 acres of coffee plantations in his region.  

From the income earned from coffee sales and (motocycle taxi) Boda-boda business, he has managed to look after his family and has bought land for his increasing family.  However, Denis’s biggest challenge is pests and diseases which attack his coffee plantation and the low price of coffee in his region hence, leaving him with inadequate income to look after his family.

Denis is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer and pesticides and for enlarging his coffee plantation. 

His dream is to be the largest supplier of coffee in his region.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edalyn

texts.en:
Edalyn is 45 years old and married; she has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs, in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for twenty years, and she earns additional income from general store-keeping.

Edalyn is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Resilyn

texts.en:
Resilyn is 27 years old and married; she has one child. Resilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell at her store, like snack foods, canned goods, other groceries, and school supplies.

Resilyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at her store, like snack foods, canned goods, and school supplies.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from general store-keeping.

Julie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her bakery. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 43 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs, in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years, and she earns additional income from a general store and by fish vending.

Marjorie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
El sonido de la aguja golpeando la tela a mil por hora, era lo primero que escuchaba Yessenia de 36 años, cuando estaba pequeña y su madre trabajaba como costurera. No cabe duda, que al ver a su madre trabajar en la máquina de coser, despertó en ella la curiosidad. Fue entonces cuando un día,  su mamá salió a vender la ropa, entonces ella aprovechó para practicar, habilidad que en 20 años se ha convertido en el sustento económico de ella y sus dos hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad. 
Desde los 15 años, esta madre soltera ha trabajado poco a poco como comerciante, ganando clientes y creando su propio negocio, el cual consiste en un bordado típico. En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo para comprar tela, seda e hilos y así mejorar la calidad. Yessenia, una mujer con grandes deseos de superación, quiere dar a conocer sus productos a través de ferias nacionales e internacionales para poder captar más clientes que puedan reconocer lo que realmente vale este producto, ya que es un arte que no todos pueden hacerlo. Además esta es la única fuente de ingresos para poder brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The sound of the needle hitting the cloth a thousand times an hour was the first thing that Yessenia, 36 years old, heard when she was little and her mother worked as a seamstress. There is no doubt that seeing her mother work on the sewing machine awakened her curiosity. Therefore, one day, she took advantage of her mother going out to sell her clothing to practice, an ability that in 20 years has converted into her and her 18- and 19-year-old children’s economic support. 

Since she was 15 years old, this single mother has worked as a salesperson, little by little gaining customers and creating her own business, which consists of traditional embroidery. Right now she needs a loan to purchase cloth, silk, and thread to improve the quality. Yessenia, a woman with a great desire for self-improvement, wants to make her products known in national and international markets. She wants to be able to gain more customers that can recognize the true value of this product since it is an art form that not all can do. Furthermore, this is the only source of income to be able to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, silk, and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy garri, beni, pepper, and groundnut

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional sets of dishes and expand his stall to accommodate more goods

loans.name: Faluk

texts.en:
Faluk is a 40-year-old married man with 6 children ages: 12, 10, 8, 5, 4, and 2 years. He is a farmer who grows coffee beans on a large scale, usually for sale.

He works 7 days a week and 10 hours per day. He also owns a retail shop in a trading center where he gets an extra income for the family. He usually sells his product to people around the trading center and transports the agricultural products to the city.

He acquired this loan in order to buy pesticides and herbicides for his crops and to also boost his retail business. 

His dreams are to be the leading supplier of coffee around his area of operation. He however faces challenges of unfavorable weather conditions, like too much sunshine which affects his crops.

He is described as an honest and hardworking man. 

He appreciates lenders for the services they offer to the low income earners.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides for his crops and to also boost his retail business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a housewife, aged 38 years, with two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to Baleswar who is 45 years old.  Both completed primary  education.  They live in the small village Moynaguri in Jalpaiguri district.  Their children are students in grade 6 and grade 5.

By occupation, Dipali's husband is a small farmer who grows mainly potatoes, beans and other green vegetables. The income from this agricultural business is too scanty to give a good lifestyle. Due to the inconsistent income from the business,  Dipali decided to cultivate jute in their own farmland.  She has chosen jute to cultivate because nowadays jute is a profitable crop.  She took a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She plans to sell jute fiber at the wholesale market shop to those who sell jute crafts items.

Dipali hopes this will make her successful in achieving more profit and she can also meet the demand of her customers as well.  She also hopes that by fulfilling market demand she can improve her financial conditions with the help of her business profit.

She is a good entrepreneur and is thankful to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers etc. to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
Sonali is 32, married, a housewife and a young mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). She is married to Mintu. aged 33 years.  Sonali has a primary education, while her husband is uneducated and can sign his name only.  They are struggling to provide education to their children who are in grades 2 and 4.  They live in Domohoni in Jalpaiguri district.

Sonali's husband is engaged in a small business selling spices and mustard oils. He started his business five years ago.  He runs the small shop from his home.  He sells different kinds of spices such as cardamom, coriander, turmeric, cumin, pulses  (lentils) and mustard oils which are daily necessities for local people.  He purchases these food items from wholesale shops and sells in his locality.  He has earned the goodwill of his customers for selling good quality spices.  His business is going well and he wants to expand it by purchasing more stocks of spices, pulses and mustard oils to meet his customers' demand.  Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital.

So Sonali has come forward to help her husband.  She has taken a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to purchase more stock  for her husband's business with an aim to grow it. She looks forward to improving his living standards with the profit earned.

She wants to further expand their business to give a secure life to her children and better education as well. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of spices and mustard oil for their existing business.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita is from the small remote village Haspatalpara in Jalpaiguri district.  Her family consists of her husband Bhajan, aged 41 years, and their only son, who is a student in grade 1.  Sangita is 25 years old, a housewife and a bachelor's degree holder, whereas her husband studied up to grade 10. They live in their own brick-built house.

Sangita's husband is engaged in a small business of selling Ayurvedic medicine.  His father was an Ayurvedic doctor, who used to make medicine from different medicinal plants and herbs.  Sangita's husband learnt it from his father.  He also purchases the raw materials of Ayurvedic medicine from the wholesale medicine market.  He prepares the medicine in his house with the assistance of Sangita. They sell these medicines to the local medicine shops.  That is how they earn their livelihood.  With the growing increase in essential goods, they want to expand their business so that they can give financial sustenance to their family.  But they lack the capital.

Sangita has applied for a loan to purchase medicinal plants and herbs. She hopes it will help her to fulfill the local demand and earn more profit through her business.  She hopes to provide better education to her son which is her major priority.  Besides, the business will help her to give a secure life to them all.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for their existing business of making Ayurvedic medicine.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is 27 years old and single.

Renelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, sardines, spices and other groceries.

Renelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Renelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, sardines, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 34 years old and married with four children.

Rosalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Rosalyn has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods and renovate his workplace

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 50 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, diapers and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Margie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Violeta is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in their community.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, school supplies and groceries.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ninfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, school supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Judith works hard to support her family.

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from tailoring. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her fish vending business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 59 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for the family.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martha Jarelly

texts.es:
Desde pequeña, Martha sintió la curiosidad por conocer el funcionamiento de las distintas organizaciones empresariales que existen en el país.  Al concluir  la secundaria  ya tenía definida  la profesión que ejercería en el  futuro. Obtó por la carrera de economía gerencial fue la mejor decisión que ha tomado en toda  su vida.
Martha esta por culminar su licenciatura, sin embargo,  necesita de un pequeño apoyo financiero para poder lograrlo. Ella decidió optar por un préstamo en  el programa Educrédito  de KIVA, con el fin de pagar  los gastos de titulación de su carrera.  Una vez obtenido su diploma,  podrá desarrollar sus habilidades de economista en cualquier empresa  del país.
texts.en:
At an early age, Martha felt curious to know about the functioning of the different business organizations that exist in the country.  Upon completing high school she had already determined what her future profession would be. She opted for the degree in Managerial Economics, and it was the best decision she has ever made in all of her life.

Martha is about to complete her bachelor’s degree, but she needs a little financial support in order to do it.  She decided to seek a loan with Kiva’s education lending program in order to pay for the costs of completing her degree. Once she has obtained her diploma, she will be able to develop her skills as an economist in any corporation in the country.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing her degree.

loans.name: Noelie

texts.fr:
Mme NOELIE est mariée et mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 10ans.  04 vont à l’école.
Elle gère une boutique depuis 21ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 carton de savon, 02bidons d’huile, 01 carton de sucre.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son commerce. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mme Noelie is married and the mother of six children. The oldest is 26 and the youngest 10 years old. Four of them go to school. She has been running a shop for 21 years. 

She buys her merchandise in local marketplaces. She wants to buy one carton of soap, two jerrycans of oil, and one carton of sugar. 

Mme Noelie wants to use her profit to grow her little business. Her ambition is to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy one carton of soap, two jerrycans of oil, and one carton of sugar.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Shanti is a 52-year-old, energetic, enthusiastic and optimistic woman.  She is from the remote village Petkati in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married to Ranjan. Both Shanti and her husband studied up to grade 8. They have only one daughter and she is married.

Shanti's husband is engaged in a small business.  But he is unable to cover the basic needs of his family with his small income.

Shanti decided to help her husband to give a good well-being to their family.  She is an enterprising woman who wants to do a business of selling Ayurvedic medicine (medicine made from medicinal plants and herbs).  She thinks it is a profitable business.  She learned about Ayurvedic Medicine from her father, who was an Ayurvedic doctor.

She is requesting the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase medicines from the medicine wholesalers, and initially start the business from her house.  With the development of the business, she hopes to rent a shop in the local market.  She hopes the loan will enable her to fulfill her dream.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to strengthen the family's economy. She is really grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase Ayurvedic medicines (medicine made from different medicinal herbs) to start a business.

loans.name: Amazone 1 Group

texts.fr: AMAZONE 1 est un  groupement composé de dix neuf personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Mariam Tolidji (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 27 ans est mariée à un certain Joachim. Le couple a deux enfants. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisés mais ils sont tous à la charge du couple. Mariam Tolidji vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Mariam Tolidji vend des chaussures, des colliers et divers produits à son domicile depuis cinq ans. De façon secondaire, Mariam Tolidji vend également des cartes de recharge téléphonique,ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Mariam Tolidji achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Mariam Tolidji et les membres du groupement AMAZONE 1, sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Amazone 1 is a group composed of 19 people who live in the same neighborhood. It's the first time this group has asked for a loan from ALIDé, so as to raise the level of their businesses and better meet the needs of their clientele. 

The representative of the group, Mariam Tolidji (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 27 years old and married to Joachim. The couple have two children who are their dependents; neither is enrolled in school. 

 Mariam Tolidji lives with her husband and children. The various expenses of the household are shared by the couple. In order to do her part, Mariam Tolidji has been selling shoes, necklaces, and various products at her home for five years. Secondarily, she also sells rechargeable telephone cards, businesses which allow her with great difficulty to meet the needs of the family. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. This is the first time that Mariam Tolidji and the other members of the group called Amazone 1 have requested a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy shoes and necklaces.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and married with three children. Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Marina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
